Test.JiraSummary: Verify Experiment Audit Trail Generation for Existing / Imported Experiment - Automated
GxP Files Verify When in Mixed Status - Automated
Test Display progress bar when computing metrics

TestStep.Action: # Open experiment with at least one spike file # Open the metrics module # Select a metric from the list if one is not selected # Change the time window
TestStep.Result: Reprocess button displays

TestStep.Action: Click "Reprocess"
TestStep.Result: OffAxIS should hide the controls and display a progress bar with a message "Calculating Metrics..." above it and "Abort" button below it.

TestStep.Action: Click "Abort" before the reprocessing is complete
TestStep.Result: Clicking "Abort" before the calculation completes should hide the progress and and display controls immediately. "Reporcess" button should be visible.

TestStep.Action: Change the time window Click "Reprocess" Let the calculation complete
TestStep.Result: If calculation is allowed to complete fully (not aborted) OffAxIS should hide the progress bar once it reaches 100% and display the updated plot. "Reprocess" button should not be visible.

Test.JiraSummary: Verify major/minor group assignment functionality

TestStep.Action: Copy the experiment file *CleanExperiment.imx* locally from: trunk\SoftwareTesting\AxIS Z
TestStep.Result: Done. File has been copied.

TestStep.Action: Import the newly copied experiment into AxIS Z File-> Import experiment
TestStep.Result: File has been loaded into the recent experiments sidebar in AxIS Z. .

TestStep.Action: Browse through the Recent Experiments in the AxIS Z sidebar: * Find And Click on the Experiment whose label reads *CleanExperiment* with the date of *20-Aug-2019*
TestStep.Result: Done. The corresponding experiment button becomes blue.

TestStep.Action: Copy the *Basic25.implate* file locally from Trunk\SoftwareTesting\AxIS Z
TestStep.Result: Done. implate file has been copied.

TestStep.Action: Click on the Plate Map Setup Module button Click on the *Well Groups* drop down option and select *Import Platemap*
TestStep.Result: Done. An open Window appears to choose file.

TestStep.Action: Navigate to the specified location where the *Basic25.implate* was saved, select it, and click *Open*.
TestStep.Result: Wells B4-F8 ( A total of 25 wells) have been filled Purple and a group named *"Georgia"* has been created on the left. See Screenshot.

TestStep.Action: Select the Colored wells that appear on the Platemap. And click the *Georgia* well group.
TestStep.Result: The wells stay filled purple but they now have yellow borders. Well Group menu section expands with items to enter in: * Treatment * Amount * Control Type * Base color

TestStep.Action: Change the *Treatment* name to Florida. Press Apply
TestStep.Result: None of the mappings of the selected wells are cleared/changed since only one major group was present before and after the change. Wells stay selected and filled.

TestStep.Action: Change the Control type to *Full Lysis* Press Apply
TestStep.Result: None of the mappings of the selected wells are cleared/changed since only one major group was present before and after the change. Wells stay selected and filled.

TestStep.Action: Change the *Base color* to something different. Press Apply
TestStep.Result: None of the mappings of the selected wells are cleared since there was only one major group present before and after the change. Wells stay selected but the color has been filled with the selected base color that was chosen.

TestStep.Action: Enter *1m* into the *Amount* textbox. Press Apply
TestStep.Result: None of the mappings of the selected wells are cleared/changed since only one major group was present before and after the change. Wells stay selected and filled.

TestStep.Action: Enter *"1m,2m,3m,4m,5m"* into the *Amount* textbox. Press Apply
TestStep.Result: Selected wells remain highlighted yellow. Since there was only *one* major group before the change, and multiple minor groups after: * All the selected wells that were assigned to the group have been cleared. * 5 color swatches along with the auto-assign buttons appear in the well group selection menu.

TestStep.Action: Click the *Left auto-assign* button.
TestStep.Result: Selected wells get automatically filled light to dark from left to right. * The left auto-assign button becomes yellow.

TestStep.Action: Change the amount to *"1m,5m"* Press Apply
TestStep.Result: Selected wells remain highlighted yellow. Since there were multiple minor groups before and after the change: * The middle three well columns become cleared since the amounts no longer exist. * The first and last selected well columns remain filled. * 2 color swatches now appear in the well group selection menu.

TestStep.Action: Change the amount to *"1m"* Press Apply
TestStep.Result: Selected wells remain highlighted yellow. Since there were multiple minor groups before and then was only one minor group after the change. * All of the selected wells have also been cleared.

Test.JiraSummary: v2.2 - AxisZ Debug Console

TestStep.Action: Open AxisZ and connect to a Maestro Z.
TestStep.Result: AxisZ opens. It detects and connects to the Maestro Z.

TestStep.Action: Type *_Ctrl+Alt+D_* . [ENTER]
TestStep.Result: AxisZ debug console opens.

TestStep.Action: Click on the main AxisZ window.
TestStep.Result: The debug console is moved to the background.

TestStep.Action: Type *_Ctrl+Alt+D_* . [ENTER]
TestStep.Result: AxisZ debug console comes to the foreground.

TestStep.Action: Minimize the debug console.
TestStep.Result: Debug console minimizes.

TestStep.Action: Type *_Ctrl+Alt+D_* . [ENTER]
TestStep.Result: AxisZ debug console comes up and moves to the foreground.

TestStep.Action: Click on "Select" and load attached script. NAV-3823.dbg
TestStep.Result: Script is loaded.

TestStep.Action: Click on "Execute".
TestStep.Result: A ScriptStatusDialog pop-up opens up and almost immediately says: *File: [PathofScript]* *Message: Finished*. The following gets printed in the debug console (see screenshot): NAV-3823.dbg> echo I like sandwiches. i like sandwiches. NAV-3823.dbg> echo "They must have cheese." they must have cheese. NAV-3823.dbg> echo I LOVE CHEESE! i love cheese! Script Complete

TestStep.Action: Close the pop-up. Type *_cmdkirk_*. [ENTER]
TestStep.Result: *Success:* is printed.

TestStep.Action: Type *_cmdkirk help_*. [ENTER]
TestStep.Result: A list of terminal commands that can be used with *cmdkirk* is printed out to the debug console. See Screenshot.

TestStep.Action: Type *_cmdspock_*. [ENTER]
TestStep.Result: *Success:* is printed.

TestStep.Action: Type *_cmdspock help_*. [ENTER]
TestStep.Result: A list of terminal commands that can be used with *cmdspock* is printed out to the debug console. See Screenshot.

TestStep.Action: Type *_help gas_* [ENTER]
TestStep.Result: * Gas [-Start (-R)] [Stop (-P)] is printed out to the console showing the terminal commands that can be used with *_Gas_*

TestStep.Action: Type *_help heater_* [ENTER]
TestStep.Result: The following commands are printed out to the console: * Heater [-Start (-R)] * [Stop (-P)] * [-Set (-S) <SetPoint>] * [-Calibrate (-C) <Actual Temp>] * [-CalibrateDoor (-D) <Actual Chamber Temp>] Showing the terminal commands that can be used with *_Heater_*

TestStep.Action: Type *_help_* [ENTER]
TestStep.Result: Lists all available non-hidden commands in the debug window See Screenshot

TestStep.Action: Type *_help sandwhich_* [ENTER]
TestStep.Result: *Parameter Error:* is printed because the command does not exist.

TestStep.Action: Type *_help logenterprisetelemetry_* [ENTER]
TestStep.Result: LogEnterpriseTelemetry [ -Stop (-P)] / [-Start (-R)] <c:/Path/To/Log> [Overwrite] Is printed out to the console showing the commands that can be used for *_logenterprisetelemetry_*

TestStep.Action: Type *_TestErrorMessages_* [ENTER]
TestStep.Result: Three Toast messages appear in the AxIS Z window. * A white "informational" message that reads *"Hello World"* * A orange "warning" message that reads *"This Is a Warning"* * A red "error" message that reads *"Look At This Dynamic Error!"* (Also has animated character at the end of the message) That last character is supposed to cycle through the following characters every half second: | then / then - then then | then back again. After 10 iterations (~25 seconds) it should stop on |

TestStep.Action: Type *_which help_*. [ENTER]
TestStep.Result: The namespace where help is located is printed. *Axion.Core.RemoteAccess.Session.Help* Is printed.

TestStep.Action: Type *_which sandwich_*. [ENTER]
TestStep.Result: *Parameter Error:* is printed because that command does not exist.

TestStep.Action: Type *_echo sandwich_*.
TestStep.Result: *sandwich* is printed out to the debug conlose.

TestStep.Action: Type *_echo "sandwich"_* including the quotation marks. [ENTER]
TestStep.Result: *sandwich* is printed out to the debug console.

Test.JiraSummary: Platemap Treatment Layers in AxIS Z

TestStep.Action: Copy the experiment file *CleanExperiment.imx* locally from: trunk\SoftwareTesting\AxIS Z
TestStep.Result: Done. File has been saved.

TestStep.Action: Import the newly copied experiment into AxIS Z File-> Import experiment
TestStep.Result: File has been loaded into the offline experiments sidebar in AxIS Z.

TestStep.Action: Browse through the Offline Experiments in the AxIS Z sidebar: Find and Click on the Experiment whose label reads: *CleanExperiment* with the date of *20-Aug-2019* Click on the plate map editor.
TestStep.Result: The Plate Map editor appears in AxIS Z. * The Well Groups appear on the left hand side. * The Plate Map appears on the right hand side

TestStep.Action: Copy the *Basic25.Implate* file locally from: trunk\SoftwareTesting\AxIS Z
TestStep.Result: Done. Platemap file has been saved

TestStep.Action: In the Plate Map Module: * Click the *Well Groups* drop down * Select the option to *Import Plate Map* * Import *Basic25.implate* into Axis Z.
TestStep.Result: Done. Well Group is populated with a single Major Group (Georgia) and the Platemap gets 25 wells filled purple. See Screenshot.

TestStep.Action: Click the *Georgia* well group. * Press the *"+"* sign more than 20x
TestStep.Result: * A *"+"* sign is located to the Layers right * Once an Additional Layer was created each Layer has a *"-"* that enables removal. * Each Treatment layer has two Text Boxes *Treatment* & *Amount* * The Well Group menu allows for up to 20 layers in total and will not allow more text boxes to be created.

TestStep.Action: Press the *"-"* signs to close all of the added layers.
TestStep.Result: Done. Each layer gets deleted

TestStep.Action: Remove *"Georgia"* and enter a new treatment name that contains characters, numbers, and special characters. Click Apply.
TestStep.Result: Name is accepted and is shown on the top of the Well Group. No validation error given from string input into the Treatment box. Clicking "Apply" will save the changes to the experiment immediately. * Apply button is no longer visible.

TestStep.Action: Select the colored wells and add 1m,2m,3m,4m,5m to the Amount textbox. Press the Enter key
TestStep.Result: * The selected colored wells become blank, but are still highlighted yellow * 5 color swatches appear along with the Auto-Assign arrows. * Pressing the "Enter" key will save the changes to the experiment immediately. * Apply button is no longer visible.

TestStep.Action: Change the amount to "1,2", 3m,4m,5m,6m Press the enter key.
TestStep.Result: * The 5 color swatches remain and auto-assign arrows are also still enabled. * The quotations escape the comma so *"1,2"* counts as 1 Amount. * AxIS Z does not Crash after inputting a quotation mark. * Pressing the "Enter" key will save the changes to the experiment immediately. * Apply button is no longer visible.

TestStep.Action: Change the Amount to "1,2", 3m,4m,5m,6m,6m
TestStep.Result: * Layer amounts must be unique and cannot be duplicated. * A Duplicate amount in a treatment layer creates a validation error which causes the "Apply" button to become disabled. * The Amount box gets highlighted red and reads "Duplicate Amount" See Screenshot.

TestStep.Action: Change the Amount to "1,2, 3m,4m,5m,6m
TestStep.Result: * A Quote escape is Started but not finished which creates a validation error which causes the "Apply" button to become disabled. * The Amount box gets highlighted red and reads "Unclosed Quote" See Screenshot.

TestStep.Action: Change the Amount box back to 1m,2m,3m,4m,5m And Add another Layer by pressing the "+" button * Give it a treatment name * Press Apply
TestStep.Result: Done. New Layer has been created * The 5 color swatches remain and auto-assign arrows are also still enabled.

TestStep.Action: Change the added layers Amount to 1m,2m,3m.
TestStep.Result: * Multiple treatment layers in a major group with multiple amount creates a validation error. * This also causes the "Apply" button to remain disabled. See Screenshot

TestStep.Action: Change the added layers Amount to 1m.
TestStep.Result: * The layers amount is unique and does not have multiple amounts so it does not create a validation error. * The Apply button is enabled and able to be pressed.

TestStep.Action: Click Apply. Click on the Duplicate Group button (The Double page Icon).
TestStep.Result: * AxIS Z immediately adds a copy a new group with the same layers and name that was previously created and gives the new group a different base color. * The new duplicated group appears underneath the group it was duplicated by.

TestStep.Action: With the duplicated group options still open Click on the Delete Group button (The Trash Can Icon).
TestStep.Result: * AxIS Z immediately removes the group with no confirmation.

TestStep.Action: In the original groups option settings. Change the groups base color to something different than whats selected Press Apply
TestStep.Result: The changed settings of the experiment have been saved The color of the swatches have changed to options of the selected changed color.

TestStep.Action: Click on the Duplicate Group button (The Double page Icon).
TestStep.Result: * AxIS Z immediately adds a copy a new group with the same layers and name that was previously created and gives the new group a different base color. * The new duplicated group appears underneath the group it was duplicated by.

TestStep.Action: Click on one of the 5 "Newly" given color swatches from the duplicated group.
TestStep.Result: The selected wells all get filled.

TestStep.Action: Click on the Delete Group button (The Trash Can Icon).
TestStep.Result: * AxIS Z immediately removes the group with no confirmation. * The selected colored wells have been cleared.

TestStep.Action: With the Group remaining: * Delete the Treatment name of the added layer.
TestStep.Result: Done. Components have been changed. Reset button becomes enabled

TestStep.Action: Click the reset button.
TestStep.Result: AxIS Z reverts the changes to what is currently stored for the experiment. Reset button is no longer visible.

TestStep.Action: With the Group remaining: * Change the Control Type
TestStep.Result: Done. Components have been changed. Reset button becomes enabled

TestStep.Action: Press the escape key.
TestStep.Result: AxIS Z reverts the changes to what is currently stored for the experiment. Reset button is no longer visible.

TestStep.Action: With the Group remaining * Change the Base color to another color
TestStep.Result: Done. Reset button becomes enabled

TestStep.Action: Click the reset button.
TestStep.Result: AxIS Z reverts the changes to what is currently stored for the experiment. Reset button is no longer visible.

Test.JiraSummary: Impedance Configuration Options (Default)

TestStep.Action: Navigate to the Experiment Setup Module. Load an Impedance Plate. Ensure that an Experiment has been started, and if not Select the "Start Experiment" button.
TestStep.Result: AxIS Z either has started a new experiment. The Experiment Start: will be populated with a time showing when the Start button was pressed in a format of MM/DD/YYYY HH:SS AM/PM Analysis Module button appears.

TestStep.Action: Click on the Analysis Module button to navigate to the Analysis plot.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Click the Analysis configuration button.(Button that reads *Impedance*) View the normal and advanced options
TestStep.Result: Analysis Plot Configuration settings open: * Shows impedance being available and selectable * Shows *impedance* highlighted Blue and Name is shown on top of the plot. * The Advanced options has *Impedance Type* and *Frequency* enabled.

TestStep.Action: Click the Barrier Index Label in the configuration settings.
TestStep.Result: Barrier Index is disabled and unable to be selected.

TestStep.Action: Click the Cytolysis Label in the configuration settings.
TestStep.Result: Cytolysis is disabled and unable to be selected.

TestStep.Action: Copy the *Elements.implate* file locally from Trunk\SoftwareTesting\AxIS Z
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Click on the Plate Map Setup Module button Click on the *Well Groups* drop down option and select *Import Platemap*
TestStep.Result: Done. An open Window appears to choose file.

TestStep.Action: Navigate to the specified location where the *Elements.implate* was saved, select it, and click *Open*.
TestStep.Result: Done. Plate map wells have been populated with colors and with 4 groups respectively: * Ice (Blue) * Fire (Red) * Earth (Green) * Magic (Purple)

TestStep.Action: Click the *Ice* Well group * Change the Control Type to *"Media"* * Press the *Apply* button to finalize.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Click on the Analysis Module button to navigate to the Analysis plot. * Click the Analysis configuration button. * View Settings and Advanced Options.

Test.JiraSummary: Verify Live Zoom mode

TestStep.Action: Navigate to the Experiment Setup Module. Load an Impedance Plate. Ensure that an Experiment has been started, and if not Select the *"Measure Baseline"* button.
TestStep.Result: The Experiment Start: will be populated with a time showing when the Start button was pressed in a format of *M/DD/YYYY *H:mm AM/PM Baseline calculation begins . Analysis Modules appear.

TestStep.Action: After baseline is acquired. Click on the Analysis Module button to navigate to the Analysis plot. And Wait a couple of minutes.
TestStep.Result: * The Live Zoom button appears as enabled and is blue * The next impedance reading updates the analysis plot and impedance traces are shown on the graph. * Every minute the plot will update and re-zoom to show all available data. * There is no badge or tooltip on the *Live Zoom* button. See screenshot.

TestStep.Action: Click the *"Live Zoom"* button. Wait a couple of minutes.
TestStep.Result: The Live Zoom functionality becomes de-toggled. * The button loses its blue highlight and becomes clear * New data is still downloaded and is being processed so a blue badge appears on the *Live Zoom* button. * A tool-tip is there on the button as well. * Re-zooming will no longer happen as new data is processed. See Screenshot

TestStep.Action: *Double click* inside the plot.
TestStep.Result: * The Live Zoom button re-enables and is blue. * Plot re-zooms to show all available data. * The plot will auto-zoom anytime new data in processed.(Every minute) * There is no badge or tooltip on the *Live Zoom* button. See Screenshot

TestStep.Action: Select the *Click-drag-and-zoom* tool (magnifying glass) from the plot tool bar. * Use the tool to (rectangle) zoom into somewhere on the plot. * Wait a couple of minutes.
TestStep.Result: The Live Zoom functionality becomes de-toggled. * The button loses its blue highlight and becomes clear * New data is still downloaded and is being processed so a blue badge appears on the *Live Zoom* button. * A tool-tip is there on the button as well. * Re-zooming will no longer happen as new data is processed See Screenshot

TestStep.Action: Click the Reset Plot button (the two arrows in the plot toolbar). Wait a couple of minutes.
TestStep.Result: * The Live Zoom button re-enables and is blue. * Plot re-zooms to show all available data. * The plot will auto-zoom anytime new data in processed. * There is no badge or tooltip on the *Live Zoom* button. See Screenshot

TestStep.Action: Select the *Pan* tool (Hand icon) from the plot tool bar. * Use the tool to Pan around the plot. * Wait a couple of minutes.
TestStep.Result: The Live Zoom functionality becomes de-toggled. * The Pan tool on the Plot toolbar highlights white. * The *Live Zoom* button loses its blue highlight and becomes clear * New data is still downloaded and is being processed so a blue badge appears on the *Live Zoom* button. * A tool-tip is there on the button as well. * Re-zooming will no longer happen as new data is processed

TestStep.Action: Click the Reset Plot button (the two arrows in the plot toolbar). Wait a couple of minutes.
TestStep.Result: * The Live Zoom button re-enables and is blue. * Plot re-zooms to show all available data. * The plot will auto-zoom anytime new data in processed. * Pan tool is still selected. See screenshot

TestStep.Action: Select the *Click-drag-and-zoom* tool (magnifying glass) from the plot tool bar. * Put mouse cursor inside the plot and use the mouse wheel to Zoom in and out of the graph. * Wait a couple of minutes.
TestStep.Result: The Live Zoom functionality becomes de-toggled. * The Click-drag-and-zoom tool is highlighted white. * Plot zooms in and out without auto-zooming as new data is processed. * The button loses its blue highlight and becomes clear * New data is still downloaded and is being processed so a blue badge appears on the *Live Zoom* button. * A tool-tip is there on the button as well. * Re-zooming will no longer happen as new data is processed. See Screenshot.

TestStep.Action: *Double click* inside the plot.
TestStep.Result: * The Live Zoom button re-enables and is blue. * Plot re-zooms to show all available data. * The plot will auto-zoom anytime new data in processed. See Screenshot.

TestStep.Action: Click the Plot Settings tool (Gear Icon) on the plot toolbar. * Modify the X and Y Min/Max values of the plot. * Wait a couple of minutes.
TestStep.Result: The Live Zoom functionality becomes de-toggled. * The button loses its blue highlight and becomes clear. * Plot X and Y dimensions change depending on the values that were input. * New data is still downloaded and is being processed so a blue badge appears on the *Live Zoom* button. * A tool-tip is there on the button as well. * Re-zooming will no longer happen as new data is processed See Screenshot

TestStep.Action: Click the Reset Plot button (the two arrows in the plot toolbar). Wait a couple of minutes.
TestStep.Result: * The Live Zoom button re-enables and is blue. * Plot re-zooms to show all available data. * The plot will auto-zoom anytime new data in processed. * There is no badge or tooltip on the *Live Zoom* button. * Plot resets back to default values before Min/Max values were changed See Screenshot.

TestStep.Action: Click the *"Live Zoom"* button. Wait a couple of minutes.
TestStep.Result: The Live Zoom functionality becomes de-toggled. * The button loses its blue highlight and becomes clear * New data is still downloaded and is being processed so a blue badge appears on the *Live Zoom* button. * There is no tooltip on the button either. * Re-zooming will no longer happen as new data is processed.

TestStep.Action: Click the Experiment Setup module button to navigate to the Experiment Setup Menu. End the experiment * Tools-> Reset Plate
TestStep.Result: Done. The current experiment ends & becomes an offline experiment while a new experiment is set as the Active Experiment. The ended experiment's Last Sample Time: will be populated with a time showing when the experiment got its last sample in the format of MM/DD/YYYY HH:mm AM/PM

TestStep.Action: Click the Door of the Maestro Icon or Press the physical button on the machine and *Eject* the plate.
TestStep.Result: Done. Plate is no longer inside the maestro. The new Experiment is gone and the ended offline experiment is the currently selected one.

TestStep.Action: Click on the Analysis Module button to navigate to the Analysis plot.
TestStep.Result: Done. The Live Zoom button is no longer visible. * No badge remains on the Analysis Configuration button. See screenshot.

TestStep.Result: Done. No treatments/colors are applied to the Plate Map wells. The wells on the plate map to the right are all turned back on and filled grey, and the Well Groups have been populated with: * Target + Effector * Target * Effector * Media * Full Lysis See Screenshot.

TestStep.Result: Done. Column 1-6 are selected and turned off (black). See screenshot.

TestStep.Action: Select *"Load Template"* from the "Well Group" dropdown menu. and choose *"GPCR (Receptor-mediated signaling)"*
TestStep.Result: Done. No treatments/colors are applied to the Plate Map wells. All the wells in the plate map are turned back on and filled grey, and the Well Groups have been repopulated with: * Cells + GPCR Agonist * Cells + DMSO * Cells * Media See Screenshot.

TestStep.Result: No treatments/colors are applied to the Plate Map wells. All the wells in the plate map are turned back on and filled grey, and the Well Groups have been repopulated with: * Cells + Drug * Cells + DMSO * Cells + Detergent * Cells * Media See Screenshot.

TestStep.Action: Select wells A1->D12 and Turn off the wells. Select "Load Template" from the "Well Group" dropdown menu. and choose *"Cell growth (Cell density sweep)"*
TestStep.Result: Done. No treatments/colors are applied to the Plate Map wells. All the wells in the plate map are turned back on and filled grey, and the Well Groups have been repopulated with: * Cells * Media See Screenshot.

TestStep.Action: Click "Well Groups" to open up the Dropdown Menu. And select "Clear Groups" from the dropdown menu.
TestStep.Result: Done. All of the groups that were populated have been deleted. The wells selected on the platemap become deselected and the platemap becomes blank.

TestStep.Action: Click "Well Groups" to open up the Dropdown Menu. Select "Load Template" from the dropdown menu. and choose *"Example Immuno-oncology"*
TestStep.Result: Done. The plate map on the right is populated with differernt colors and the Well Groups have been populated with: * Target + Effector * Target * Effector * Media * Full lysis See Screenshot.

Test.JiraSummary: Axis Z Support Bundle Creation

TestStep.Action: Open AxIS Z with no device connected.

TestStep.Result: There’s an option to create a support bundle for the AxIS Z app with version number.

TestStep.Result: A pop-up comes up with a progress bar. Once it's complete, a button will appear marked 'Open In Explorer'.

TestStep.Action: Click on *Open Explorer...*.
TestStep.Result: File explorer opens with the newly created support bundle selected.

TestStep.Action: Open the support bundle zip file.
TestStep.Result: It contains the following folders: * axis_z_logs * axis_z_settings And files: * DeviceReport.log * SosDump.log

TestStep.Result: File explorer opens with the newly created support bundle selected.

TestStep.Action: Open the support bundle zip file.

Test.JiraSummary: AxisZ Firmware Flashing

TestStep.Action: Reset AxisZ with no device connected.
TestStep.Result: AxisZ opens.

TestStep.Action: Click on *Help* menu item.
TestStep.Result: There is no *Restore Firmware* option.

TestStep.Action: Connect a Maestro Z.
TestStep.Result: Maestro Z is detected by AxisZ.

TestStep.Action: Click on *Help* menu item.
TestStep.Result: *Restore Firmware* option is now available.

TestStep.Action: Disconnect the Maestro Z.
TestStep.Result: The *Restore Firmware* option disappears. AxisZ shows "No Maestro Connected".

TestStep.Action: Reconnect the Maestro Z. Once the Maestro Z is detected, click on *Help -> Restore Firmware*.
TestStep.Result: "Update Firmware Confirmation" pop-up appears. Only the Maestro Z device is listed.

TestStep.Action: _Uncheck_ the box to "Update the firmware on the Maestro Z" if not already unchecked.
TestStep.Result: The *Proceed* button is _disabled_.

TestStep.Action: _Check_ the box to "Update the firmware on the Maestro Z" if not already unchecked.
TestStep.Result: The *Proceed* button is _enabled_.

TestStep.Action: Click the *Cancel* button.
TestStep.Result: "Update Firmware Confirmation" pop-up disappears.

TestStep.Action: Click on *Help -> Restore Firmware*.
TestStep.Result: "Update Firmware Confirmation" pop-up appears.

TestStep.Action: Make sure that "Update the firmware on the Maestro Z" is checked and click *Proceed*.
TestStep.Result: The AxisZ window disappears. "Updating Firmware" pop-up appears with no interactable controls and only showing two progress bars and text. (See screenshot) Once the firmware process completes successfully the Maestro Z will restart. A "Firmware updated successfully" pop-up appears replacing the updating pop-up. (See screenshot)

TestStep.Action: Verify there is no process to cancel the the firmware upgrade process. (No cancel button)
TestStep.Result: Done. If the process is canceled (*or failed*), the page will change to a text display indicating such, and prompting you to close the window.

TestStep.Action: Click the *Close* button on successful operation. _Note: No matter the result, succeed, fail or aborted, a *Close* button will appear._
TestStep.Result: The pop-up closes. The main window will reappear. The device will reboot and get detected by AxisZ.

Test.JiraSummary: v2.1 - Maestro syncs time with AxIS on shutdown to get correct date and timezone

TestStep.Action: If open, close AxIS Navigator and AxisZ. Turn on the Maestro.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Open a command window and type *_arp -a_* <ENTER>. In powershell: arp -a | Select-String 169 will only show you the lines for the 169 addresses.
TestStep.Result: IP addresses are printed. The address starting with *169.254* and of *Type = dynamic* should be the address for kirk. *Note:* Multiple dynamic addresses could show up if connected to multiple maestros via a switch. Take note of all addresses to differentiate later on.

TestStep.Action: Use the device ip from the previous step to SSH into the Maestro.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Enter command *_date_* <ENTER>.
TestStep.Result: It returns the current date & time including the timezone.

TestStep.Action: Type *_tail -f /var/log/kirk.wedding.log_* <ENTER>.
TestStep.Result: kirk.wedding.log is printed with the *correct, current date and time*.

TestStep.Action: Enter command *_Ctrl+C_*. Enter command *_systemctl stop kirk_* <ENTER>.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Enter command *_date -s "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM"_* <ENTER>. where the date is set for at least 2 days into the future.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Enter the command *_hwclock --systohc_* <ENTER>.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Enter command *_date_* <ENTER>.
TestStep.Result: It returns the *date and time you just set in step 7* including timezone.

TestStep.Action: Type *_tail -f /var/log/kirk.wedding.log_* <ENTER>.
TestStep.Result: kirk.wedding.log is printed with the *correct, current date and time*. Not the date and time from step 7.

TestStep.Action: Turn off the M2 then turn it back on again.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: SSH back into the Maestro. Do not open AxIS Navigator. Use *_arp -a_* <ENTER> again to get the device ip if it changed.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Enter command *_date_* <ENTER>.
TestStep.Result: It returns the *future date & time with time zone that was seen in step 7* (plus however long it took to reboot). (Kirk's time setting persists reboot as long as it's not connected to AxIS Navigator or AxisZ.)

TestStep.Action: Type *_tail -f /var/log/kirk.wedding.log_* <ENTER>.
TestStep.Result: kirk.wedding.log is printed with the *future date and time from step 7*.

TestStep.Action: Start AxIS or AxisZ now.
TestStep.Result: Maestro connects to AxIS Navigator or AxisZ.

TestStep.Action: Go back to the SSH window: Enter command *_Ctrl+C_*. Enter command *_date_* <ENTER>.
TestStep.Result: It returns the *future date & time with time zone that was seen in step 7* (plus however long it took to reboot). (Kirk's time setting persists reboot as long as it's not connected to AxIS Navigator or AxisZ.)

TestStep.Action: Type *_tail -f /var/log/kirk.wedding.log_* <ENTER>.
TestStep.Result: kirk.wedding.log is printed with the *future date and time from step 7*.

TestStep.Action: Close AxisZ or Navigator. Turn off the M2 then turn it back on again.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: SSH into the M2 and enter command *_date_* <ENTER>. Do not open AxIS Navigator. Use *_arp -a_* <ENTER> again to get the device ip if it changed.
TestStep.Result: It returns the *current date & time including the timezone*. (AxIS/AxisZ synced the PC's date and time with kirk during the previous launch. The new time requires a kirk reboot in order to take effect.)

TestStep.Action: Type *_tail -f /var/log/kirk.wedding.log_* <ENTER>.
TestStep.Result: kirk.wedding.log is printed with the *correct, current date and time*.

TestStep.Action: With Navigator or AxisZ still closed. Change the time zone in the PC to Pacific.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Enter command *_Ctrl+C_*. Enter command *_date_* <ENTER> in the ssh console.
TestStep.Result: The *_date_* command returns the *old time* including the *old, Eastern* timezone.

TestStep.Action: Type *_tail -f /var/log/kirk.wedding.log_* <ENTER>.
TestStep.Result: kirk.wedding.log is printed with the *old, Eastern time*.

TestStep.Action: Open AxIS or AxisZ. Enter command *_Ctrl+C_*. Enter command *_date_* <ENTER> in the ssh console.
TestStep.Result: The Maestro is detected. The *_date_* command returns the *current time* including the *new, Pacific* timezone. (Time was synced in the SBC linux.)

TestStep.Action: Type *_tail -f /var/log/kirk.wedding.log_* <ENTER>.
TestStep.Result: kirk.wedding.log is *still* printed with the *old, Eastern time*. (Time was not synced in the kirk until reboot.)

TestStep.Action: Turn off the M2 then turn it back on again. SSH back into it. Enter command *_date_* <ENTER> in the ssh console.
TestStep.Result: The *_date_* command returns the *current time* including the *new, Pacific* timezone. (The timezone persisted a reboot.)

TestStep.Action: Type *_tail -f /var/log/kirk.wedding.log_* <ENTER>.
TestStep.Result: kirk.wedding.log is now printed with the *new, Pacific time*. (kirk's time was synced in on reboot.)

TestStep.Action: Fix the timezone and close and re-open AxIS or AxisZ.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Turn off the M2 then turn it back on again. SSH back into it. Enter command *_date_* <ENTER> in the ssh console.
TestStep.Result: The Maestro is detected in AxisZ/Navigator. The *_date_* command returns the current date & time including the *new, correct Eastern* timezone.

TestStep.Action: Type *_tail -f /var/log/kirk.wedding.log_* <ENTER>.
TestStep.Result: kirk.wedding.log is printed with the *new, correct Eastern time*. (kirk's time was synced in on reboot.)

TestStep.Result: AxIS closes and reopens.

TestStep.Result: Done. Settings window appears. The new Network Bursts settings are: * Maximum Inter-Spike Interval = 100 ms * Minimum Number of Spikes = 50 * Minimum Participating Electrodes (%) = 35% Other settings and options are correct and match. See Screenshot

TestStep.Action: Double click the *Statistics Compiler* to Open the Statistic Compiler Settings. Check the settings. compare Settings to make sure default values are correct.
TestStep.Result: Done. Settings window appears. Settings and other options are Correct and Match. See Screenshot

TestStep.Action: Navigate to the *Experiment Setup Properties* and set up to Record: *Spike Detector:* * Spike Counts * Spike lists *Burst Detector:* * Electrode Burst List * Network Burst List *Statistics Compiler:* * Advanced Metrics

TestStep.Result: Done. 5 Files have been created.

TestStep.Result: CSVs match.

Test.JiraSummary: v2.1.0 Req. Diligent - Overwhelmed spike detector in axis does not cause corrupted data in Kirk as we lead up to a TTL

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS Navigator and connect live source.
TestStep.Result: AxIS Navigator resets and restarts. Live Source connected.

TestStep.Action: Double click the live source to open settings. Select Neural: Spikes and turn off the "Median Noise Subtraction by unchecking the box. Click Apply then OK
TestStep.Result: Done. Settings changed. Edit Maestro Settings pop up disappears.

TestStep.Action: Add a spike detector with the following settings: * *Static Threshold Crossing* * Threshold to *200µV* * Coincident Event Removal to: *None* Click OK
TestStep.Result: Done. Settings changed. Spike Detector settings popup closes.

TestStep.Action: Connect a signal plate attached to a Diligent signal generator to the live source. And also connect the Signal generator to your computer. Open the WaveForms application.
TestStep.Result: Done. Analog Discovery 2 Diligent Signal generator is connected. WaveForms Application opens.

TestStep.Action: After Application opens Select *"Wavegen"* from the side tab.
TestStep.Result: Done. Sine Graph shows up on the right side. See Screenshot.

TestStep.Action: Set up the settings to match these: * *Type:* Pulse * *Frequency:* 300Hz * *Amplitude* 1V * *Offset* 0V * *Symmetry:* 2% * *Phase* 0 degrees
TestStep.Result: Done. Square wave Graph shows up on the right side. See attachment.

TestStep.Action: Back in AxIS Navigate to the Experiment Setup Properties and set to record a: * AxIS Raw file * AxIS Spk file
TestStep.Result: Done. Recording environment set.

TestStep.Action: Press play to begin streaming.
TestStep.Result: Done. AxIS begins offset and starts streaming.

TestStep.Action: Navigate back to the WaveForms application and Select *"Enable"* and then press run.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Navigate back to AxIS Navigator. Switch to the Spike plot a find a well where all spikes are being captured cleanly.
TestStep.Result: Under the best of circumstances this will always TTL, but the raw data that is recorded should preserve the correct data with visible, *EVEN* bursts. At no point are there any columns in the Raster Plot that aren't filled from bottom to top. Look at the Attached photos of what's *NOT* supposed to happen.

TestStep.Action: Record for 30 seconds.
TestStep.Result: Done. AxIS SPK and Raw files have been created.

TestStep.Action: Load the AxIS raw file that was just recorded back into AxIS. And Copy and paste the Spike detector that is connected to the live source to it.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Select the File for Playback. Navigate to the Spike plot and to the same well you viewed live and press play.
TestStep.Result: The Raw data that was recorded shows the correct data by showing visible even bursts. See attachment.

Test.JiraSummary: Navigator-launcher.log only gets created when errors occur

TestStep.Action: Go to the settings folder in C:\Users\[User]\AppData\Roaming\Axion BioSystems\AxIS Navigator.
TestStep.Result: If navigator-launcher.log exists, delete it.

TestStep.Action: Launch Navigator. Close Navigator. Go to the settings folder.
TestStep.Result: navigator-launcher.log does not exist.

TestStep.Action: Open the latest Application-0.settings file and delete some random characters/lines to force a startup error. Save and close the file.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Launch Navigator. Go back to the settings folder.
TestStep.Result: navigator-launcher.log exists.

TestStep.Action: Open navigator-launcher.log.
TestStep.Result: There is an error detailing that Axion.Navigator.Launcher.App could not load the applications settings file. There is NOT a SemaphoreFullException error in the log.

Test.JiraSummary: Impedance Database Temporary Retrieval Via Support Bundle

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS Navigator and connect to M2/Maestro Z.
TestStep.Result: AxIS closes and restarts, M2/Maestro Z is connected.

TestStep.Action: Open Debug console *(Ctrl-Alt-D)* *Warning: Use this command with caution, It cannot differentiate fake Impedance files from real ones.* Enter the command *cmdkirk deleteimpedancedatabases* into the console in order to delete all impedance data from Maestro Z.
TestStep.Result: Success. The impedance files database should have been deleted.

TestStep.Action: Take a support Bundle in Axis. *Help-> Create Support Bundle.*
TestStep.Result: Support Bundle has been created.

TestStep.Action: Open the support bundle.
TestStep.Result: Verify that a folder named *impedance_data* exists and has no contents inside.

TestStep.Action: Load/Dock an Impedance plate into the Maestro Z. Take Note of the Barcode.
TestStep.Result: Plate is loaded.

TestStep.Action: Open the debug console, and run the command: *cmdkirk createdbfileforloadedplate*
TestStep.Result: Success. Database files should have been created. Will confirm in later steps.

TestStep.Action: Take a support Bundle in Axis. *Help-> Create Support Bundle.*
TestStep.Result: Support Bundle has been created.

TestStep.Action: Open the support bundle.
TestStep.Result: Verify that a folder named *impedance_data* exists.

TestStep.Action: Open the *impedance_data* folder.
TestStep.Result: It contains a folder called *PlateBarcode* where 'PlateBarcode' matches the barcode of the plate loaded.

TestStep.Action: Open the *PlateBarcode* folder.
TestStep.Result: It contains a file called *PlateBarcode.db* where 'PlateBarcode' matches the barcode of the plate loaded.

TestStep.Result: 20190227_600629D_CDI_CM2_ChronicPacingTest_IMPbefore_1Hz(000).raw is copied

TestStep.Result: Done.

Test.JiraSummary: Support Bundle contains journal log entries for the last 2 boots

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS Navigator connected to an M2.

Test.JiraSummary: v2.0.1 Debug commands for turning on / off individual hearts

TestStep.Action: Attach a Maestro 2 to AxIS and reset.
TestStep.Result: AxIS Navigator resets and M2 connects.

TestStep.Action: Detect the type of Maestro. Help -> About
TestStep.Result: Maestro Pro/Edge.

TestStep.Action: Verify correct number of artichokes for Maestro type. Check debug console -> Artichokes -> View Status.
TestStep.Result: 6 for Edge. 12 for Pro. No error pop-ups about "x out of 768 channels are offline"

TestStep.Action: Turn on devmode. devmode true
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Change plate type to: * Artichoke 6 if Edge. (Smart Plate Edge) * Artichoke 12 if Pro. (Smart Plate Pro)
TestStep.Result: Plate type has changed.

TestStep.Action: Turn off Heart 0 on Pogo board 0. (heart 0000 off).
TestStep.Result: Success.

TestStep.Action: Play AxIS Navigator.
TestStep.Result: BioCore 1 and BioCore 2 have flat signals.

TestStep.Action: Check the power level. Type `open window powermanagement` in debug console.
TestStep.Result: IsOn is False for Heart 0 (VDD and VSS).

TestStep.Action: Turn off Heart 2 on Pogo board 0. (heart 0002 off).
TestStep.Result: BioCore 5 and BioCore 6 have flat signals.

TestStep.Action: Check the power level in the power management window.
TestStep.Result: IsOn is False for Heart 2 (VDD and VSS).

TestStep.Action: If a Maestro Pro is connected, turn off Heart 2 on Pogo board 1. (heart 0102 off).
TestStep.Result: Biocore 11 and Biocore 12 have flat signals.

TestStep.Action: Check the power level in the power management window.
TestStep.Result: IsOn is False for Heart 5 (VDD and VSS).

TestStep.Action: Run self test and check artichoke heart status. Self-Test -> View Results... -> Run Full Diagnostics.
TestStep.Result: Diagnostics say: Heart Boards: Fail 00, 02 (and 05 for Pro) Powered = False Artichoke chips: 2 of 6 for Edge or 7 of 12 for Pro are online.

TestStep.Action: Close the Self-Test window and Click on Artichokes: -> View Status.
TestStep.Result: Artichoke chips: 2 of 6 for Edge or 7 of 12 for Pro are online.

TestStep.Action: Reboot Maestro. Close and reopen Artichoke Status window after Maestro comes back online. Artichokes: -> View Status.
TestStep.Result: They are all online. (Online = True)

TestStep.Action: Check the power level. Type `open window powermanagement` in debug console.
TestStep.Result: IsOn is False for Hearts (VDD and VSS).

TestStep.Action: Open the self test and check artichoke heart status. Self-Test -> View Results...
TestStep.Result: Diagnostics say: Heart Boards: Pass

TestStep.Action: Run self test again and check artichoke heart status. Click on Run Full Diagnostics.
TestStep.Result: Diagnostics say: Heart Boards: Pass

Test.JiraSummary: v2.0.2 Artichoke sine wave test command "AchkSineTest"

TestStep.Action: Connect a Maestro PRO to AxIS and open up the debug console.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Enter command "devmode true", then in the main window select Smart Plate Pro as the active plate type.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Switch to the Continuous Plot and zoom to 5 mV/Div and 2 ms/Div.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Set the analog mode to "Cardiac: Standard" and hit play.
TestStep.Result: Offset correction finishes, and AxIS is plotting.

TestStep.Action: Enter "AchkSineTest -v 10" into the debug console.
TestStep.Result: The continuous plot shows a sine wave measuring at approximately 3000 mV RMS. The amplitude looks to be 10 mV peak-to-peak. Bad channels will have a squished wave, or the sine wave will not be steady. Do not fail the test if you see this, this command is to help identify bad channels.

TestStep.Result: File added.

TestStep.Action: Right click the file and add a neural offline spontaneous configuration. Configuration-> Neural Offline-> Spontaneous
TestStep.Result: Done. Three nodes added. * Spike Detector * Statistics Compiler * Burst Detector

TestStep.Action: Click play and Navigate to the Activity Map.

Test.JiraSummary: Verify contractility carrier signal elimination during pacing

TestStep.Action: Connect M2 and reset AxIS Navigator.
TestStep.Result: AxIS opens. M2 connects.

TestStep.Action: Load a CytoView MEA 24 plate or change plate type to a CytoView MEA 24.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Switch to "Cardiac Contractility" analog mode.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Add Stimulation Inspector node to live source and change the Pre-Tag and Post-Tag durations to 20ms.
TestStep.Result: Stimulation Inspector is added to the steam tree.

TestStep.Action: Click Play.
TestStep.Result: AxIS streams. Offset correction begins.

TestStep.Action: Switch to the Spike Plots.
TestStep.Result: Tag is seen in each electrode but no signal.

TestStep.Action: When offset correction completes open the debug console and execute "runstimulationfile heather-stim.xml" (xml file attached)
TestStep.Result: Signals are now seen.

TestStep.Action: Set zoom level to 2 mV/Div and look at the waveforms that are not flat (not electrodes 12 or 13).
TestStep.Result: You should *NOT* see a 25-ms carrier around the central peak. No noisy-looking oscillating signal on both sides of the peaks. See screenshots.

TestStep.Action: Go to debug console and enter "forcevoltageplotting true".
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Go back to the Continuous plot and set zoom levels to 500 uV/Div and 200 ms/Div. Pause streaming.
TestStep.Result: You should *NOT* see a 25-ms carrier around the central peak. No noisy-looking oscillating signal on both sides of the peaks. See screenshots.

Test.JiraSummary: v2.0.1 Running cardiac analysis on a whole plate compared to an individual well results in the same data for that well

TestStep.Action: Copy locally and load trunk\SoftwareTesting\RAW Files\Cardiac from Apps\20180130_4008-10_Ncardia_Cor4U_DIV8_Dofetilide30minPostDose_LEAP_Classic_EStim+_MEA48(000).raw.
TestStep.Result: Loaded.

TestStep.Action: Attach a Cardiac Offline -> Field Potentials configuration.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Set up file segment starting from 150 seconds for 60 seconds.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Set up the analysis to NOT use only the stable beats (Unchecked the box in the Statistics compiler).
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Run the analysis for all wells and save it to a csv as whole_plate(000).csv.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Open the plate map editor and turn off all wells but A2.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Perform another analysis and save as A2(000).csv.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Compare the well analysis for A2.
TestStep.Result: The A2 well analysis will be the same in both. Same amount channel beats.

TestStep.Action: Compared the synchronized beats for well A2.
TestStep.Result: They are the same in both CSV files.

TestStep.Action: Compare the source date for well A2.
TestStep.Result: Source data is identical.

Test.JiraSummary: v2.0.1 Stimulating during & after LEAP stepping does not crash the Maestro

TestStep.Action: Reboot Maestro and reset AxIS Navigator.
TestStep.Result: Both reboot/reset.

TestStep.Action: Connect a Maestro to AxIS. Set the analog mode to Cardiac LEAP.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Set up a valid triggered (one time only) stimulation. Navigate to the continuous plot.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Press play and immediately press the Trigger button.
TestStep.Result: Unable to press the "Trigger button" while offset is finishing. There is no change in the continuous waveform, the stimulation did not occur.

TestStep.Action: Wait until the 30 second mark, then try to press the trigger button again.
TestStep.Result: Same thing happens. Trigger button is unable to be pressed until offset is complete. The Offset continues and continuous waveform continue to update. The stimulation did not occur.

TestStep.Action: Wait until the 95 second mark (Or offset to finish). Then try to Press the trigger button a third time.
TestStep.Result: This time, the stimulation _does_ occur, The trigger button is green and able to be pressed, and you can see the activity in the continuous waveform plot.

TestStep.Action: Continue playing for 30 seconds.
TestStep.Result: AxIS doesn't crash, and the maestro does not reboot.

TestStep.Action: Stop AxIS.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Setup a short LEAP in the debug console. {noformat}devmode true leapduration 10 devmode false{noformat} Then start induction.
TestStep.Result: The trigger button is disabled as long as LEAP induction is happening.

TestStep.Action: Press the Trigger button 90s or less after LEAP is done.
TestStep.Result: No yellow warning message. No Navigator crash. AxIS stimulates.

Test.JiraSummary: v2.1.0 Verify Nancy secure password

TestStep.Action: Connect a live source to AxIS Navigator and turn on.

TestStep.Action: Open the debug console and get the Device IP.

TestStep.Action: Use babun, cygwin, putty or command prompt to SSH to root@device_ip. *password*: St1m.ly

TestStep.Action: Type "ls"
TestStep.Result: axion_nginx.conf appears in the window.

TestStep.Result: A script appears in the window that contains the Port number needed to log into Nancy. *Look where it reads* location /kirk/ proxy_pass http://localhost:NANCYPORTNUMBER//kirk/ *NOTE* the port number may be different See Screenshot

TestStep.Result: You are back to the $ prompt.

TestStep.Action: Type ssh -L NANCYPORTNUMBER:localhost:NANCYPORTNUMBER root@kirk.IP.address and then press enter Enter Password again (if necessary): St1m.ly
TestStep.Result: The command line accepts the command and afterwards takes a few seconds to refresh in order to input another command.

TestStep.Action: In an internet browser, go to http://localhost:NANCYPORTNUMBER/_Nancy.
TestStep.Result: NancyFX webpage loads.

TestStep.Action: Enter the password: St1m.ly
TestStep.Result: It doesn't work.

TestStep.Action: Enter the password from the Google sheet mentioned above in the test description.
TestStep.Result: Password is accepted. Nancy Dashboard is displayed.

TestStep.Action: Close the web browser and console windows.
TestStep.Result: Done.

Test.JiraSummary: v2.1 Error disconnecting/reconnecting Lumos & Maestro with firmware dialog open

TestStep.Action: Open AxIS and connect / turn on Lumos as well as a Maestro.
TestStep.Result: Lumos & maestro connect.

TestStep.Action: Click Help --> Restore Firmware.
TestStep.Result: Restore Firmware Confirmation dialog opens.

TestStep.Action: If the update checkbox is not already checked, Click the checkbox to update the firmware for the *"Lumos"* Before clicking *"Proceed"* unplug Lumos.
TestStep.Result: AxIS should not crash, but should instead disable upgrade checkbox and change description to "Unavailable (connection lost)"

TestStep.Action: Reconnect the Lumos.
TestStep.Result: Lumos is detected (and it's checkbox is re-enabled. coming soon)

TestStep.Action: Turn off the Lumos.
TestStep.Result: AxIS should not crash, but should instead disable upgrade checkbox and change description to "Unavailable (connection lost)"

TestStep.Action: Turn on the Lumos.
TestStep.Result: Lumos is detected (and it's checkbox is re-enabled. coming soon)

TestStep.Action: Click Help --> Restore Firmware.
TestStep.Result: Restore Firmware Confirmation dialog opens.

TestStep.Action: If the update checkbox is not already checked, Click the checkbox to update the firmware for the *"Maestro"* Before clicking *"Proceed"* Unplug the Maestro.
TestStep.Result: AxIS should not crash, but should instead disable upgrade checkbox and change description to "Unavailable (connection lost)"

TestStep.Action: Reconnect the Maestro.
TestStep.Result: Maestro is detected (and it's checkbox is re-enabled. coming soon)

TestStep.Action: Turn off the Maestro.
TestStep.Result: AxIS should not crash, but should instead disable upgrade checkbox and change description to "Unavailable (connection lost)"

TestStep.Action: Turn on Maestro.
TestStep.Result: Maestro is detected (and it's checkbox is re-enabled. coming soon)

Test.JiraSummary: Artifact Eliminator blanks Contractility signals in stimulating and non-stimulating wells

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS.
TestStep.Result: AxIS closes and reopens.

TestStep.Action: Copy locally and add 20190320_112_CDI_CM2_DIV16_Baseline_18Kv50K_Contractility_1Hz_CytoView_MEA96-Rows_ACEG_Paced.raw to Axis. trunk\SoftwareTesting\RAW Files\Contractility\20190320_112_CDI_CM2_DIV16_Baseline_18Kv50K_Contractility_1Hz_CytoView_MEA96-Rows_ACEG_Paced.raw
TestStep.Result: Done. File Added.

TestStep.Action: Right click the file and add a *Contractility Paced* configuration to it. Cardiac Offline -> Contractility Paced configuration.
TestStep.Result: Done. Three nodes added: * Artifact Eliminator * Cardiac Beat Detector * Statistic Compiler Also the Activity Map and the Cardiac Beat Plot appear on the bottom toolbar.

TestStep.Action: Double click the file in the Stream tree to open settings and set the file to Loop Playback. Press Apply then OK
TestStep.Result: Done. Check mark in the box indicating that the Loop playback has been set. Settings disappear.

TestStep.Action: Navigate to the Cardiac Beat plot. Then Press Play.
TestStep.Result: Done. AxIS begins Playing file. Beat Amplitudes are shown.

TestStep.Action: Navigate Through and Observe Wells in: * A * C * E * G
TestStep.Result: Electrode in 12 and 22 in all these wells *DON'T* detect beats. Because those electrodes are stimulated and blanked. And the bubble plots are missing for those electrodes and there are two corresponding "holes" in the conduction plot.

TestStep.Action: Navigate Through and Observe Wells in: * B * D * F * H
TestStep.Result: Electrode in 12 and 22 in all these wells *DO* detect beats. Because those electrodes are not stimulated. And the bubble plots for those electrodes are there.

TestStep.Action: Navigate to the Continuous Plot.
TestStep.Result: Done. File Continues to play. Their are no RMS values because this is a Contractility file.

TestStep.Action: Navigate Through and Observe Wells in: * A * C * E * G
TestStep.Result: Electrodes in 12 and 22 in all these wells show a flatlining Artifact Eliminator signal. Because those electrodes are stimulated and blanked. The AE signals in the non-stimulated electrodes show a flat line were the raw signals show a spike. This is were those signals are blanked

TestStep.Action: Navigate Through and Observe Wells in: * B * D * F * H
TestStep.Result: Electrodes in 12 and 22 in all these wells show a flat AE signal were raw signals show a spike. Because all electrodes in non-stimulated wells are also blanked.

Test.JiraSummary: v2.0.1 Beat Plot shows Peak-to-Peak Amplitude in Contractility Mode.

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS.
TestStep.Result: AxIS closes and reopens.

TestStep.Action: Copy locally and load a Contractility file into AxIS. (\trunk\SoftwareTesting\RAW Files\Contractility\30-second_Contractility.raw)
TestStep.Result: Done. File loaded and set to Play/Rec.

TestStep.Action: Right click the file and add a Cardiac: Contractility configuration to it. Configurations-> Contractility
TestStep.Result: Done. Two nodes added Cardiac Beat Detector-> Statistic Compiler Activity Map and Cardiac Beat Plots are added to the Bottom Toolbar.

TestStep.Action: Click on the Cardiac Beat Plot.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Press Play. And then Press Pause when there are Beats present on the Continuous and Cardiac Beat Plot.
TestStep.Result: File will begin showing data In Axis and populate the Plots with different amplitude peaks. See Screenshot.

TestStep.Action: Right click on one of the electrode waveforms and deselect "Averaged Beats"
TestStep.Result: Check mark is removed.

TestStep.Action: Right click on one of the electrode waveforms and select "Copy Electrode Waveform"
TestStep.Result: Done. Waveform has been copied.

TestStep.Action: Open up a new Excel spreadsheet.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Right click on cell A1 and choose the "Paste Special" option.
TestStep.Result: Done. Paste Special window appears.

TestStep.Action: Choose the Unicode option.
TestStep.Result: Done. Waveform Values appear.

TestStep.Action: Select another empty cell and type "=MIN(B2:BX)" where X is the last row with pasted values.
TestStep.Result: Done. Calculates the Min.

TestStep.Action: Select another empty cell and type "=MAX(B2:BX)" where X is the last row with pasted values.
TestStep.Result: Done. Calculates the Max.

TestStep.Action: Select another empty cell and Subtract the value from MAX from the value of MIN.
TestStep.Result: Done. After the value is calculated the number (rounded possibly) should correspond with the (blue) number in the chosen electrode waveform on the Cardiac beat plot.

Test.JiraSummary: Raster plot does clear on TTL Panic

TestStep.Action: Reset Axis and connect to live source.
TestStep.Result: AxIS closes and reopens. Live source is connected.

TestStep.Action: Right click the live source and add a Neural Spontaneous configuration to it. Configuration->Neural Real-Time->Spontaneous
TestStep.Result: Done Two Nodes Added: * Spike Detector * Burst Detector

TestStep.Action: Double click the Spike detector to open the settings. Change the Threshold to 3 to force *TTL* Press Apply then OK
TestStep.Result: Done. Settings have been changed and the Spike Detector now reads *3 x STD* in the stream tree. The settings close

TestStep.Action: Navigate to the Spike plot and Press Play.
TestStep.Result: Done. AxIS Begins to stream.

TestStep.Action: Wait for AxIS to TTL (took about 15s)
TestStep.Result: When is starts to TTL (Spike and Burst detector become slightly greyed out): * the Raster plot stops updating but keeps the existing marks.

TestStep.Action: Wait for Axis to exit TTL. (Time can range on this)
TestStep.Result: The AxIS exits TTL (Spike and Burst detector return back to the normal color): * The Raster plot then resumes to process spikes and also resumes to plot on the map.

Test.JiraSummary: (New) Force Voltage Plotting context menu option

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS Navigator connected to a live source.

TestStep.Result: Contractility signal is plotted again in the original color. No RMS values are plotted.

TestStep.Result: Voltage data is plotted in gray. RMS values are plotted.

TestStep.Action: Reopen AxIS. Navigate to the continuous plot and Press Play.
TestStep.Result: Contractility plots as normal (green) with no RMS values. The voltage data is not plotted.

Test.JiraSummary: v 2.0.2 RunStimulationFile does not error when running files consecutively

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS Navigator with a Maestro connected. Begin streaming.
TestStep.Result: You can see continuous waveforms.

TestStep.Action: Navigate to Stim Studio and create a one-time stimulation with the monophasic stimulation node. Edit the stimulus duration to 3 seconds.
TestStep.Result: Trigger button is now enabled.

TestStep.Action: Open the debug console, and enter "savestimulationfile c:\users<current user>\desktop\test316.xml"
TestStep.Result: A new file test316.xml appears on your desktop.

TestStep.Action: Now enter "runstimulationfile c:\users<current user>\desktop\test316.xml"
TestStep.Result: You can see the stimulation's effects in the waveforms. There are no error messages in AxIS or in the debug console, nor are there messages about the stimulation starting late.

TestStep.Action: Again enter "runstimulationfile c:\users\<current user>\desktop\test316.xml"
TestStep.Result: Same thing, same effects. There are no error messages in AxIS or in the debug console, nor are there messages about the stimulation starting late.

TestStep.Action: Open test316.xml and modify dacvoltage to equal 900 mV. Save.
TestStep.Result: The file is modified.

TestStep.Action: Again enter "runstimulationfile c:\users<current user>\desktop\test316.xml"
TestStep.Result: The stimulation is visible in the waveforms, and the waveforms max out higher than before. There are no error messages in AxIS or in the debug console, nor are there messages about the stimulation starting late.

Test.JiraSummary: v2.1.0 User Interaction / Indication of Calibration via GUI

TestStep.Action: Connect a Maestro to AxIS.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Double click the Maestro in the stream tree.
TestStep.Result: Settings menu pops up. If the Maestro is already calibrated then there is a calibration date under the analog modes, otherwise there is only the analog mode data present. Take note of the date, if there is one.

TestStep.Action: Open the debug console and enter the command "open window calibration"
TestStep.Result: The "Calibration Window" window pops up.

TestStep.Action: Copy M2_Fake_Calibration_6_Modes.csv from trunk\SoftwareTesting\Calibration Files
TestStep.Result: The file is on the local computer.

TestStep.Action: In the calibration window, click the "Import…" button to the right of "RMS Offsets" and select the file you just copied.
TestStep.Result: "Debug console reads: * Calibrations successfully imported for 6 analog modes: NeuralSpikes, FieldPotentials, CardiacStandard, CardiacBroadband, CradiacLEAP, CardiacContractility * Exporting previous calibration data to C:\Users\[user]\AppData\Roaming\Axion BioSystems\Backup_calibration_data.csv * Calibrations successfully exported to C:\Users\[user]\AppData\Roaming\Axion BioSystems\Backup_calibration_data.csv." * Sent Calibration Data to device. Response from device: OK - OK

TestStep.Action: Close the Maestro settings panel and open it back up again.
TestStep.Result: There is a new calibration date set to when you applied the new calibration file.

TestStep.Action: With the Maestro settings panel still open, turn off the Maestro, then boot it back up.
TestStep.Result: Maestro connects to AxIS. No AxIS Navigator crash.

TestStep.Action: Open the Maestro settings panel.
TestStep.Result: The calibration date is the same as before the reboot.

TestStep.Action: Calibrate using the same file as before.
TestStep.Result: You get the same debug console messages.

TestStep.Action: Close the Maestro settings panel and open it back up again.
TestStep.Result: The new calibration date from the previous step (step 9) is listed.

TestStep.Action: In the Calibration window, click "Clear"
TestStep.Result: "You see the following debug console messages: * Exporting previous calibration data to C:\Users\[user]\AppData\Roaming\Axion BioSystems\Backup_calibration_data.csv * Calibrations successfully exported to C:\Users\[user]\AppData\Roaming\Axion BioSystems\Backup_calibration_data.csv. * Sent Calibration Data to device. Response from device: OK - OK"

TestStep.Action: Close the Maestro settings panel and open it back up again.
TestStep.Result: There is no calibration data present in the Maestro Settings panel

TestStep.Action: Turn the Maestro off.
TestStep.Result: It is off.

TestStep.Action: In the Calibration Window, click the Import button.
TestStep.Result: "No Neuroface found. Cannot import RMS calibration."

TestStep.Action: Turn on the Maestro 2 and push the Import button within a few seconds.
TestStep.Result: "No Neuroface found. Cannot import RMS calibration."

TestStep.Action: Wait for the Maestro to connect. Click the Import button.
TestStep.Result: File open/load dialog opens up.

TestStep.Action: Click Open without selecting a file.
TestStep.Result: Nothing happens.

TestStep.Action: Click Cancel without selecting a file.
TestStep.Result: Dialog closes.

TestStep.Action: Click the Import button.
TestStep.Result: File open/load dialog opens up.

TestStep.Action: Select a non-calibration csv and click OK.
TestStep.Result: Calibration not allowed.

TestStep.Action: Click the Active Plate dropdown, and select Classic MEA 48 plate type.
TestStep.Result: Plate type changed.

TestStep.Action: Click the Import button.
TestStep.Result: File open/load dialog opens up.

TestStep.Action: Select the calibration csv and click OK.
TestStep.Result: Maestro goes through the calibration process successfully.

TestStep.Action: Click the Export button.
TestStep.Result: File save dialog opens up.

TestStep.Action: Choose a name and save location and click OK.
TestStep.Result: Calibration file is saved.

TestStep.Action: Compare the original and the exported calibration files using BeyondCompare giving them a 2% relative numeric tolerance.
TestStep.Result: They are "identical".

TestStep.Action: Cycle power on the M2.
TestStep.Result: Maestro restarts.

TestStep.Action: Click the Active Plate dropdown, and select Classic MEA 48 plate type.
TestStep.Result: Plate type changed.

TestStep.Action: Click the Export button again and save a new calibration csv.
TestStep.Result: New file is saved.

TestStep.Action: Compare the latest exported csv to the original using BeyondCompare giving them a 2% relative numeric tolerance.
TestStep.Result: They are "identical".

TestStep.Action: Directly compare the two exported CSVs.
TestStep.Result: They are truly identical.

Test.JiraSummary: v2.1.0 Req. Function Generator - Analog mode frequency response

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS and Connect M2.
TestStep.Result: AxIS closes and reopens. Live source is connected

TestStep.Action: Load signal plate attached to Diligent signal generator into M2.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Double click the live source to open Maestro Acquisition settings.
TestStep.Result: Maestro Settings window appears.

TestStep.Action: Disable Median referencing/subtraction for Neural: Spikes Click Click "Apply" then and click play.
TestStep.Result: Done. AxIS begins streaming. Offset begins and ends.

TestStep.Action: Open Waveforms Application. On the left panel click *"Wavegen"*
TestStep.Result: Done. New Workspace appears with Sine wave showing on the graph to the right.

TestStep.Action: +Channel Setup (Neural Spikes):+ Click the dropdown that reads *Simple* and switch to Sweep mode. * Type: Sine wave * Frequency: 200 Hz * Amplitude: 1 V * Offset: 0 Vdc * Symmetry: 50% * Phase: 0 degrees * Sweep to 3khz in 10s
TestStep.Result: Done. Channel has been set.

TestStep.Action: *In WaveForms* click Run. *In AxIS* Navigate to the Continuous Plot and Change the: * Voltage scale to 500μV/Div * Time scale to 500μs/Div
TestStep.Result: A sine wave is seen increasing in frequency over 10 seconds over the range of the analog mode. (~333us to 5ms per sine wave cycle - change zoom to verify) There is no sharp cutoff or flatlining at either end. The amplitude stays mostly consistent within the visible range. It will decrease over time mirroring the shape of the LPF frequency response curve, but it should be close to constant at this zoom level.

TestStep.Action: *In AxIS*, change the: * Time scale to 2s/Div
TestStep.Result: You can see the entire sweep. There is tapering of the amplitude over the 10 seconds for technical reasons.

TestStep.Action: *Navigate back to the WaveForms Application* Press Stop
TestStep.Result: *In AxIS*, the continuous plot returns to a typical noisy signal.

TestStep.Action: +Channel Setup (Neural: Field Potentials):+ Click the dropdown that reads *Simple* and switch to Sweep mode. * Type: Sine wave * Frequency: 1 Hz * Amplitude: 1 V * Offset: 0 Vdc * Symmetry: 50% * Phase: 0 degrees * Sweep to 2khz in 10s
TestStep.Result: Done. Channel has been set.

TestStep.Action: Using the acquisition settings click *Neural: Field Potentials* and click apply.
TestStep.Result: Offset begins and ends. Signal stabilizes over time.

TestStep.Action: *In WaveForms* click Run. *In AxIS* Change the: * Voltage scale to 500μV/Div * Time scale to 1ms/Div
TestStep.Result: A sine wave is seen increasing in frequency over 10 seconds over the range of the analog mode. (500us to 1s per sine wave cycle - change zoom to verify) There is no sharp cutoff or flatlining at either end. The amplitude stays mostly consistent.

TestStep.Action: *In AxIS*, change the: * Time scale to 2s/Div
TestStep.Result: You can see the entire sweep. There is tapering of the amplitude over the 10 seconds for technical reasons.

TestStep.Action: *Navigate back to the WaveForms Application* Press Stop
TestStep.Result: *In AxIS*, the continuous plot returns to a typical noisy signal.

TestStep.Action: +Channel Setup (Neural Broadband):+ Click the dropdown that reads *Simple* and switch to Sweep mode. * Type: Sine wave * Frequency: 0.1 Hz * Amplitude: 1 V * Offset: 0 Vdc * Symmetry: 50% * Phase: 0 degrees * Sweep to 5khz in 50s
TestStep.Result: Done. Channel has been set.

TestStep.Action: Using the acquisition settings click *Neural: Broadband,* disable median subtraction and then click apply.
TestStep.Result: Offset begins and ends. Signal stabilizes over time.

TestStep.Action: *In WaveForms* click Run. *In AxIS*, change the: * Voltage Scale to 1 mV/Div * Time scale to 10 s/Div
TestStep.Result: You can see the entire sweep. There is tapering of the amplitude over the 50 seconds for technical reasons.

TestStep.Action: Click the dropdown that reads Sweep to *Simple* mode. * Type: Sine wave * Frequency: 0.1 Hz * Amplitude: 1 V * Offset: 0 Vdc * Symmetry: 50% * Phase: 0 degrees
TestStep.Result: Done. Channel has been set.

TestStep.Action: *In AxIS* Change the: * Voltage scale to 1 mV/Div * Time scale to 5s/Div
TestStep.Result: The sine waves are seen with a10 second period.

TestStep.Action: Change the waveform as follows * Type: Sine wave * Frequency: 5 kHz * Amplitude: 1 V * Offset: 0 Vdc * Symmetry: 50% * Phase: 0 degrees
TestStep.Result: Done. Channel has been set.

TestStep.Action: *In AxIS* Change the: * Voltage scale to 1 mV/Div * Time scale to 100 us/Div
TestStep.Result: **The RIGOL is better for this high frequency. The Diligent can’t handle it.* The sine waves are spiky due to not enough samples but you can barely see the 200us period in some channels.

TestStep.Action: *Navigate back to the WaveForms Application* Press Stop
TestStep.Result: *In AxIS*, the continuous plot returns to a typical noisy signal.

TestStep.Action: +Channel Setup (Cardiac: Standard):+ Click the dropdown that reads *Simple* and switch to Sweep mode. * Type: Sine wave * Frequency: 1 Hz * Amplitude: 1 V * Offset: 0 Vdc * Symmetry: 50% * Phase: 0 degrees * Sweep to 2khz in 10s
TestStep.Result: Done. Channel has been set.

TestStep.Result: Offset begins and ends. Signal stabilizes over time.

TestStep.Action: *In WaveForms* click Run. *In AxIS* Change the: * Voltage scale to 500μV/Div * Time scale to 500μs/Div
TestStep.Result: A sine wave is seen increasing in frequency over 10 seconds over the range of the analog mode. (500ms to 1s per sine wave cycle - change zoom to verify) There is no sharp cutoff or flatlining at either end. The amplitude stays mostly consistent.

TestStep.Action: *In AxIS*, change the: * Time scale to 2s/Div
TestStep.Result: You can see the entire sweep. There is tapering of the amplitude over the 10 seconds for technical reasons.

TestStep.Action: *Navigate back to the WaveForms Application* Press Stop
TestStep.Result: *In AxIS*, the continuous plot returns to a typical noisy signal.

TestStep.Action: +Channel Setup (Cardiac: Broadband):+ Click the dropdown that reads *Simple* and switch to Sweep mode. * Type: Sine wave * Frequency: 100 mHz * Amplitude: 1 V * Offset: 0 Vdc * Symmetry: 50% * Phase: 0 degrees * Sweep to 2kHz in 50s

Test.JiraSummary: v2.0.2 Verify offset correction high pass filters for analog modes

TestStep.Action: Connect a Maestro Pro or Edge to PC and Reset AxIS Navigator.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Open Maestro settings and play in Neural Spikes.
TestStep.Result: Maestro streams.

TestStep.Result: Result: Selected high-pass filter: 200 Hz Active high-pass filter : 200 Hz

TestStep.Action: Change analog mode to Field Potentials and click Apply.
TestStep.Result: AxIS starts Removing DC offset.

TestStep.Action: Once the change takes full effect type "configureoffsetcorrection" into the debug console.
TestStep.Result: Result: Selected high-pass filter: 100 mHz Active high-pass filter : 100 mHz

TestStep.Action: Change analog mode to Cardiac Standard and click Apply.
TestStep.Result: AxIS starts Removing DC offset.

TestStep.Action: Once the change takes full effect type "configureoffsetcorrection" into the debug console.
TestStep.Result: Result: Selected high-pass filter: 100 mHz Active high-pass filter : 100 mHz

TestStep.Action: Change analog mode to Cardiac Broadband and click Apply.
TestStep.Result: AxIS starts Removing DC offset.

TestStep.Action: While offset correction is taking place type "configureoffsetcorrection" into the debug console.
TestStep.Result: Result: Selected high-pass filter: 100 mHz Active high-pass filter : 100 mHz *It’s 100 mHz/200 mHz immediately when offset starts and up to ~43 seconds in offset time remaining. Then 100 mHz/100 mHz.

TestStep.Action: Change analog mode to Cardiac LEAP and click Apply.
TestStep.Result: AxIS starts Removing DC offset.

TestStep.Action: When offset correction is more than halfway done type "configureoffsetcorrection" into the debug console.
TestStep.Result: Result: Selected high-pass filter: 20 mHz Active high-pass filter : 20 mHz

TestStep.Action: Once the change takes full effect type "configureoffsetcorrection" into the debug console.
TestStep.Result: Result: Selected high-pass filter: 20 mHz Active high-pass filter : 20 mHz

TestStep.Action: Change analog mode to Cardiac Conractility and click apply.
TestStep.Result: AxIS starts Removing DC offset.

TestStep.Action: Once the change takes full effect type "configureoffsetcorrection" into the debug console.
TestStep.Result: Result: Selected high-pass filter: 100 mHz Active high-pass filter : 100 mHz

Test.JiraSummary: v2.0.2 Req. RIGOL Pro screen activity map updates in a timely manner

TestStep.Action: Type `cmdspock fakenextscan 0600001234` in the debug console to spoof a CytoView MEA 24. Grab a signal generator, hook it up to a signal plate, and dock the plate. Connect a Maestro Pro to AxIS.
TestStep.Result: Done. AxIS detects a CytoView MEA 24 plate.

TestStep.Action: Add a Cardiac Real-Time -> Field Potentials configuration and switch to the Activity map.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Set the following signal to be sent: * Pulse signal * 3s period * 0.5 V high, 0 V low * Duty Cycle 5%
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Start the signal. Start streaming.
TestStep.Result: Cardiac configurations don’t show beats data until offset correction completes, usually ~1 minute after playback starts. After offset correction completes, activity map data starts to show in AxIS AND on the M2 screen. Every 3 seconds, that data is updated, and matches the updates on the activity map in AxIS as well.

TestStep.Action: Stop streaming. Switch the analog mode to Neural Spikes and add a Neural Real-Time -> Spontaneous configuration.. Resume streaming.
TestStep.Result: Activity Map on the M2 screen does not display activity for the first 10 seconds of playback. The activity map on the M2 screen updates, showing new data every 3 seconds.

Test.JiraSummary: v2.0.2 Scaling controls for contractility signal added

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS Navigator and connect it to a Maestro Pro or Edge.
TestStep.Result: AxIS has been reset.

TestStep.Action: Right Click the live source and add an Cardiac Beat Detector. Add Processing-> Cardiac Beat Detector. Click OK.
TestStep.Result: Done. CBD is added. The Activity Map, Continuous plot, and Cardiac beat plot appear.
