TestStep.Result: Done. AxIS Begins Streaming

TestStep.Action: Using the *"Time Scale"* zoom controls zoom into 50μs/Div
TestStep.Result: Done. The continuous waveform plot has zoomed in and continues to stream. AxIS does not crash.

TestStep.Action: Right click the live source to open up the settings and change to Cardiac: Contractility
TestStep.Result: Done. Contractility mode settings have set. Time Scale changes to 5 ms/Div. AxIS begin offset and continues streaming.

TestStep.Action: Press Stop.
TestStep.Result: Done. Axis Stops Streaming and returns to being idle.

TestStep.Action: Click on the Cardiac beat plot.
TestStep.Result: Percentage Scale Display Sidebar is set to % (measure of impedance). See Screenshot.

TestStep.Action: Click on the Continuous Waveform plot.
TestStep.Result: Vertical zoom Display Sidebar is set to % (measure of impedance). See Screenshot.

TestStep.Action: Click View->Show all plate types.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Change active plate to CytoView MEA 24
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Press Play.
TestStep.Result: Axis begins Streaming. After about 55 seconds the Offset finishes.

TestStep.Action: Click on the Cardiac beat plot.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Using Display sidebar use the Percentage scale to Zoom out to 20.0%/Div
TestStep.Result: Graphs in wells Decrease in size.

TestStep.Action: Using Display Sidebar use the Percentage scale to Zoom in to 2.0%/Div
TestStep.Result: Graphs in well Increase in size.

TestStep.Action: Click on the Continuous Waveform plot.
TestStep.Result: Done. Vertical Zoom display settings are set to % (Contractility).

TestStep.Action: Using Display sidebar use the vertical to Zoom out to 20.0%/Div and horizontal zoom to 10 s/Div.
TestStep.Result: Graphs in wells Decrease in size (slightly) and become more flat almost looks like a Straight line with a little bit of noise. See screenshot

TestStep.Action: Using Display Sidebar use the vertical to Zoom in to 2.0%/Div and horizontal zoom to 10 s/Div.
TestStep.Result: Graphs in well Increase in size. Waves become more prevalent and easier to distinguish. See screenshot

TestStep.Action: Right click the live source and add a Spike detector. Add Processing->Spike Detector
TestStep.Result: Done. Spike detector is added. The Spike plot appears.

TestStep.Action: Click on the Spike plot.
TestStep.Result: Vertical Zoom settings are set to voltage instead of %. See Screenshot.

Test.JiraSummary: v2.0.2 Management: Batch Processing Remote Files

TestStep.Action: Add a new batch process to AxIS.
TestStep.Result: The batch processing window opens up.

TestStep.Action: Add REMOTE files of different lengths, including at least one with disabled wells, to the batch process. (Files listed above)
TestStep.Result: The user can add a batch process to AxIS and populate it with RAW files.

TestStep.Action: Add a Neural: Offline Spontaneous configuration to the Batch Process Block.
TestStep.Result: The user can apply default configurations to the batch process.

TestStep.Action: Use the following macro setup for the batch processing path: [Folder]\[SourceFile]\[StreamName]_[Duration]_[FileSegment]
TestStep.Result: The macro is considered valid.

TestStep.Action: Run the batch process.
TestStep.Result: The macros populate properly when the batch processor is run. The progress bars and the Play Bar update normally.

TestStep.Action: Switch to the raster plot and click on the zoom controls repeatedly.
TestStep.Result: Plot zooms as expected between 100ms/div and 30s/div. No crash.

TestStep.Action: Click the Batch Status button.
TestStep.Result: Batch Process window opens highlighting the file in progress.

TestStep.Action: When complete, set the batch processor to run for 30 seconds with an offset of one minute and 30 seconds. Run the batch.
TestStep.Result: neural analysis file details the offset and segment of the file recordings.

TestStep.Action: Set the batch processor to run from the End of File for 90 seconds and then run the batch.
TestStep.Result: Partial data files are recorded in the scenario that they are too short to fit within the requested lengths.

TestStep.Action: Set the batch to run for 30 seconds with an offset of 1 minute, 30 seconds and run the batch.
TestStep.Result: Data files too short for an offset are skipped. Skipping does not cause problems for re-run batch processes.

TestStep.Action: Re-run this batch.
TestStep.Result: The batch process completes with no errors and only the "2 files will be skipped" warning.

TestStep.Action: Set the batch processor to output an AxIS RAW file. Run the batch.
TestStep.Result: The batch process completes with no errors and only the "2 files will be skipped" warning.

TestStep.Action: Set the batch processor to output AxIS SPK, Spike List, Spike Count, and Burst List outputs. Run the batch.
TestStep.Result: The batch process completes with no errors and only the "2 files will be skipped" warning.

TestStep.Action: Attach a Cardiac : Offline Field Potentials configuration and set the batch processor to generate electrode/well beat lists and a cardiac analysis. Run the batch.
TestStep.Result: The batch process completes with no errors and only the "2 files will be skipped" warning.

TestStep.Action: Click on the Open Log button.
TestStep.Result: Batch log opens.

TestStep.Action: Open the output directory in Windows Explorer and delete the batch log file.
TestStep.Result: File is deleted

TestStep.Action: Click the Open Log' button
TestStep.Result: “File Not Found” error appears. AxIS doesn’t crash.

TestStep.Action: Close AxIS and reopen it.
TestStep.Result: Batch processing settings persist when AxIS is shut down properly.

TestStep.Action: Re-run the Batch Process.
TestStep.Result: Batch Process starts.

TestStep.Action: While batch process is running, click File --> New Batch Process.
TestStep.Result: Batch Process Settings window opens.

TestStep.Action: Add some files.
TestStep.Result: Files are added.

TestStep.Action: Click the Cancel button.
TestStep.Result: Batch Process is added.

TestStep.Action: Wait for the running batch process to finish, then double-click on new Batch Process.
TestStep.Result: No files were added.

Test.JiraSummary: v2.1.0 Verify Full System Self-Test

TestStep.Action: Connect M2 to AxIS Navigator. Reboot M2 and reset AxIS.
TestStep.Result: M2 reboots. AxIS opens. M2 connects to AxIS.

TestStep.Action: Open the debug console, and click the button "View Results" next to the Self-Test label
TestStep.Result: It opens a Self-Diagnostics window with a list of tests and whether they pass/fail/notrun. There is a Test Status and it is set to "Data Analyzer: Idle Neuroface: Idle"

TestStep.Action: Close the window, then open the Self Tests View Results window again.
TestStep.Result: It opens again, and you can see the same information.

TestStep.Action: Click Self Test --> View Results again.
TestStep.Result: Nothing happens.

TestStep.Action: Click Artichoke --> View Status
TestStep.Result: A window opens with a list of artichokes.

TestStep.Action: Click Artichoke --> View Status again.
TestStep.Result: Nothing happens

TestStep.Action: Close the artichoke window. In the self diagnostics window, click "Run Full Diagnostics"
TestStep.Result: * The debug console starts to print test information. * In the Self Diagnostics window, the test status changes to "Data Analyzer: RunningFullTest Neuroface: RunningFullTest" * The debug console prints the message "Requesting full diagnostics test" * At the end of the test both the door and plate holder are open and the console prints "System diagnostic test done".

TestStep.Action: Once the Test Status returns to "Data Analyzer: Idle Neuroface: Idle", Click "Save..." and save the test results in a CSV.
TestStep.Result: The CSV is output, and openable (not corrupted).

TestStep.Action: Open the CSV.
TestStep.Result: The following tests are listed in the file, and they all PASS: Heart Boards AD7998 I2C ADC Artichoke chips Heart IO Expanders EEPROM Chips Heart Provisioning Main data acquisition ADC Heater Door Heater Temperature Sensors Basic Diagnostic Test Temperature Sensors Extended Diagnostics CO2 Sensor Communications CO2 Valve CO2 Flow Meter Plate Holder Motor Controller Plate Holder Basic Motion Plate Holder Limit Switches Door Motor Controller Door Basic Motion Door Limit Switches Detect Barcode Reader Detect Fan Controller(s) Verify Internal Temperature Verify RPM Change Detect Flash Detect Partitions Eject button LED LCD display detection LCD display connection LCD built-in storage RAM Capacity External drive detection Swap partition mount status Data partition mount status

TestStep.Action: Create a support bundle and open the enterprise.log file from the Maestro folder
TestStep.Result: # There is a log entry for each of 4 plate heaters (A-D) # Each entry indicates the test passed # Each entry indicates the expected and actual value for the heater plate !xray-attachment://9ed95f68-630d-473b-a712-acf9ec4175c1|width=1590,height=80!

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS.
TestStep.Result: AxIS closes and reopens.

TestStep.Action: *Copy Locally* and Load file 5min_Cardiac.raw Into AxIS Navigator and attach a: Field Potentials configuration. *File can be found here:* Trunk\SoftwareTesting\RAW Files\cardiac\5min_Cardiac.raw
TestStep.Result: Configuration is attached. 2 Nodes added: * Cardiac Beat Detector * Statistics Compiler AxIS is set to record Advanced Metrics (for Cardiac).

TestStep.Action: Open the Statistics Compiler settings. (Double click on Statistics compiler)
TestStep.Result: The stats compiler is for cardiac configurations. It has a *"saved data"* subsection as well as *"Beat Quality Control"* and *"FPD Measure Quality Control"* sections.

TestStep.Action: "Click Ok" to Close the stats compiler settings window. Copy the streamtree starting with the CBD.
TestStep.Result: Beat Detector copied.

TestStep.Action: *Copy Locally* and Load file OverwhelmingRatBrains-30s.raw Into AxIS Navigator and attach a: Offline Spontaneous configuration. *File can be found here:* Trunk\SoftwareTesting\RAW Files\neural\OverwhelmingRatBrains-30s.raw
TestStep.Result: Configuration is attached 3 nodes added: * Spike Detector * Burst Detector * Statistics Compiler AxIS is set to record Advanced Metrics & AxIS Spike for Neural.

TestStep.Action: Open the Statistics Compiler settings. (Double click the Statistics Compiler)
TestStep.Result: The stats compiler is for neural configurations. It has a *"Saved data"* subsection as well as a *"Active Electrode Selection Criteria"* section.

TestStep.Action: "Click Ok" to Close the Statistics compiler settings pop-up and paste the copied cardiac streamtree to the file.
TestStep.Result:
Cardiac streamtree pasted 2 nodes added: * Cardiac Beat Detector * Statistics Compiler
And each sits below the neural ones.

TestStep.Action: Rename the outputs of the Statistics Compilers so the top one is *Neural Analysis* and the bottom one is *Cardiac Analysis*. Click Record.cording to finish.
TestStep.Result: Cardiac and Neural Analysis (Advanced Metrics) CSV files are created along with a spk file.

TestStep.Action: Open Analysis files.
TestStep.Result: Analysis Duration is about the same as the file length for *neural (299.75 seconds vs 300 seconds)* and about 5-8 seconds shorter for cardiac. *(293.5 seconds vs 300 seconds)*.

TestStep.Action: Change the file playback of the file to any 10 second segment and click record.
TestStep.Result: Advanced Metrics runs for the 10 seconds selected and playback stops.

TestStep.Action: Open Analysis files.
TestStep.Result: Both Cardiac and Neural Analysis files are created and populated along with a spk file. Analysis Duration is *about 10 seconds (9.75s) for neural* and *3.5 seconds for cardiac*.

TestStep.Action: Change the file settings to play the Whole File and click OK then record. Click Stop after 15 seconds. ( *Remember that it's in accelerated playback.* )
TestStep.Result: Both Cardiac and Neural Analysis files are created and populated. *Analysis Duration is about 15 seconds for Neural and 8-10 seconds for Cardiac* because the Cardiac Beat Detector buffers more data and was interrupted by the abrupt stop.

TestStep.Result: You should see live updates to spock.wedding.log.

TestStep.Action: Open the Maestro Settings and change the Acquisition Settings to Field Potentials.
TestStep.Result: You should see the following in the terminal window: * Artichoke.Rodeo Median Referencing: False * Artichoke.Rodeo Setting analog mode to FieldPotentials * *ighPassDigitalFilterController Step 1: TwoHundredHertzHpf* * Artichoke.Rodeo Low Pass filter changed: TwoKiloHertzLpf * AnalogModeTransitionController Analog Mode Transition Handler Parsed Xml (BioCoreFourB)-(FieldPotentials): * *(After 7.5 seconds for artichoke 4A. Faster for 4B) ighPassDigitalFilterController Step 2: Moving HP filter: TwoHundredHertzHpf -> OneHundredMilliHertzHpf* * *ighPassDigitalFilterController HP Filter is good: OneHundredMilliHertzHpf* * AnalogModeTransitionController Successfully set analog mode to FieldPotentials * Artichoke.Rodeo Finished Transition to: FieldPotentials

TestStep.Action: Change the mode back to Neural Spikes and after it is settled change to Cardiac: Standard.
TestStep.Result: You should see the following in the terminal window: * Artichoke.Rodeo Median Referencing: False * Artichoke.Rodeo Setting analog mode to CardiacStandard * *ighPassDigitalFilterController Step 1: TwoHundredHertzHpf* * Artichoke.Rodeo Low Pass filter changed: TwoKiloHertzLpf * AnalogModeTransitionController Analog Mode Transition Handler Parsed Xml (BioCoreFourB)-(CardiacStandard): * *(After 7.5 seconds for artichoke 4A. Faster for 4B)* * AnalogModeTransitionController Attempting Stimulator Reset. * AnalogModeTransitionController Stimulator is Parsed. Clearing. * *ighPassDigitalFilterController Step 2: Moving HP filter: TwoHundredHertzHpf -> OneHundredMilliHertzHpf* * *ighPassDigitalFilterController HP Filter is good: OneHundredMilliHertzHpf* * AnalogModeTransitionController Successfully set analog mode to CardiacStandard * Artichoke.Rodeo Finished Transition to: CardiacStandard

TestStep.Action: Change the mode back to Neural Spikes and after it is settled change to Cardiac: Broadband.
TestStep.Result: You should see the following in the terminal window: * Artichoke.Rodeo Median Referencing: False * Artichoke.Rodeo Setting analog mode to CardiacBroadband * *ighPassDigitalFilterController Step 1: TwoHundredHertzHpf* * Artichoke.Rodeo Low Pass filter changed: TwoKiloHertzLpf * AnalogModeTransitionController Analog Mode Transition Handler Parsed Xml (BioCoreFourB)-(CardiacBroadband): * *(After 7.5 seconds for artichoke 4A. Faster for 4B)* * AnalogModeTransitionController Attempting Stimulator Reset. * AnalogModeTransitionController Stimulator is Parsed. Clearing. * *ighPassDigitalFilterController Step 2: Moving HP filter: TwoHundredHertzHpf -> OneHundredMilliHertzHpf* * *ighPassDigitalFilterController HP Filter is good: OneHundredMilliHertzHpf* * AnalogModeTransitionController Successfully set analog mode to CardiacBroadband * Artichoke.Rodeo Finished Transition to: CardiacBroadband

TestStep.Action: Change the mode back to Neural Spikes and after it is settled change to Cardiac: LEAP.
TestStep.Result: You should see the following in the terminal window: * Artichoke.Rodeo Median Referencing: False * Artichoke.Rodeo Setting analog mode to CardiacLeap * *ighPassDigitalFilterController Step 1: TwoHundredHertzHpf* * Artichoke.Rodeo Low Pass filter changed: TwoKiloHertzLpf * AnalogModeTransitionController Analog Mode Transition Handler Parsed Xml (BioCoreFourB)-(CardiacLeap): * *(After 7.5 seconds for artichoke 4A. Faster for 4B) ighPassDigitalFilterController Step 2: Moving HP filter: TwoHundredHertzHpf -> OneHundredMilliHertzHpf* * *(After 15 seconds for artichoke 4A. Faster for 4B) ighPassDigitalFilterController Step 3: Moving HP filter: OneHundredMilliHertzHpf -> TwentyMilliHertzHpf* * *ighPassDigitalFilterController HP Filter is good: TwentyMilliHertzHpf* * AnalogModeTransitionController Attempting Stimulator Reset. * AnalogModeTransitionController Stimulator is Parsed. Clearing. * AnalogModeTransitionController Successfully set analog mode to CardiacLeap * Artichoke.Rodeo Finished Transition to: CardiacLeap

TestStep.Action: Change the mode back to Neural Spikes and after it is settled change to Cardiac: Contractility.
TestStep.Result: You should see the following in the terminal window: * Artichoke.Rodeo Median Referencing: False * Artichoke.Rodeo Setting analog mode to CardiacContractility * *ighPassDigitalFilterController High Pass filter changing immediately: OneHundredMilliHertzHpf* * *ighPassDigitalFilterController HP Filter is good (OneHundredMilliHertzHpf)* * Artichoke.Rodeo Low Pass filter changed: None * AnalogModeTransitionController Analog Mode Transition Handler Parsed Xml (BioCoreFourB)-(CardiacContractility): * *(After 7.5 seconds for artichoke 4A. Faster for 4B)* * AnalogModeTransitionController Attempting Stimulator Reset. * AnalogModeTransitionController Stimulator is Parsed. Clearing. * AnalogModeTransitionController Successfully set analog mode to CardiacContractility * Artichoke.Rodeo Finished Transition to: CardiacContractility

TestStep.Action: Change Analog Mode to Neural Spikes.

Test.JiraSummary: v2.0.2 Import / Export (Load / Save) calibration via debug console commands

TestStep.Action: Place a calibration file in c:\users<current user>\desktop and rename it as import.csv. File: \trunk\SoftwareTesting\Calibration Files\M2_Fake_Calibration_6_Modes.csv
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: With the Maestro turned off or disconnected, reset AxIS Navigator and the debug console.
TestStep.Result: Debug console opens.

TestStep.Action: Type "exportcalibrationdata c:\users<current user>\desktop\export.csv" into the debug console.
TestStep.Result: "Unknown Error: No Neuroface selected."

TestStep.Action: Type "importcalibrationdata c:\users<current user>\desktop\import.csv" into the debug console.
TestStep.Result: "Unknown Error: No Neuroface selected."

TestStep.Action: Turn on or connect Maestro. Set Active Plate to Classic MEA 48
TestStep.Result: It connects. Active Plate is Classic MEA 48.

TestStep.Action: Type "importcalibrationdata c:\users<current user>\desktop\import.csv" into the debug console.
TestStep.Result: Success.

TestStep.Action: Type "exportcalibrationdata c:\users<current user>\desktop\export1.csv" into the debug console.
TestStep.Result: c:\users<current user>\desktop\export1.csv is created.

TestStep.Action: Compare import.csv to export1.csv using BeyondCompare giving them a 1% relative numeric tolerance. *Beyond Compare instructions:* 1. Select Diffs and Minor buttons. 2. Click on Rules button. 3. Click *Edit Default...* 4. Set *Numeric tolerance:* to *1 relative (%)*. 5. Click *OK*. 6. Click *OK*.
TestStep.Result: They are "identical". There are no entries other than the headers.

TestStep.Action: Reboot the M2.
TestStep.Result: Maestro restarts.

TestStep.Action: Set Active Plate to Classic MEA 48 then type "exportcalibrationdata c:\users<current user>\desktop\export2.csv" into the debug console.
TestStep.Result: c:\users<current user>\desktop\export2.csv is created.

TestStep.Action: Compare import.csv to export2.csv using BeyondCompare giving them a 1% relative numeric tolerance.
TestStep.Result: They are "identical". There are no entries other than the headers.

TestStep.Action: Compare export1.csv to export2.csv
TestStep.Result: They are truly identical.

TestStep.Action: Delete import.csv, export1.csv and export2.csv.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Clear M2 calibration. 'open window calibration' -> *Clear* RMS Offsets.
TestStep.Result: Success.

TestStep.Action: Close the calibration window and type in the debug console: "exportcalibrationdata c:\users<current user>\desktop\export3.csv"
TestStep.Result: Result is *Unknown Error: No calibration data found.*

Test.JiraSummary: v2.0.2 Maestro Pro loads default configurations when not attached to AxIS (offline streaming)

TestStep.Action: * Connect an M2 Pro with no plate loaded and reset AxIS Navigator. * Set the analog mode to Neural: Spikes.

TestStep.Result: Activity is present in the M2 Activity Map.

TestStep.Action: Start AxIS.
TestStep.Result: AxIS recognizes the M2.

TestStep.Action: Tap on the plate to create activity.
TestStep.Result: Nothing happens. The activity map on the M2 does not light up.

TestStep.Action: Restart the M2 Pro.
TestStep.Result: M2 Pro restarts.

TestStep.Action: Switch the M2 screen to the Activity Map. Tap on the plate to create activity.
TestStep.Result: Nothing happens. The activity map on the M2 does not light up.

TestStep.Action: Add a Cardiac -> Real-Time Field Potentials configuration in AxIS. Press Play.
TestStep.Result: Activity Map module is added. AxIS Navigator streams.

TestStep.Action: Switch to the Activity Map in AxIS.
TestStep.Result: Spike Amplitude: Cardiac Beat Detector is selected as the Source.

TestStep.Action: Tap the plate.
TestStep.Result: Both Activity maps have similar activity.

TestStep.Action: Switch the Activity Map Source from Spike Amplitude: Cardiac Beat Detector to Beat Rate: Cardiac Beat Detector and tap on the plate.
TestStep.Result: Screen Activity Map still looks like Spike Amplitude. Screen is set to only use the defaults.

TestStep.Action: Add a Neural -> Real-Time Spontaneous configuration in AxIS.
TestStep.Result: Spike Rate: Spike Detector is selected as the Source in the AxIS Activity Map.

TestStep.Action: Tap the plate.
TestStep.Result: Both Activity maps have similar activity.

TestStep.Action: Switch the Activity Map Source from Spike Rate: Spike Detector to Spike Amplitude: Spike Detector. Open the plate door and Tap on the plate.
TestStep.Result: Screen Activity Map still looks like Spike Rate. Screen is set to only use the defaults.

TestStep.Action: Close AxIS Navigator.
TestStep.Result: AxIS is closed.

TestStep.Action: Tap the plate.
TestStep.Result: The M2 Pro activity map screen shows activity.

Test.JiraSummary: v2.0.2 Test "hot channel" data has calibration applied - fake calibration file

TestStep.Action: Connect M2 and reset AxIS Navigator.
TestStep.Result: AxIS opens and M2 connects.

TestStep.Action: Dock a Smart Plate and set Active Plate to Classic MEA 48. The Smart Plate is important so that the RMS / Noise values you record are consistent between runs. If you can’t find a smart plate, a "good" plate with saline would work.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Erase the calibration by opening the debug console, entering "open window calibration" and clicking the "Clear" button.
TestStep.Result: Success messages in the console. The calibration data is automatically exported / backed up.

TestStep.Action: Open up the Maestro Settings.
TestStep.Result: There is no calibration date.

TestStep.Action: Open the debug console and enter "devmode true".
TestStep.Result: Success.

TestStep.Action: Navigate to the Scheduled Recording setup: Set up a scheduled recording. * To Record Every minute for 10 Seconds. * To Execute Once Set up to record: * A raw file output * A raw noise level output csv.
TestStep.Result: Recording is enabled.

TestStep.Action: Start schedule recording and repeat for: * Neural: Spikes * Neural: Field Potentials * Cardiac: Standard * Cardiac: Broadband * Cardiac: LEAP * Cardiac: Contractility
TestStep.Result: Recordings are created. One raw file and 1 CSV for each analog mode. (2 x 6 total)

TestStep.Action: Copy locally and import calibration data: \trunk\SoftwareTesting\Calibration Files\M2_Fake_Calibration_6_Modes.csv
TestStep.Result: Calibration successful.

TestStep.Action: Export the calibration data
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Using Beyond Compare. Compare the M2_Fake_Calibration_6_modes.csv to the newly Exported calibration data that was previously saved. *NOTE* you will have to use a Numeric Tolerance of 1% in beyond compare.
TestStep.Result: The exported CSV is identical to m2_Fake_Calibration_6_Modes.csv.

TestStep.Action: Delete the Calibration data that was saved in Step 9.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Perform the scheduled recording again for each analog mode. (These Should be calibrated with the fake calibration.)
TestStep.Result: "2 x 6 recordings are created. (1 raw file and 1 CSV each.)

TestStep.Action: Load each calibrated raw file and check that each analog mode has calibration applied to the following electrodes in the corresponding wells: * 13 * 14 * 23 * 24 *NOTE* when checking the calibration for the contractility file *right click* the continuous plot and Select the option for *Plot Voltage Data* (Ensure that Devmode is still turned on)
TestStep.Result: (Electrodes = 13, 14, 23, 24) Neural: Spikes A1 = 10+ volts Field Potentials A2 = 20+ volts Cardiac Standard A3 = 30+ volts Cardiac Broadband A4 = 40+ volts Cardiac LEAP A5 = 50+ volts Cardiac Contractility A6 = 60+ volts

TestStep.Action: Compare the raw noise CSVs to each other. (Calibrated and Uncalibrated) Electrodes = 13, 14, 23, 24
TestStep.Result: "The calibrated ones have higher noise estimates by the amounts listed below: (Electrodes = 13, 14, 23, 24) Neural: Spikes A1 = 10+ volts Field Potentials A2 = 20+ volts Cardiac Standard A3 = 30+ volts Cardiac Broadband A4 = 40+ volts Cardiac LEAP A5 = 50+ volts Cardiac Contractility A6 = 60+ volts

TestStep.Action: Create a batch process with the calibrated raw files and record Noise Estimate CSVs.
TestStep.Result: 6 csv files are created.

TestStep.Action: Compare the recent raw noise CSVs to the ones from the live calibrated recordings.
TestStep.Result: They are nearly identical. (Noticeable differences only in the large calibration values. > 1E-6)

TestStep.Action: Remove all files from AxIS and add the uncalibrated ones.
TestStep.Result: All uncalibrated raw files are added.

TestStep.Action:
"For each file import the Calibration file below: *trunk\SoftwareTesting\Calibration Files\M2_Fake_Calibration_6_Modes.csv*
Then Play while recording a raw noise Estimate output csv. Check that calibration is applied to electrodes 13, 14, 23, 24 in the appropriate wells. *NOTE* when checking the calibration for the contractility file *right click* the continuous plot and Select the option for *Force Voltage Data* (Ensure that Devmode is still turned on)
TestStep.Result: "6 csv files are created. (Electrodes = 13, 14, 23, 24) Neural: Spikes A1 = 10+ volts Field Potentials A2 = 20+ volts Cardiac Standard A3 = 30+ volts Cardiac Broadband A4 = 40+ volts Cardiac LEAP A5 = 50+ volts Cardiac Contractility A6 = 60+ volts

TestStep.Action: Compare the recent raw noise CSVs to the ones from the live calibrated recordings.
TestStep.Result: They are nearly identical. (Noticeable differences only in the large calibration values. > 1E-6)

TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Result: They match.

TestStep.Action: Delete the neural node in stim studio. Go back to the debug console. Provision the hearts as 4a artichokes. Reboot the M2.
TestStep.Result: Done. The maestro has been rebooted and the artichokes are listed as 4a.

TestStep.Action: Drag and drop the neural node into Lane A in stim studio.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Open the debug console, enter the command: "savestimulationfile c:\users\[user]\desktop\test_4a.xml"
TestStep.Result: Done, an XML file is output.

TestStep.Action: Compare the information inside the <loop> tags in test_4a.xml with the file 4a_final(2.1.0).xml in TRUNK\SoftwareTesting\JIRA Supplemental Files\NAV-3018
TestStep.Result: They match.

TestStep.Action: Back in the debug console, re-provision the artichokes to their initial state. Reboot the M2.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Result: Done. Spike detector added

TestStep.Result: Done. Output files have been created.

TestStep.Result: Maestro is calibrated.

TestStep.Result: Maestro settings show the Calibration Date: "Day, Month Day(number), Year Time * I.e Monday, September 9, 2019 16:37 At the bottom of the setting popup window.

TestStep.Result: All Files are deleted and the live source (Calibrated) remains.

TestStep.Action: With The calibrated Maestro connected. Load the *"Uncalibrated.raw"* file. Add a Spike Detector to the file.
TestStep.Result: Done. Spike Detector added.

TestStep.Action: Navigate to the *"Experiment Setup Properties"* and set to Output a: * Raw Noise Estimate csv (devmode) * And a spike list. Press Record.
TestStep.Result: Done. Output files have been created.

TestStep.Action: With the calibrated Maestro connected. Load the *"Calibrated.raw"* file. Add a Spike Detector to the file.
TestStep.Result: Done. Spike detector added.

TestStep.Action: Navigate to the *"Experiment Setup Properties"* and set to Output a: * Raw Noise Estimate csv (devmode) * And a spike list. Press Record.
TestStep.Result: Done. Output files have been created.

TestStep.Action: Compare the outputs from the uncalibrated files in both calibrated and uncalibrated Maestro.
TestStep.Result: They are identical.

TestStep.Action: Compare the outputs from the calibrated files in both calibrated and uncalibrated Maestro.
TestStep.Result: They are identical.

TestStep.Action: Open the created Spike List csv.

TestStep.Result: Offset restarts. There is no artifact that appears in any of the electrode waveforms. AxIS continues to stream

TestStep.Action: Before The offset finishes double click the live source and change into *Cardiac: Standard* analog mode.
TestStep.Result: Offset restarts. There is no artifact that appears in any of the electrode waveforms. AxIS continues to stream

TestStep.Action: Immediately when the play button is able to be pressed Press Play.

TestStep.Action: Press stop.
TestStep.Result: Waveforms in the continuous waveform plot become blank and AxIS return to being idle.

TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Result: Constant Time node added.

TestStep.Action: In the debug console open up the SOStree and navigate to StreamControl->StreamTelemetry
TestStep.Result: Stream Telemetry contents open.

TestStep.Action: In AxIS click on the continuous plot and click play. Watch the numbers in the SlicesInFreePool

Test.JiraSummary: Changing analog modes while stimulating DOES NOT cancel Channel state assertion

TestStep.Action: Connect to live source. and reset AxIS Navigator.
TestStep.Result: Live source is connected. AxIS opens.

TestStep.Action: Open Debug menu and Get the Device Ip.
TestStep.Result: AxIS plays and stimulating.

TestStep.Action: Use babun, cygwin, putty or command prompt to SSH to root@device_ip.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Type "tail -f /var/log/spock.wedding.log"
TestStep.Result: Done. You should see Live updates coming from the spock wedding log

TestStep.Action: Right click on the live source and change analog mode to Cardiac: Standard. Click Play.
TestStep.Result: AxIS plays and begins offset.

TestStep.Action: While still trying to finish the offset quickly change analog mode to Field Potentials.
TestStep.Result: AxIS stops stimulating but continues playing after an offset correction.

TestStep.Action: Open babun, cygwin, putty or command prompt to view the ssh logs of the transitioning of analog modes.
TestStep.Result: *Follow the Steps in the description to get a better idea*. When you scroll up on the logs you should see the first Dacset for cardiac Standard followed by: * A block of logs that reads that the transition was cancelled * Another Dacset of Field potentials * followed by another set of logs reading that the transition to Field potentials was successful. * After that block comes the Channel state assertion See Screenshots

Test.JiraSummary: Analog mode transitions do not cause false spikes

TestStep.Action: Connect a Maestro to AxIS. Open the analog mode settings and set the analog mode to Neural: Spikes. Click Apply.
TestStep.Result: Done. Analog mode window is still open.

TestStep.Action: Add a Spike Detector to your live source. Add Processing-> Spike Detector
TestStep.Result: Done. The Spike Plot and Activity map is module is now available.

TestStep.Action: Navigate to the Continuous waveform plot.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Press play. While offset correction is occurring, change the analog mode to Cardiac: Standard and click Apply.
TestStep.Result: Offset correction restarts, no spikes are detected.

TestStep.Action: Before offset correction is finished, switch back to Neural: Spikes and click Apply.
TestStep.Result: Offset correction restarts, no spikes are detected.

TestStep.Action: Before offset correction is finished, switch to Cardiac: Broadband and click Apply.
TestStep.Result: Offset correction restarts, no spikes are detected.

TestStep.Action: Before offset correction is finished, switch back to Neural: Spikes and click Apply.
TestStep.Result: Offset correction restarts, no spikes are detected.

TestStep.Action: Before offset correction is finished, switch to Cardiac: Standard and click Ok.
TestStep.Result: Offset correction restarts, no spikes are detected. Analog settings close.

TestStep.Action: Press Stop.
TestStep.Result: AxIS discontinues streaming and returns to being idle.

Test.JiraSummary: No crash LEAPing after stopping multiple times, aborting in between

TestStep.Action: Connect M2 and reset AxIS Navigator.
TestStep.Result: AxIS opens. M2 connects.

TestStep.Action: Set M2 to Contractility: LEAP analog mode and go to the LEAP Module.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Click Play.
TestStep.Result: AxIS offset corrects and streams.

TestStep.Action: Click stop and then click on "Start Induction" as soon as the button is available.
TestStep.Result: "Start Induction" button gets disabled while until the play controls return and then it's immediately enabled. Induction starts after Start Induction button is pressed. No crashes. Spock does not reboot. (M2 does not disconnect and reconnect.)

TestStep.Action: After inducing has started click "Abort LEAP Induction" button.
TestStep.Result: Induction aborts. AxIS streams.

TestStep.Action: Wait for offset to complete. Click stop and then click on "Start Induction" as soon as the button is available.
TestStep.Result: "Start Induction" button gets disabled while until the play controls return and then it's immediately enabled. Induction starts after Start Induction button is pressed. No crashes. Spock does not reboot. (M2 does not disconnect and reconnect.)

TestStep.Action: After inducing has started click "Abort LEAP Induction" button.
TestStep.Result: Induction aborts. AxIS streams.

TestStep.Action: *DO NOT wait for offset to complete.* Click stop and then click on "Start Induction" as soon as the button is available.
TestStep.Result: "Start Induction" button gets disabled while until the play controls return and then it's immediately enabled. Induction starts after Start Induction button is pressed. No crashes. Spock does not reboot. (M2 does not disconnect and reconnect.)

TestStep.Action: After inducing has started click "Abort LEAP Induction" button.
TestStep.Result: Induction aborts. AxIS streams.

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS.
TestStep.Result: AxIS closes and reopens.

TestStep.Result: Done. File Loaded and selected for play/Pause.

TestStep.Action: Right click the file and add a Cardiac: Contractility configuration.
TestStep.Result: Done. Cardiac beat Detector and Statistic compiler added. Activity Map and Cardiac Beat Plot have been added to the bottom toolbar.

TestStep.Action: Click on the Cardiac beat plot icon on the bottom toolbar.
TestStep.Result: Done. Cardiac Beat Plot appears.

TestStep.Action: Ensure that *Well A1* has been selected. Press Play.
TestStep.Result: After about 7 second the Cardiac beat plot becomes populated with data. All the amplitude numbers are below 10. See Screen shot.

TestStep.Action: Switch to well A2.
TestStep.Result: All electrodes beat at once (not just four or five). This is how we know that the well beats are being calculated correctly.

TestStep.Action: Reset Axis & connect to live source.

TestStep.Action: Right click the Live source and add a Spike Detector. Add Processing-> Spike Detector.

TestStep.Action: Click on the Stimulation studio button on the bottom toolbar
TestStep.Result: Done. Stimulation Studio menu appears.

TestStep.Action: Add a Cardiac pacing node to Lane A and Set up a Cardiac Pacing Stimulation. Stimulate until stopped once every 1 second.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Select *"Classic MEA 48"* plate. Click the *"*"* button to select all electrode wells and select a single electrode to stimulate by pressing apply.
TestStep.Result: Done. A red Box appears around the selected Electrode.

TestStep.Action: Click on the Spike plot.
TestStep.Result: Done. Spike plot appears in AxIS

TestStep.Action: From the Spike plot Zoom controls on the bottom right hand corner change the zoom setting to be 1 s/Div.

TestStep.Result: Spike plot becomes populated with spikes. The Spike Plot shows the stimulation made and updates the bottom with the appropiate number of tags. Instead of showing 4 tags per second AxIS will only show one per second. See Screenshot. * Stimulating once per second

TestStep.Result: Axis stops stimulating but continues to stream.

TestStep.Action: Click on the Stimulation studio button on the bottom toolbar
TestStep.Result: Done. Stimulation Studio menu appears.

TestStep.Action: Change the Stimulation settings to *Stimulate Until stopped every 3 seconds*.
TestStep.Result: Done Settings changed.

TestStep.Action: Click on the Spike plot.
TestStep.Result: Done. Spike plot appears in AxIS

TestStep.Action: Press the Start button.
TestStep.Result: Spike plot becomes populated with spikes. The Spike Plot shows the stimulation made and updates the bottom with the appropiate number of tags. Instead of showing 4 tags per second AxIS will only show one every three seconds. See Screenshot. * Stimulating once every 3 seconds

TestStep.Action: Press the red Stop button. Also press Stop underneath the live play controls
TestStep.Result: AxiS Stops stimulating. Spike Plot becomes blank and returns to idle state.

Test.JiraSummary: Contractility Dashboard shows Correct Bubble Plot Mapping

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS.
TestStep.Result: AxIS closes and reopens.

TestStep.Result: After about 8 seconds the Plot starts showing data from the file. Looking at electrode waveform *22* it has a huge spike (positive value) and correlating that to the same bubble on the contractility map you see that the Bubble shrinks in size. Looking at electrode waveform *34* it has a negative value correlating that to the same bubble on the contractility map you see that the Bubble grows in size.

TestStep.Result: File continues to play. After a few seconds the Chosen Electrode reappears and the corresponding Bubble on the Contractility bubble also reappears.

TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Result: Done. Continuous plot shows in AxIS.

Test.JiraSummary: v2.0.1 No Spikes should be detected during DC Offset Removal and transition messages are logged

TestStep.Action: * Connect a Maestro and reset AxIS Navigator. * Fakescan a CyteCiew 24 plate (06) and set door to stay open before docking.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Open Debug Console and Get the device IP.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Use command prompt to SSH to root@device_ip. Password: St1m.ly
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Type:"tail -f /var/log/kirk.wedding.log"
TestStep.Result: You should see live updates to kirk.wedding.log.

TestStep.Action: Add to the live source the following: # 100 uV Static Threshold Spike Detector # Default Cardiac Beat Detector
TestStep.Result: Done. Spike detector and Cardiac Beat Detector added. Activity Map, Spike Plot and Cardiac Beat Plots are also added to the bottom toolbar.

TestStep.Action: Click on the Continuous Plot.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Click Play to Start streaming and stimulate the pins after DC offsetting is done.
TestStep.Result: Done. Axis begins streaming. Continuous Plot, Activity Map, Spike Plot and CBD Plot show activity On Pro system it also shows the Activity map light up on the LCD panel.

TestStep.Action: Press Stop then Play to reset the Beats Plot.
TestStep.Result: Beats and Spike plots are clear.

TestStep.Action: After Offset Finishes. Right click the Live source and change the Settings to *"Field Potentials"*. Stimulate the pins during offset.
TestStep.Result: Axis begins offset correction. During offset correction Activity Map, Spike and Beat Plots *do not* display activity. The M2 front panel also shows no activity. The continuous map shows a very noisy signal. Logs appear and show that the Pipeline is being set up for *Field Potentials*. No NRE exceptions. See Screenshot

TestStep.Action: After the signal stabilizes (Offset finishes) switch the settings to *"Cardiac: Standard"* And continue to Stimulate pins during Offset.
TestStep.Result: Axis begins offset correction. During offset correction Activity Map, Spike and Beat Plots *do not* display activity. The M2 front panel also shows no activity. The continuous map shows a very noisy signal. Logs appears and shows the Pipeline being set up for *Cardiac: Standard* and the FPD Detection being turned off. No NRE exceptions. See screenshot.

TestStep.Action: After the signal stabilizes (Offset finishes) switch the settings to *"Cardiac: Broadband"* And continue to Stimulate pins during Offset.
TestStep.Result: Axis begins offset correction. During offset correction Activity Map, Spike and Beat Plots *do not* display activity. The M2 front panel also shows no activity. The continuous map shows a very noisy signal. Logs appears and shows the the Pipeline setting it up for *Cardiac: Broadband*.No NRE exceptions. See screenshot.

TestStep.Action: After the signal stabilizes (Offset finishes) switch the settings to *"Cardiac: LEAP"* And continue to Stimulate pins during Offset.
TestStep.Result: Axis begins offset correction. During offset correction Activity Map, Spike and Beat Plots *do not* display activity. The M2 front panel also shows no activity. The continuous map shows a very noisy signal. Logs appears and shows the the Pipeline setting it up for *Cardiac: LEAP*. No NRE exceptions. See screenshot.

TestStep.Action: After the signal stabilizes (Offset finishes) switch the settings to *"Cardiac: Contractility"* And continue to Stimulate pins during Offset.
TestStep.Result: Axis begins offset correction. During offset correction Activity Map, Spike and Beat Plots *do not* display activity. The M2 front panel also shows no activity. The continuous map shows a very noisy signal. . Logs appears and shows the the Pipeline setting it up for *Cardiac: Contractility*. No NRE exceptions. See screenshot.

TestStep.Action: After the signal stabilizes (Offset finishes) switch the settings to *"Neural: Spikes"* And continue to Stimulate pins during Offset.
TestStep.Result: Axis begins offset correction. During offset correction Activity Map, Spike and Beat Plots *do not* display activity. The M2 front panel also shows no activity. The continuous map shows a very noisy signal. Logs appears and shows the the Pipeline setting it up for *Neural: Spikes*. Also shows the Burst detector being removed and the application of a new neural configuration. No NRE exceptions. See screenshot.

TestStep.Action: After Signal Stabilizes Press Stop.
TestStep.Result: AxIS immediately stops streaming and returns to being Idle.

TestStep.Result: One node added-> Cardiac Beat Detector. Activity Map and the Cardiac Beat plot also appear on the bottom toolbar.

TestStep.Action: Click on the Cardiac Beat Plot.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Right click inside the plot and click "Averaged beats" to disable the feature.
TestStep.Result: Done. Averaged Beat is now unchecked.

TestStep.Action: Right click inside the plot again.
TestStep.Result: Menu appears and shows the "Remove Offset" feature enabled. Synchronized Beats Only option appears See Screenshot

TestStep.Action: Press play.
TestStep.Result: Axis begins streaming file.

TestStep.Action: When the Cardiac Beat Plot is populates with data press Pause.
TestStep.Result: Done. Axis Shows Contractility beats are *"zeroed"* out and ideally touch the zero origin of the beat plot at some point. See Screenshot.

TestStep.Action: Press Stop.
TestStep.Result: Cardiac Beat Plot Clears and AxIS return to being "idle".

TestStep.Action: Copy locally and add contractility file 30-second_Contractility.raw. Trunk/SoftwareTeseting/RAWFiles/Contractility/30-second_Contractility.raw
TestStep.Result: Done. File loaded and selected for Play/Rec

TestStep.Action: Right click the file and add an Cardiac Beat Detector. Add Processing->Cardiac Beat Detector
TestStep.Result: One node added-> Cardiac Beat Detector. Activity Map and the Cardiac Beat plot also appear on the bottom toolbar.

TestStep.Action: Click on the Cardiac Beat Plot.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Right click inside the plot.
TestStep.Result: Menu appears and shows the "Remove Offset" feature hidden. Synchronized Beat Only option is hidden and is no longer shown See Screenshot

TestStep.Action: Press play.
TestStep.Result: Axis begins streaming file.

TestStep.Action: When the Cardiac Beat Plot is populates with data press Pause.
TestStep.Result: Done. Axis Shows Contractility beats are *"zeroed"* out at the beat detection line ideally. At the very least the plot should measure 0V at some point.

Test.JiraSummary: Lumos 24-well plates have Stim paddles

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS.
TestStep.Result: AxIS closes and reopens.

TestStep.Action: From the active plate dropdown menu click and choose the Lumos-24 plate type. (Click View->Show all Plate types if plate type in not shown)
TestStep.Result: Done. Plate type Changed. Lumos MEA 24 is shown inside the Drop-down box. See Screenshot

TestStep.Action: Double click on the plate map.
TestStep.Result: Plate Map Editor appears and shows the electrodes and well information. Also shows the Stim Paddle (41) on each well. Electrode 41 is much larger than the rest. See Screenshot.

TestStep.Action: Click the Stimulation Studio Button on the bottom toolbar.
TestStep.Result: Stimulation Studio menu appears in AxIS.

TestStep.Action: From the Plate selection dropdown click and choose the Lumos-24 plate type
TestStep.Result: Done. Plate type changes and shows the electrode and well information. Also shows the stim Paddle (41) on each well. Electrode 41 (A) is shown larger than the rest. See Screenshot

TestStep.Result: Done. One node added Cardiac Beat Detector. Activity Map and Cardiac Beat Plot also appear on the bottom thumbnail bar.

TestStep.Action: Click on the Continuous Plot.
TestStep.Result: Done. Display Scale settings show 5.0%/Div as default zoom level.

TestStep.Action: Press the *"+"*/and *"-"* magnifying glass buttons on the Display Vertical Scale Zoom toolbar.
TestStep.Result: When pressed the Display Vertical Scale settings show the correct zoom scales of 2.0%, 5.0%, 10.0%, and 20.0%

TestStep.Action: Click on the Cardiac Beat plot.
TestStep.Result: Done. Display Scale setting shows 5.0% as default zoom level.

TestStep.Action: Press the *"+"*/and *"-"* magnifying glass buttons on the Display Vertical Scale Zoom toolbar.
TestStep.Result: When pressed the Display Vertical Scale settings show the correct zoom scales of 2.0%, 5.0%, 10.0%, and 20.0%

TestStep.Result: AXIS opens. File is loaded and selected.

TestStep.Action: Right click the File and Add a Contractility configuration to it. Configuration->Cardiac Offline->Contractility.
TestStep.Result: Done. Two nodes added. Cardiac Beat Detector->Statistics compiler. Activity Map and the Cardiac Beat Plot appear on the bottom Thumbnail bar.

TestStep.Result: Done. Display Scale settings show 5.0%/Div as default zoom level.

TestStep.Action: Press the *"+"*/and *"-"* magnifying glass buttons on the Display Vertical Scale Zoom toolbar.
TestStep.Result: When pressed the Display Vertical Scale settings show the correct zoom scales of 2.0%, 5.0%, 10.0%, and 20.0%

TestStep.Action: Click on the Cardiac Beat plot.
TestStep.Result: Done. Display Scale setting shows 5.0% as default zoom level.

TestStep.Action: Press the *"+"*/and *"-"* magnifying glass buttons on the Display Vertical Scale Zoom toolbar.

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS and connect to live source.

TestStep.Action: Right click the live source and add a Cardiac Beat Detector. Add processing-> Cardiac Beat Detector.

TestStep.Action: Right click the Cardiac Beat Detector and add a Statistics Compiler.
TestStep.Result: Statistics Compiler block added to Cardiac Beat detector.

TestStep.Result: Cardiac Beat Detector Settings appear. With default settings. See Screenshot.

TestStep.Action: Press OK and Double click on the Statistics Compiler To open Settings. Do not press "OK"
TestStep.Result: Statistics Compiler Settings appear with default settings. !xray-attachment://e4e0afb0-ef4e-45fb-82ac-908f737da51b|width=334,height=402!

TestStep.Action: Right click the live source and Change settings to Cardiac: Contractility mode.

TestStep.Action: Double click on the Cardiac Beat Detector. To open Settings. Do not press "OK"
TestStep.Result: Cardiac Beat Detector Settings appear. With new Contratility default settings. * LEAP Settings Hidden * FPD detection settings Hidden * Beat threshold Hidden See Screenshot.

TestStep.Action: Press OK and Double click on the Statistics Compiler To open Settings. Do not press "OK"

TestStep.Action: Copy locally and add 30-second_Contractility.raw into AxIS.

TestStep.Action: Right click the file and add a Cardiac Beat Detector. Do not press OK. Add processing-> Cardiac Beat Detector.
TestStep.Result: Cardiac Beat Detector settings appear with the new default Contractility settings. * LEAP Settings Hidden * FPD detection settings Hidden * Beat threshold Hidden See Screenshot.

TestStep.Action: Press OK to close CBD settings window. Right click the Cardiac Beat Detector and add a Statistics Compiler. Do not press OK.

TestStep.Result: AxIS begins streaming.

TestStep.Result: Debug console opens.

TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Result: Done.

Test.JiraSummary: Activity Map replaces Spike Amplitude with Beat Amplitude % when in Contractility mode

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS Navigator and connect to live source.
TestStep.Result: AxIS closes and reopens. Device is connected.

TestStep.Action: Double-click the live source and change the analog mode to Neural: Spikes.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Add a Cardiac Beat Detector to the live source and click on the Activity map.
TestStep.Result: Source drop down menu contains: * Spike Amplitude: Cardiac Beat Detector * Beat Rate: Cardiac Beat Detector. Title of map shows as Spike Amplitude.

TestStep.Action: Double-click the live source and change the analog mode to Cardiac: Contractility. Press Apply then OK.
TestStep.Result: Source drop down menu changes to contain: * Beat Rate: Cardiac Beat Detector * Beat Amplitude: Cardiac Beat Detector Title of map changes and shows as Beat Rate BPM.

TestStep.Action: Switch source to Beat Amplitude: Cardiac Beat Detector.
TestStep.Result: Activity Map title is "Beat Amplitude %".

TestStep.Action: Add a Cardiac Real-Time -> Contractility configuration to the live source.
TestStep.Result: Stream Tree contains an a CBD. Source drop down still contains * Beat Rate: Cardiac Beat Detector. * Beat Amplitude: Cardiac Beat Detector Title of map shows as Beat Rate BPM.

TestStep.Action: Switch source to Beat Amplitude: Cardiac Beat Detector.
TestStep.Result: Activity Map title is "Beat Amplitude (%)".

TestStep.Action: Add a Cardiac Real-Time -> Field Potentials configuration to the live source.
TestStep.Result: Stream Tree contains an CBD. Source drop down menu contains: * Spike Amplitude: Cardiac Beat Detector. * Beat Rate: Cardiac Beat Detector. Title of the map shows back as Spike Amplitude (uV). Contractility Amplitude is gone from the dropdown menu.

TestStep.Action: Add a Cardiac Real-Time -> Contractility Paced configuration to the live source.
TestStep.Result: Stream Tree contains an Artifact Eliminator and a CBD. Source drop down contains: * Beat Rate: Cardiac Beat Detector * Beat Amplitude: Cardiac Beat Detector and Title of the Map changes and shows as Beat Rate (BPM).

TestStep.Action: Switch source to Beat Amplitude: Cardiac Beat Detector.
TestStep.Result: Activity Map title is "Beat Amplitude (%)".

TestStep.Action: Copy locally and load trunk\SoftwareTesting\RAW Files\Contractility\30-second_Contractility.raw.
TestStep.Result: File loaded and selected.

TestStep.Action: Add a Cardiac Offline --> Contractility configuration to the file.
TestStep.Result: Cardiac Beat Detector and Statistics Compiler processing nodes are added to file.

TestStep.Action: Select the Activity Plot.
TestStep.Result: Source drop down menu contains: * Beat Rate: Cardiac Beat Detector * Beat Amplitude: Cardiac Beat Detector The title of that map Shows as Beat Rate (BPM).

TestStep.Action: Switch source to Beat Amplitude: Cardiac Beat Detector.
TestStep.Result: Activity Map title is "Beat Amplitude (%)".

TestStep.Action: Add a Cardiac Offline -> Contractility Paced configuration.
TestStep.Result: Stream Tree contains an Artifact Eliminator, a CBD, and a Statistics Compiler. Source drop down still contains: * Beat Rate: Cardiac Beat Detector. * Beat Amplitude: Cardiac Beat Detector The title of map shows as Beat Rate (BPM).

TestStep.Action: Switch source to Beat Amplitude: Cardiac Beat Detector.
TestStep.Result: Activity Map title is "Beat Amplitude (%)".

Test.JiraSummary: User Can Activate/Deactivate channels while Stimulating

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS Navigator and connect it to a Live source.
TestStep.Result: AxiS Closes and reopens. Device is connected.

TestStep.Action: Open the debug console and get the device IP
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Use command prompt to SSH to root@device_ip. Password: St1m.ly
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Type:"tail -f /var/log/spock.wedding.log"
TestStep.Result: You should see live updates to spock.wedding.log.

TestStep.Action: Click on the Stimulation Studio icon.
TestStep.Result: Done. Stimulation studio menu appears.

TestStep.Action: Add a Biphasic pulse to New Lane A.
TestStep.Result: Done. Biphasic node added to New Lane. See Screenshot. !https://xray.cloud.xpand-it.com/api/internal/attachments/c53aee05-458e-45a8-b5f0-eabbff659181?inXray=true|width=761,height=237!

TestStep.Action: Set to Stimulate *"Until Stopped"* every *5* seconds.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: From the plate selection drop down menu, set The plate type to *"Classic MEA 48"*
TestStep.Result: Done. Plate selected.

TestStep.Action: Click the '*' symbol and select an Electrode to stimulate in all the wells. Click Apply.
TestStep.Result: Done. Electrode selected The electrode is highlighted with a red box. See Screenshot. !https://xray.cloud.xpand-it.com/api/internal/attachments/f3a71e1c-c86b-45a8-a3a6-2413785af92e?inXray=true|width=545,height=376!

TestStep.Action: Click on the Continuous Waveform Plot.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: From the Active Plate drop down menu select the *"Classic MEA 48"* Plate type.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Press play.
TestStep.Result: AxIS starts streaming. After offset correction is done, Stimulation button is no longer greyed out and becomes green.

TestStep.Action: Press the Start stimulation button, wait a couple of seconds after it stimulates once then right click on a channel and *"Disable Electrode"*.
TestStep.Result: Chosen Electrode channel visually turns off: Stimulation button becomes Red to *"Stop"* The Log shows that a channel needs to be updated it doesn't. You see the following: *"MaestroChannelSelectController Got 1 updates..."* But *NOT* see the following: MaestroChannelSelectController Applied 1 channel updates. Took: 2070 ms (times may vary) !https://xray.cloud.xpand-it.com/api/internal/attachments/700f3e95-f001-4fa6-9b3b-1bd736bf000d?inXray=true|width=1565,height=793!

TestStep.Action: Press the "Stop" button.
TestStep.Result: Axis Stops Stimulating, and the stimulation button turns back green. The Log updates and shows the XML for the stimulation: <stimulation no-clean-up="true" xmlns="StimulationSchema.xsd"> <electrical-operations> <achkset channelid="0x00,0x34" command="0x4040" /> </electrical-operations> </stimulation> (the channelid may be different) And afterwards shows the Disabling of the electrode channel: *"MaestroChannelSelectController Applied 1 channel updates. Took: 2070 ms"* (times may vary)

TestStep.Action: Press the Start stimulation button, wait a couple of seconds after it stimulates once then right click on the *"Turned off channel*" and click *"Disable Electrode"* in order to enable it.
TestStep.Result: Chosen Electrode channel visually turns off: Stimulation button becomes Red to *"Stop"* The Log shows that a channel needs to be updated it doesn't. You see the following: *"MaestroChannelSelectController Got 1 updates..."* But *NOT* see the following: MaestroChannelSelectController Applied 1 channel updates. Took: 2070 ms (times may vary) !https://xray.cloud.xpand-it.com/api/internal/attachments/c353810a-67c9-416d-96c4-37a18f0d261b?inXray=true|width=1559,height=788!

TestStep.Action: Press the "Stop" trigger button.
TestStep.Result: Axis Stops Stimulating, and the stimulation button turns back green. The Log updates and shows the XML for the stimulation: <stimulation no-clean-up="true" xmlns="StimulationSchema.xsd"> <electrical-operations> <achkset channelid="0x00,0x34" command="0x4080" /> </electrical-operations> </stimulation> (the channelid may be different) And afterwards shows the Disabling of the electrode channel: *"MaestroChannelSelectController Applied 1 channel updates. Took: 2070 ms"* (times may vary)

TestStep.Action: Press the Start stimulation button, then immediately right click on a channel to *"Disable Electrode"*.
TestStep.Result: Chosen Electrode channel visually turns off: Stimulation button becomes Red to *"Stop"* The Log shows that a channel needs to be updated it doesn't. You see the following: *"MaestroChannelSelectController Got 1 updates..."* But *NOT* see the following: MaestroChannelSelectController Applied 1 channel updates. Took: 2070 ms (times may vary)

TestStep.Action: Press the "Stop" trigger button.
TestStep.Result: Axis Stops Stimulating, and the stimulation button turns back green. The Log updates and shows the XML for the stimulation: <stimulation no-clean-up="true" xmlns="StimulationSchema.xsd"> <electrical-operations> <achkset channelid="0x00,0x34" command="0x4040" /> </electrical-operations> </stimulation> (the channelid may be different) And afterwards shows the Disabling of the electrode channel: *"MaestroChannelSelectController Applied 1 channel updates. Took: 2070 ms"* (times may vary) The following is *NOT* seen: "Rodeo.Engine Unhandled: State: StreamingError Trigger: CleanUpStimulation"

TestStep.Action: Press the Start stimulation button, wait a couple of seconds after it stimulates once then right click on the *"Turned off channel*" and click *"Disable Electrode"* in order to enable it.
TestStep.Result: Chosen Electrode channel visually turns off: Stimulation button becomes Red to *"Stop"* The Log shows that a channel needs to be updated it doesn't. You see the following: *"MaestroChannelSelectController Got 1 updates..."* But not see the following: MaestroChannelSelectController Applied 1 channel updates. Took: 2070 ms (times may vary)

TestStep.Action: Press the "Stop" trigger button.
TestStep.Result: Axis Stops Stimulating, and the stimulation button turns back green. The Log updates and shows the XML for the stimulation: <stimulation no-clean-up="true" xmlns="StimulationSchema.xsd"> <electrical-operations> <achkset channelid="0x00,0x34" command="0x4080" /> </electrical-operations> </stimulation> (the channelid may be different) And afterwards shows the Disabling of the electrode channel: *"MaestroChannelSelectController Applied 1 channel updates. Took: 2070 ms"* (times may vary) The following is *NOT* seen: "Rodeo.Engine Unhandled: State: StreamingError Trigger: CleanUpStimulation"

TestStep.Action: Press Stop play control button to stop streaming.
TestStep.Result: Log shows AxIS returning to idle mode. *"Artichoke.Rodeo Successfully Parked in Idle mode."*

Test.JiraSummary: File Playback includes Impedance Data when present in raw files

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS and Connect to live Source.
TestStep.Result: AxIS closes and reopens. Done.

TestStep.Action: Right Click the Live source and add a Contractility configuration.
TestStep.Result: Configuration has been added. A CBD has been added to the live source.

TestStep.Action: Click on the Experiment Setup Properties.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Set the Maestro to record an AxIS raw file from the drop down menu in continuous streams.
TestStep.Result: Done. AxIS Raw has been set.

TestStep.Action: Open Maestro door manually and Right click on the eject button and select "Keep Door Open".
TestStep.Result: Done. "Keep Door Open" is checked.

TestStep.Action: Click on the Cardiac Beat plot.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Press play.
TestStep.Result: AxIS begins streaming. Offset finishes after about 55 seconds.

TestStep.Action: Press record and while the Maestro is still open try to replicate beats to show up on the plots by tapping on the plate/pins.
TestStep.Result: Plot shows data. In specific areas of the plot.

TestStep.Action: After some waveforms are shown in the plot Press Stop.
TestStep.Result: AxIS discontinues to stream and saves Raw file to the recording folder.

TestStep.Action: Load the newly recorded file into AxIS.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Right click file and select for play/rec.
TestStep.Result: Box to the left of the name turns green. File has been selected.

TestStep.Action: Add a Cardiac Beat Detector and play the file to ensure Beat plot data was recorded.
TestStep.Result: Beat data seen in Cardiac Beat Plots.

TestStep.Action: Remove file from AxIS. Open TAFT and load newly recorded raw file.
TestStep.Result: Done. File loads successfully.

TestStep.Action: Click the Data Sets tab.
TestStep.Result: Shows both Voltage And Impedance having A block Vector each. See Screenshot. !https://xray.cloud.xpand-it.com/api/internal/attachments/9e2f5c3c-5ad7-4cc8-bd9e-0130adf7d07c?inXray=true|width=784,height=535!

TestStep.Result: AxIS closes and reopens.

TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Right click the live source and add a Contractility configuration. Configuration -> Cardiac Real-Time -> Contractility
TestStep.Result: Maestro settings are set to Cardiac: Contractility mode and Cardiac Beat Detector is added to the live source. The activity map, continuous Waveform, and Cardiac Beat plot are added.

TestStep.Action: Attach a Spike Detector to the live source.
TestStep.Result: Done. Spike Plot added.

TestStep.Action: Click on the Cardiac Beat Plot
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Hover over Display zoom controls.
TestStep.Result: Tooltip messages say "Percentage Scale" & "Time scale" for vertical and time zoom controls respectively.

TestStep.Action: Click on the Continuous Waveform Plot.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Hover over Display zoom controls.
TestStep.Result: Tooltip messages say "Percentage Scale" & "Time scale" for vertical and time zoom controls respectively.

TestStep.Action: Click on the Spike Plot
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Hover over Display zoom controls.
TestStep.Result: Tooltip message says "Voltage Scale" vertical amplitude control. Time controls are disabled.

Test.JiraSummary: Turning off different channels does not change which beats are encapsulated/assigned to an electrode

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS Navigator.
TestStep.Result: Done. AxIS resets.

TestStep.Action: Copy locally and load trunk\SoftwareTesting\RAW Files\Contractility\20190111_600801D_CDI_CM2_DIV44_ContractilityTesting_Contractility(000).raw
TestStep.Result: File is loaded.

TestStep.Action: Add a Cardiac Beat Detector to the loaded file.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Open the plate map editor and disable all but 1 electrode. (You can play the file first to guarantee you choose an electrode with beats.)
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Go the the Cardiac Beats Plot and right-click the CBD plot and turn off Averaged Beats.
TestStep.Result: Averaged Beats is unchecked.

TestStep.Action: Press play Wait for the first beat then pause AxIS.
TestStep.Result: AxIS is paused. Beat is seen.

TestStep.Action: View the beat plot value near the vertical line (beat time.
TestStep.Result: The value is very close to zero. See screenshot for example.

TestStep.Action: Copy the plot in a screenshot for reference. Paste it to paint.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Open the plate map editor and change which electrode is disabled.
TestStep.Result: Different electrode is enabled.

TestStep.Action: Click Stop then Play the file again. Pause at the first beat in the new electrode.
TestStep.Result: The new found beat does not exactly match the first beat in the screenshot.

TestStep.Action: View the beat plot value near the vertical line (beat time.
TestStep.Result: The value is very close to zero. See screenshot for example.

Test.JiraSummary: v2.0.1 Quickly play/stop and switching analog modes does not crash neuroface

TestStep.Action: Play AxIS with a live source and open the settings.
TestStep.Result: AxIS plays. Settings is open.

TestStep.Action: Open the debug console.
TestStep.Result: Opens.

TestStep.Action: Set analog mode to Cardiac: Broadband.
TestStep.Result: Done. Begins DC Offset finishes after 55 secs.

TestStep.Action: Play and Stop repeatedly (Up to 20x).
TestStep.Result: No crashes.

TestStep.Action: Add a Spike Detector and select Neural: Spikes and quickly change referencing mode 5 times.
TestStep.Result: No crashes.

TestStep.Action: Quickly switch to a different analog mode and click Apply. Repeat 20+ times. Touch each analog mode.
TestStep.Result: No crashes.

Test.JiraSummary: v2.0.1 - Verify low pass filter on analog modes

TestStep.Action: Connect an M2 and reset AxIS.
TestStep.Result: Connected.

TestStep.Action: Double-click on the Maestro in AxIS and set Analog mode to Neural: Spikes. Enter.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Open the debug console. "Alt-Ctrl-D"
TestStep.Result: Opens.

TestStep.Action: Type "ConfigureLowPass" into the debug console.
TestStep.Result: Reply is "FourKiloHertzLpF" for Artichoke 4A and "ThreeKiloHertzLpF" for Artichoke 4B

TestStep.Action: Record a short raw file, load it and double click it.
TestStep.Result: Digital Low Pass Filter is 4 kHz Kaiser Window for Artichoke 4A and 3 kHz for 4B.

TestStep.Action: Select Maestro for playback and change the analog mode to Field Potentials.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Type "ConfigureLowPass" into the debug console.
TestStep.Result: Reply is "TwoKiloHertzLpF"

TestStep.Action: Record a short raw file, load it and double click it.
TestStep.Result: Digital Low Pass Filter is 2 kHz Kaiser Window.

TestStep.Action: Select Maestro for playback and change the analog mode to Cardiac: Standard.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Type "ConfigureLowPass" into the debug console.
TestStep.Result: Reply is "TwoKiloHertzLpF"

TestStep.Action: Record a short raw file, load it and double click it.
TestStep.Result: Digital Low Pass Filter is 2 kHz Kaiser Window.

TestStep.Action: Select Maestro for playback and change the analog mode to Cardiac: Broadband.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Type "ConfigureLowPass" into the debug console.
TestStep.Result: Reply is "TwoKiloHertzLpF"

TestStep.Action: Record a short raw file, load it and double click it.
TestStep.Result: Digital Low Pass Filter is 2 kHz Kaiser Window.

TestStep.Action: Select Maestro for playback and change the analog mode to Cardiac: LEAP.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Type "ConfigureLowPass" into the debug console.
TestStep.Result: Reply is "TwoKiloHertzLpF"

TestStep.Action: Record a short raw file, load it and double click it.
TestStep.Result: Digital Low Pass Filter is 2 kHz Kaiser Window.

TestStep.Action: Select Maestro for playback and change the analog mode to Cardiac: Contractility.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Type "ConfigureLowPass" into the debug console.
TestStep.Result: Reply is "None"

TestStep.Action: Record a short raw file, load it and double click it.
TestStep.Result: Digital Low Pass Filter is None.

Test.JiraSummary: M2 does not disconnect when docking plate while AxIS is connecting

TestStep.Action: Connect M2 and Reset AxIS Navigator.
TestStep.Result: AxIS resets. M2 connects.

TestStep.Action: Eject plate holder and close AxIS. Place a plate on top of the Maestro.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Launch AxIS and immediately push the Ject button.
TestStep.Result: Plate docks. AxIS starts.

TestStep.Action: Eject the plate holder, close AxIS and restart the M2.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Launch AxIS and wait for the M2 to connect to AxIS. Push the ject button immediately after the M2 connects to AxIS.
TestStep.Result: Plate docks.

TestStep.Action: Eject the plate holder, close AxIS and restart the M2.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Launch AxIS and wait for the M2 to connect to AxIS. When the M2 status light in AxIS begins to flash blue push the ject button repeatedly.
TestStep.Result: Plate docks and undocks repeatedly.

Test.JiraSummary: AxIS doesn't crash pausing non-impedence cardiac file

TestStep.Action: Reset Axis.
TestStep.Result: Done. AxIS closes and reopens.

TestStep.Action: Copy locally and load File trunk\SoftwareTesting\RAW Files\cardiac\5min_Cardiac(000).raw into AxIS Navigator.
TestStep.Result: File loaded.

TestStep.Action: Right click the added file and add the Field Potentials configuration. Configurations->Cardiac Offline->Field Potentials
TestStep.Result: Spontaneous configuration has been added. Cardiac Beat Detector and Statistic compiler have been added as well. See Screenshot.

TestStep.Action: Click on the Cardiac Beat Plot.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Switch to well E3 and press play.
TestStep.Result: After about 7 seconds AxIS begins showing beats.

TestStep.Action: Press pause.
TestStep.Result: User interface freezes and continues to show beats in the plot.

TestStep.Action: Press play.
TestStep.Result: User interface resumes playback and continues to update the plotting for the duration of the file.

Test.JiraSummary: Use standard directory picker for Batch Process Folder macro

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS.
TestStep.Result: Axis Closes and reopens.

TestStep.Action: Create a Batch Process. File->New Batch Process
TestStep.Result: Edit Batch Process Settings menu shows.

TestStep.Action: Click ok in the Batch Proces Settings.
TestStep.Result: Menu closes and disappears. AxIS now shows the selected batch process settings in the window.

TestStep.Action: Click on the Experiment Setup Properties icon.
TestStep.Result: Done. Experiment Setup view is shown.

TestStep.Action: Right Click inside the "Output Filename" input box and select Macros -> Folder...
TestStep.Result: Default/Standard Windows Directory Picker is shown vs old crappy one. See Screenshot.

TestStep.Action: Select Desktop and click OK.
TestStep.Result: Output Filename is C:\Users\cramos\Desktop\[SourceFile]

Test.JiraSummary: Req. Function Generator - Contractility Calculation Verification - Live

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS.
TestStep.Result: Axis Closes and Reopens.

TestStep.Action: Connect to live Source. (I used Maestro Pro).
TestStep.Result: Live source connected.

TestStep.Action: Right click eject button to "keep door open" and insert signal plate into live source.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Right click the live source and change the analog mode to Cardiac: Contractility
TestStep.Result: Done. Settings changed.

TestStep.Action: Connect Analog Discovery 2 function generator to the *Signal plate* and computer.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Open Waveforms and create a Wavegen to test impedance. See *Impedance.png (attached)* for reference or load attached project.
TestStep.Result: Wavegen created. Impedance modulation created.

TestStep.Action: Show All Plate types and Select the Cytoview MEA 24 plate.
TestStep.Result: Done. Plate selected. 16 channels appear in the continuous plot.

TestStep.Action: Press play in AxIS.
TestStep.Result: Axis immediately starts streaming. Finishes Offset in about 55 seconds.

TestStep.Action: Click on the Continuous Waveform plot.
TestStep.Result: Done. While the continuous plot is streaming the output of the wave lengths are normalized are all close to zero. Also the continuous plot isnt showing any noise the waveform is normalized around 40hz.

TestStep.Action: In Waveforms Enable the Modulation and Run.
TestStep.Result: The continuous plot flatlines for brief a second and immediately starts measuring signal from Generator.

TestStep.Action: Use the display zoom toolbar to change the Percentage scale to 2.0%/Div and the Time scale to 200ms/Div
TestStep.Result: Continuous plot shows the Zoom controls functioning properly.The correct impedance measurements based upon the data. 4hz shows 4 peaks respectively. See Screenshots.

TestStep.Action: Click the Experiment Setup Properties.
TestStep.Result: Experiment Setup menu shows in AxIS.

TestStep.Action: Set the continuous Streams to record an Axis Raw file.
TestStep.Result: Done. Record button becomes red and no longer greyed out.

TestStep.Action: Press Record and after about 7 seconds press stop.
TestStep.Result: AxIS records raw file to the recording folder and Stops streaming. AxIS returns to being IDLE

TestStep.Action: In Waveforms press stop.
TestStep.Result: The continuous plot in AxIS flatlines for a sec and then immediately streams again displaying the noise from the live source.

TestStep.Action: Load newly recorded contractility file in AxIS.
TestStep.Result: Done. File loaded.

TestStep.Action: Right click file and select for Play/rec.
TestStep.Result: Done. Box beside Filename becomes Green.

TestStep.Action: Click on the Continuous Waveform plot.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Press play.
TestStep.Result: The continuous plot displays the correct recorded impedance measurements based upon the data. 4hz shows 4 peaks respectively. See Screenshot.

TestStep.Action: Close Axis.
TestStep.Result: Done.

Test.JiraSummary: Change Stim Waveforms during contractility mode

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS Navigator and connect it to a Maestro Pro or Edge.
TestStep.Result: AxIS Closes and Reopens.

TestStep.Action: Right click the Live source open the settings and change to the Cardiac: Contractility analog mode.
TestStep.Result: Done. Analog mode changed.

TestStep.Action: Click on the Stimulation studio.
TestStep.Result: Done. Stimulation Studio Menu opens.

TestStep.Action: Drag a Cardiac Pacing Stimulation to the New Lane A. Set to stimulate *until stopped* every second.. Set active plate to Classic MEA 48
TestStep.Result: Done. Cardiac Pacing node inserted. Stimulation set. Active plate set.

TestStep.Action: Click the * (asterisk), select a electrode to Stimulate and click Apply. *If you're going to use BeyondCompare select electrode 32 to stimulate.*
TestStep.Result: Done. Electrodes being used are traced with a red square.

TestStep.Action: In the Debug Console Type in "savestimulationfile" and Add a path C:\User\[Current User]\Stim.xml
TestStep.Result: Done. File gets save to the path that was provided.

TestStep.Action: Open newly saved .xml file with notepad,a text editor,or IDE. Compare new file with ContractilityStim.xml using beyond compare or similar tool or compare visually. trunk\SoftwareTesting\JIRA Supplemental Files\NAV-2583
TestStep.Result: The xml appears and near the end of the document you should see: Inside the Loop tag: It should have three Delays ** 5 ms (Reads 5000us) ** 5.6 ms (Reads 5600us) ** 2 ms (Reads 2000us) Outside the loop block The final Achkset command should read: <achkset channelid="0xFF,0xFF" command="0x0807"> See Screenshot.

TestStep.Action: Double click the live source to open the Maestro settings. Change to Cardiac: Standard analog mode.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: In the Debug Console Type in "savestimulationfile" and Add a path C:\User\[Current User]\Stim2.xml
TestStep.Result: Done. File gets save to the path that was provided.

TestStep.Action: Open newly saved *Stim2*.xml file with notepad, a text editor, or IDE. Compare new file with nonContractilityStim.xml using beyond compare or similar tool or compare visually. trunk\SoftwareTesting\JIRA Supplemental Files\NAV-2583
TestStep.Result: The xml appears and near the end of the document you should see: Inside the Loop tag: It should have three Delays ** 20 ms(Reads 20000us) ** 20.6 ms(Reads 20600us) ** 10 ms(10000us) Outside the loop tag The final Achkset command should read: <achkset channelid="0xFF,0xFF" command="0x0800"> See Screenshot.

Test.JiraSummary: 2.0.1 - Macro support for recording file paths

TestStep.Action: Connect to a live source and Reset AxIS Navigator.
TestStep.Result: AxIS resets and opens. M2 connects.

TestStep.Action: Dock a plate with a 10 digit barcode or enter debug command "cmdspock fakenextscan 0111111122"
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Clear the Recording Name textbox.
TestStep.Result: Recording Name, Investigator, Description are all blank.

TestStep.Action: Set AxIS to save .raw, uncheck "auto-name file"
TestStep.Result: The textbox displays [Barcode]\[RecordingName]

TestStep.Action: Right click the .raw file name textbox.
TestStep.Result: Under Macros is a list: * Barcode * Date * Investigator * PlateType * RecordingName * StreamName

TestStep.Action: Change the name of the .raw output file: [Barcode]_[Date]_[Investigator]_[PlateType]_[RecordingName]_[StreamName]
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Record a file for 2 seconds.
TestStep.Result: The output file name is \[Barcode]_\[Today's date]\[Plate Type]__ \[_Maestro name_](000).raw \[Barcode] = 1111-1122 when using the fakenextscan command

TestStep.Action: Go back to the Debug Console and enter the Debug command "cmdspock fakenextscan 0311111122" and dock the plate
TestStep.Result: Done. Active plate changes to "Classic MEA 48 AccuSpot"

TestStep.Action: Record a file for 2 seconds.

TestStep.Action: Record a file for 2 seconds.
TestStep.Result: The output file name is: \[Barcode]_\[Today's Date]E-Stim+ Classic MEA 48___\[Maestro name]_(000 ).raw \[Barcode] = 1111-1122 when using the spoofbarcode command
