Test.JiraSummary: Req. Oscilloscope Verify Voltage Ramp And Hold for PEDOT plating

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Go to Stimulation Studio Module (Electrical) and verify no Ramp pulse node exists.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Open the debug console (CTRL_ALT_D) and type "devmode true".
TestStep.Result: Ramp pulse appears in electrical stim studio.

TestStep.Action: Go to Stimulation Studio (Electrical). Copy locally the ramp configuration Trunk \Software Testing\JIRA Supplemental Files\NAV-2532\NAV-2532.sswf .Then click File-> Open Stim Wave Form and add the copied file.
TestStep.Result: The File is uploaded. Configuration is in place and the electrodes are highlighted and ready to be stimulated See screenshot.

TestStep.Action: Connect an Oscilloscope to the live source, insert a current plate into the maestro.
TestStep.Result: Oscilloscope and current plate is connected

TestStep.Action: On the Oscilloscope set vertical trigger to 500mV and the Horizontal trigger at 50.0%.
TestStep.Result: Triggers have been set

TestStep.Action: Click on the continuous waveform plot in AxIS, change the plate to Classic MEA 48 and press play.
TestStep.Result: Waveforms stream and the Trigger button is now enabled (green).

TestStep.Action: Go to the "Trigger" menu on the oscilloscope and set it to normal.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Press Trigger in AxIS
TestStep.Result: The selected wells stimulate and the corresponding wave is shown on the Oscilloscope.See Screenshot.

TestStep.Action: Press the "Cursor" button on the Oscilloscope in order to measure the points on the waves.
TestStep.Result: Cursor functions appear on the right side of the Oscilloscope. See screenshot.

TestStep.Action: Make sure "H Bars are selected" (in order to test the horizontal). and Press Menu off to close menu.
TestStep.Result: H Bar is selected. Menu closes

TestStep.Action: Use the top left hand corner knob and select button to measure from the Zero (X-axis) to the lowest point of the graph.
TestStep.Result: From the Zero point to the lowest point the measure should be -750 mV.

TestStep.Action: Use the top left hand corner knob and select button to measure from the Zero (X-axis) to the highest point of the graph.
TestStep.Result: From the Zero point to the highest point the measure should be 750 mV.

TestStep.Action: Press the "Cursor" button on the Oscilloscope in order to measure the points on the waves.
TestStep.Result: Cursor functions appear on the right side of the Oscilloscope.

TestStep.Action: Choose "V-Bars" and press the Menu off button
TestStep.Result: Vertical bars are selected and the side menu disappears.

TestStep.Action: Use the top left hand corner knob and select button to measure from lowest point of the ramp to the top of the slope.
TestStep.Result: From those two points the measure should read close to 3s.

TestStep.Action: Use the top left hand corner knob and select button to measure from the top of the ramp to the end of the graph (hold time). (Steady Line at the top of Ramp after the slope).
TestStep.Result: From those two Point the measure should read close to 2s.

TestStep.Action: Click and switch to the LEAP Setup
TestStep.Result: LEAP Display shows.

TestStep.Action: Click the lock
TestStep.Result: The Lock Unlocks to allow user to change settings.

TestStep.Action: Select either the day of the week, month, day, year, hour, minute, or second item in the induction date box.
TestStep.Result: Which ever is clicked will be highlighted in blue. see screen shot.

TestStep.Action: Click on one of the up or down arrows to change the selected item. To change it once.
TestStep.Result: The selected time increases or decreases as expected.

TestStep.Action: Click the same arrow again.
TestStep.Result: Again, The selected time increases or decreases as expected.

TestStep.Action: Click on the rightmost arrow (facing downward) to open the calendar menu connected to the Induction Date box
TestStep.Result: Calendar menu shows. See Screenshot.

TestStep.Action: At the bottom of the Calendar menu click on either the hour or the minutes item. (displayed in military time (24-hour clock))
TestStep.Result: Which ever is clicked will be highlighted blue. See screen shot.

TestStep.Action: Click on one of the up or down arrows to change the selected item. To change it once.
TestStep.Result: The selected time increases or decreases as expected.

TestStep.Action: Click on the same arrow again.
TestStep.Result: Again, The selected time increases or decreases as expected.

Test.JiraSummary: Artifact Eliminator blanks non-stimulated wells

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS Navigator and connect to a Maestro.
TestStep.Result: AxIS resets.

TestStep.Action: Add two Stimulation Inspectors to the live source, one after an Artifact Eliminator, with 5ms pre and 10 ms post settings.
TestStep.Result: Done. See screenshot.

TestStep.Action: Dock a plate. Go to the Stimulation Studio module and set the plate type to match.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Add Neural (brain) pulse node and set stim studio to stimulate once.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Select channel14 from the side menu connected to the wells, and also select well A1 then press apply.
TestStep.Result: Done. See screenshot.

TestStep.Action: Click Spike plots menu and Click play.
TestStep.Result: Maestro streams. Trigger button is enabled.

TestStep.Action: In the Spikes Plot menu, zoom to 20 uV / Div and Click the Trigger button.
TestStep.Result: Well A1, channel 14 has the purple trace, which follows the Stimulation Inspector AFTER the Artifact Eliminator, blanked to 0V starting at 5 ms. See screenshot.

TestStep.Action: View any electrode other than the stimulating electrode, such as A1-11.This electrode is in the stimulated well but it's not stimulated.
TestStep.Result: Instead of being blanked from the trigger point the purple trace after the Artifact eliminator roughly follows the orange signal from approximately the 7.2 ms mark. There is some variation due to median subtracting. The blanking does not also have to be at the 0 V mark. It happens at the last known voltage. It just needs to be flat. See Screenshot.

TestStep.Action: Go to any other well but A1. View any electrode.
TestStep.Result: The purple and orange traces are on top of each other before and after the blanking period. See screenshot.

Test.JiraSummary: Stim studio produces conditional XML for different amounts of BioCircuit paddles being stimulated

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS Navigator.
TestStep.Result: AxIS resets and restarts.

TestStep.Action: Go to Stimulation Studio and add a Cardiac Pacing node to lane A.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Click on View -> Show All Plate Types.
TestStep.Result: A list of plate types is now available.

TestStep.Action: Select a BioCircuit MEA 24 plate.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Open debug console and type 'savestimulationfile c:\TempFolder\24.xml' <Enter>. (TempFolder being the folder created by the user for saving the newly created xml files)
TestStep.Result: 24.xml is created inside created TempFolder.

TestStep.Action: Change the stimulation to only stimulate 13 paddles. Then go to the debug console and type 'savestimulationfile c:\TempFolder\13.xml' <Enter>.
TestStep.Result: 13.xml is created inside the created TempFolder.

TestStep.Action: Change the stimulation to only stimulate 12 paddles. Then go to the debug console and type 'savestimulationfile c:\TempFolder\12.xml' <Enter>.

TestStep.Action: Compare 1.xml and 12.xml files.

TestStep.Action: Compare 13.xml and 24.xml files.
TestStep.Result: 13.xml and 24.xml contain the inverse: <dacset dacid="stimvoltage_0" dacvoltage="800 mV" /> <delay duration="10000us" /> <tag> <stimulation> <loaddacs /> <dacset dacid="stimvoltage_0" dacvoltage="-0.8 V" />

Test.JiraSummary: Date Macro increments correctly along with the file index

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS Navigator and connect an M2.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Set AxIS Navigator to re-record raw files from a file.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Change the file name to the Date macro only.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Record a small file.
TestStep.Result: File name is date(000).raw. e.g. 20210127(000).raw

TestStep.Action: Change the the time zone to the future so the date increases on the PC. (UTC+14:00 Kiritimati Island) Restart Navigator
TestStep.Result: Date on the PC increases by one day. Navigator restarts

TestStep.Action: Record again.
TestStep.Result: File name is date+1(000).raw. When Navigator restarts, it detects the new date and uses it in the file name

TestStep.Action: * Delete the raw files, reset the iterator by checking/unchecking the Auto-Name box. * Reset the time zone. * Restart Navigator
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Start recording again
TestStep.Result: File date(000).raw starts recording.

TestStep.Action: While recording, change the the time zone to the future so the date increases on the PC.
TestStep.Result: PC date is date+1.

TestStep.Action: Stop recording and start recording again.
TestStep.Result: New file name is date(001).raw. Recording does not use date of the new time zone.

TestStep.Action: * Delete the raw files, * reset the iterator by checking/unchecking the Auto-Name box. * reset the time zone. * Restart Navigator
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Setup Scheduled Recording to record a raw file every minute for 30 seconds. Start Schedule Recording and let it record two files.
TestStep.Result: Files created are named date(000).raw and date(001).raw.

TestStep.Action: After the second file is recorded change the the time zone to the future so the date increases on the PC.
TestStep.Result: Date on the PC increases by one day.

TestStep.Action: Schedule Recording records again.
TestStep.Result: File name is date(002).raw. The new date is not used by Navigator for the file name

TestStep.Action: Stop Scheduled Recording. Delete the raw files, reset the iterator by checking/unchecking the Auto-Name box. and reset the time zone.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Start Scheduled Recording again.
TestStep.Result: File date(000).raw starts recording.

TestStep.Action: Stop the scheduled recording Reset AxIS Navigator.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Copy locally and load trunk\SoftwareTesting\JIRA Supplemental Files\NAV-2482\5by5_pulse_swwf.
TestStep.Result: Biphasic pulse node inside x5 loop is loaded. Stimulating 5 times every 5 seconds. Smart Plate - Edge.

TestStep.Action: Click Start to start stimulating and view the oscilloscope.
TestStep.Result: A train of 25 1-second pulses is displayed with measurements of 1-volt pk-pk and 1-second period.

TestStep.Action: Set the stimulation to "until stopped" and click Start. View oscilloscope.
TestStep.Result: An *endless* train pulses is displayed with measurements of 1-volt pk-pk and 1-second period. (Make sure is more than 25 pulses.)

TestStep.Action: Stop Stimulation. Set stimulation to exactly 5 times, once every 5 seconds. Delete loop. Start stimulation.
TestStep.Result: A train of 5 pulses is displayed with measurements of 1-volt pk-pk and 5-second period.

TestStep.Action: Copy locally and load trunk\SoftwareTesting\JIRA Supplemental Files\NAV-2482\5by6_cardiac_swwf.
TestStep.Result: Cardiac pacing node inside x5 loop is loaded. Stimulating 5 times every 6 seconds. Smart Plate - Edge.

TestStep.Action: Click Start to start stimulating and view the oscilloscope.
TestStep.Result: A train of 25 pulses is displayed (5x1-second pulses followed by 1 second at 0V, times 5.) with measurements of approximately 1.6-volt pk-pk and 1-second period.

TestStep.Action: Set the stimulation to "until stopped" and click Start. View oscilloscope.
TestStep.Result: An *endless* train of pulses (5x1 second pulses followed by 1 second at 0V) is displayed with measurements of approximately 1.6-volt pk-pk and 1-second period. (Make sure to count at least 6 groups of 5 pulses.)

TestStep.Action: Stop stimulation. Set stimulation to exactly 5 times, once every 6 seconds. Delete loop. Start stimulation.
TestStep.Result: A train of 5x, 1-second pulses followed by 5 seconds at 0V) is displayed with measurements of approximately1.6-volt pk-pk and a period of 6 seconds.

TestStep.Action: Copy locally and load trunk\SoftwareTesting\JIRA Supplemental Files\NAV-2482\5by6_neural_swwf.
TestStep.Result: Cardiac pacing node inside x5 loop is loaded. Stimulating 5 times every 6 seconds. Smart Plate - Edge.

TestStep.Action: Click Start to start stimulating and view the oscilloscope.
TestStep.Result: A train of 25 pulses is displayed (5x1-second pulses followed by 1 second at 0V times 5.) with measurements of 1-volt pk-pk and 1-second period.

TestStep.Action: Set the stimulation to "until stopped" and click Start. View oscilloscope.
TestStep.Result: An *endless* train of pulses (5x1 second pulses followed by 1 second at 0V) is displayed with measurements of 1-volt pk-pk and 1-second period. (Count at least 30 pulses.)

TestStep.Action: Stop stimulating. Set stimulation to exactly 5 times, once every 6 seconds. Delete loop. Start stimulation.
TestStep.Result: A train of 5x 1-second pulses followed by 5 seconds at 0V) is displayed with measurements of 1-volt pk-pk and 6-second period.

Test.JiraSummary: Compare Cardiac output files - same or better

TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Result: A Digital filter,a Cardiac Beat Detector and a Cardiac Statistics Compiler are added. See screenshot for settings.

Test.JiraSummary: AchkSineTest works after stimulation

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS Navigator and connect an M2. (With a good DDS chip.)
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Start streaming in Cardiac Standard analog mode with or without plate engaged. Zoom to 2 mV/Div and 500 us/Div
TestStep.Result: AxIS streams.

TestStep.Action: Open debug console and type: "AchkSineTest -v 10 -f 1000 -i 1000"
TestStep.Result: You should see 10 mVpp 1KHz sine wave on all channels. You may have to alter the zoom levels to see them. If your Maestro has a bad DDS, then the waves will not appear.

TestStep.Action: Enter command "AchkSineTest off"
TestStep.Result: Signal stops

TestStep.Action: Run any stimulation. You can either do it in Stimulation Studio or using XML file.
TestStep.Result: Stimulation is completed. After stimulation, there are no sine waves.

TestStep.Action: Go back to the debug console and type: "AchkSineTest -v 10 -f 1000 -i 1000"
TestStep.Result: You should see 10 mVpp 1KHz sine wave on all channels.

TestStep.Action: Enter command "AchkSineTest off"
TestStep.Result: Signal stops

Test.JiraSummary: Offset Correction does not roll back in Broadband or LEAP analog modes

TestStep.Action: Connect a Maestro to AxIS. Reset.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: While the Maestro is stopped, change the analog mode to Cardiac Broadband.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Hit play, and carefully watch the offset correction, particularly between seconds 20-30.
TestStep.Result: Offset correction smoothly crawls across the playbar. It never goes back, only forwards. At second 25, there is no sudden jerk back in offset correction.

TestStep.Action: Stop playback. Change the analog mode to Cardiac LEAP.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Hit play, and carefully watch offset correction.
TestStep.Result: Offset correction smoothly crawls across the playbar. It never goes back, only forwards. At second 70, there is no sudden jerk back in offset correction.

Test.JiraSummary: Environmental data output CSV file for live sources

TestStep.Action: Close AxIS. Reboot your Maestro. Reset AxIS. Dock a plate if there isn't already one.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Click the continuous stream file output combobox.
TestStep.Result: There is the option to output Environmental Data.

TestStep.Action: Click it.
TestStep.Result: Environmental Data is set to be output

TestStep.Action: Navigate to the scheduled recording module. Set a one time recording to last 60 seconds.
TestStep.Result: Done. "Start Schedule" button is enabled.

TestStep.Action: Click Start Schedule.
TestStep.Result: Offset correction begins, then recording.

TestStep.Action: About 20 seconds into the recording, change the temperature value and the CO2 value.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: 40 seconds into the recording, turn off the heater and the gas.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Wait for the recording to finish.
TestStep.Result: A CSV file is output.

TestStep.Action: Open the CSV.
TestStep.Result: "Time (s)" column spans from 1 to 59. "Heater Enabled" is TRUE until ~second 40 "Heater Set Point (°C)" is 37 until sometime around second 20. "Plate Temperature (°C)" seems accurate--temp should change slightly sometime after second 20. "Gas Mixer Enabled" is TRUE until ~second 4- "CO2 Set Point (% CO₂)" is 5 until ~second 20 "CO2 Concentration (% CO₂)" column is the last one. It is probably blank because you have no gas.

TestStep.Action: Reboot to Maestro to reset heater and gas controls. Reset AxIS as well.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Remove the docked plate.
TestStep.Result: CO2 control turns off.

TestStep.Action: Open the debug console.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Set AxIS to output an Environmental Data file.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Navigate to scheduled recording and set up a 60 second recording.
TestStep.Result: Done. Start Schedule button is enabled.

TestStep.Action: * Dock the plate. * Start the schedule.
TestStep.Result: Offset correction starts, after that, recording begins.

TestStep.Action: 30 seconds into recording, make a note of the maestro's current temperature. Enter the command "heater -c 47"
TestStep.Result: AxIS thinks the Maestro has overheated. Heater is forcibly turned off.

TestStep.Action: Count to 3 seconds, then reset the heater back to what it originally was using heater -c again.
TestStep.Result: Done, heater has returned to its original value, but it does not turn back on.

TestStep.Action: Wait for the recording to finish.
TestStep.Result: A CSV file is output.

TestStep.Action: Open it.
TestStep.Result: Time (s) column shows 1-59. Heater Enabled is true until the temperature jumps (heater may shut off one second before the temp changes) Heater Temp appears to be accurate across the recording. Gas Mixer Enabled is false for the enter file.

TestStep.Result: File is loaded.

TestStep.Action: Set the file to output Environmental Data.
TestStep.Result: The option is not available

Test.JiraSummary: Maestro reconnects after PC wakes from hibernation

TestStep.Action: Connect your maestro to AxIS.
TestStep.Result: It is connected.

TestStep.Action: IF hibernation is not enabled on your PC: # Open a command window prompt as admin # Enter command "powercfg.exe /hibernate on"
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Put your computer on hibernate. Wait 30 seconds.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Wake up the PC again.
TestStep.Result: The maestro eventually reconnects to AxIS. The Maestro may have a different IP address and AxIS may ask user to repair network connection, but it is OK. *Note:* The issue can sometimes be reproduced ONLY with PCMCIA adapter. It disconnects after reconnecting and reconnects again, but it always reconnects.

TestStep.Action: IF hibernation was not enabled on your PC: # Open a command window prompt as admin # Enter command "powercfg.exe /hibernate off"
TestStep.Result: Done.

Test.JiraSummary: Accelerate Playback and Accelerate Recording menu items

TestStep.Result: There is one popup menu item called "Accelerated Recording" and it is enabled and checked.

TestStep.Action: Click record.
TestStep.Result: Recording is accelerated.

TestStep.Action: While recording is still occurring, right click the record button and click Accelerated Recording.
TestStep.Result: Recording now happens at 1x (not accelerated) speed.

TestStep.Action: While recording is still occurring, right click the record button and click Accelerated Recording.
TestStep.Result: Recording is accelerated again.

Test.JiraSummary: Verify Remove Offset feature of Cardiac Beat plots

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS Navigator.
TestStep.Result: AxIS starts.

TestStep.Action: Load Cardiac file [trunk.axionbio.com|http://trunk.axionbio.com]\SoftwareTesting\HashedTestFiles\Cardiac\axion.demo.cardiac.raw
TestStep.Result: File loads.

TestStep.Action: * Add a Field Potentials configuration. * Switch to the Cardiac Beat Plots.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Play until you see a beat. Then Right-Click -> Copy Electrode Waveform.
TestStep.Result: The beat is evenly distributed around the 0V horizontal line.

TestStep.Action: Paste to Excel. Select all samples and view the average in the bottom bar.
TestStep.Result: The average value should be tiny. Near 0V.

TestStep.Action: Right-Click on the electrode and un-check/disable Remove Offset.
TestStep.Result: Done. If the file is still playing notice the beats are offset from the 0V horizontal line. Not evenly distributed.

TestStep.Action: Play again from the beginning until you see a beat. Then Right-Click -> Copy Electrode Waveform.
TestStep.Result: The beat is offset from the 0V horizontal line. Not evenly distributed.

TestStep.Action: Paste to Excel. Select all samples and view the average in the bottom bar.
TestStep.Result: Average is much farther away from 0 than the offset value.

TestStep.Action: Pause AxIS Navigator while streaming and beats are plotted. Right-Click -> Copy Electrode Waveform while paused.
TestStep.Result: Notice the beat is offset from the 0V horizontal line. Not evenly distributed.

TestStep.Action: Paste to Excel. Select all samples and view the average in the bottom bar.
TestStep.Result: Take note of the average.

TestStep.Action: Right-Click on the same electrode and check/enable Remove Offset.
TestStep.Result: Notice the beat is evenly distributed around the 0V horizontal line.

TestStep.Action: Copy/Paste to Excel. Select all samples and view the average in the bottom bar.
TestStep.Result: The average is a lot closer to 0 V than the previous one.

Test.JiraSummary: Neural gain remains consistent after switching from Cardiac to Neural mode

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS. Connect to a live source with a plate and set to Cardiac: LEAP. Play.
TestStep.Result: Offset correction starts and completes.

TestStep.Action: Take note of the RMS values once offset correction is complete.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Open the debug console and open the SOS tree to KirkSosRoot -> Devices -> SpockSosRoot -> Data Acquisition -> Active Analog Mode.
TestStep.Result: SosRoot is open.

TestStep.Action: Stop playing.
TestStep.Result: AxIS Navigator stops.

TestStep.Action: Having the M2 Pro stopped in LEAP mode, opening the Maestro settings and click on Neural Spikes but DON'T press OK.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Click play and immediately click OK on the settings panel. Notice the Active Analog mode changes. Notice the RMS values.
TestStep.Result: The Active Analog Mode changes quickly to Neural: Spikes. It doesn't go through the various Cardiac modes of the LEAP stepping process. Offset correction does not restart. It finishes quickly (much less than 60 seconds.) The RMS values are different from Cardiac: LEAP and correspond to a high-gain mode.

TestStep.Action: Wait until offset correction completes.
TestStep.Result: After offset correction completes it should go into Neural: Spikes. Notice that RMS values correspond to a high-gain mode. At no time during the first minute of playback does gain change. It remains the same. There is no spike in signal and RMS values *DO NOT* increase to something consistent with low-gain mode. It remains consistent to high gain mode.

Test.JiraSummary: LEAP analog mode play -> stop -> play works

TestStep.Action: Set the Maestro's analog mode to LEAP.
TestStep.Result: Maestro is ready to stream.

TestStep.Action: Hit play, then wait ten seconds.
TestStep.Result: AxIS Navigator streams. Ten seconds has passed.

TestStep.Action: Hit stop. Then immediately hit play.
TestStep.Result: The maestro starts streaming normally.

TestStep.Action: Repeat steps 2 & 3 ten times.
TestStep.Result: Streaming is never halted prematurely.

Test.JiraSummary: Digital Board Provisioning Test

TestStep.Action: Copy firmware files (BOOT.BIN, spock.ub) into the blank micro SD card. Ensure that the recovery firmware version is the one that's being tested.
TestStep.Result: Create a recovery firmware micro SD card.

TestStep.Action: Install or upgrade AxIS Navigator to the latest version.
TestStep.Result: Install or upgrade AxIS Navigator to the latest version.

TestStep.Action: Plug in the jumper to connect the green and any black wire on the 20/24-pin connector of the computer power supply. Do not power the supply until you are instructed to do so. Reference work instruction step 5.1.1. - 5.1.4 for pictures.
TestStep.Result: Short circuit green and any black wires on the 20/24-pin connector.

TestStep.Action: Open the Transmogrifier and click "Help" > "Install Drivers" on the menu bar. This will install the digital board driver. Make sure to click "Yes" button when you see the UAC popup. You should see a success message after that. Contact Advanced Development if you see a stack trace window. Reference work instruction step 5.2.1. - 5.1.6 for more help.
TestStep.Result: Install the digital board driver.

TestStep.Action: Connect USB cable (type A to B) to PC and the digital board. Reference work instruction step 5.3.1. - 5.3.4 for more help.
TestStep.Result: Connect PC and the digital board via USB cable.

TestStep.Action: Connect 4-pin 12V power cable to the digital board. Reference work instruction step 5.3.5 for a picture.
TestStep.Result: Connect power to the digital board.

TestStep.Action: Insert the recovery micro SD card that you created in step 1 into the digital board.
TestStep.Result: Insert the recovery card to the micro SD card slot on the digital board.

TestStep.Action: Turn on or power the power supply. You should see the digital board lighting up.
TestStep.Result: Digital board powered up.

TestStep.Action: Click "M2 Digital Board" tab on the Transmogrifier and wait until the connection status changes to "Connected". This can take up to 10 minutes. Once the Transmogrifier is connected to the digital board, ensure that the tab title is "M2 Digital Board - M2 Digital Board (Recovery Mode)" and the boot device is "SD Card". Reference work instruction step 5.4.3 for the Transmogrifier screenshot.
TestStep.Result: Transmogrifier connected to the digital board in recovery (SD card) mode.

TestStep.Action: In the upper left corner, click "File" -> "Preferences" and locate "Recovery M2 Digital Board Firmware" setting. Set the "Recovery M2 Digital Board Firmware" Path to the directory that you have the recovery firmware that you are testing.
TestStep.Result: Set recovery firmware path in Transmogrifier.

TestStep.Action: Click "Upload Recovery Firmware" button on the Transmogrifier. You should see "Please reboot the M2 Digital board manually to reconnect ..." once the upload is done.
TestStep.Result: Upload recovery firmware to the EEPROM.

TestStep.Action: Hold down the “RESCUE BOOT” button and press the “POR” (Power On Reset) button on the digital board to boot from the EEPROM. Reference work instruction step 5.4.6. for locations of the buttons.
TestStep.Result: Digital board powered up. There is no way to find out whether the digital board is booting in recovery mode until it is connected to the Transmogrifier.

TestStep.Action: Wait until Transmogrifier is connected to the digital board. Once connected, ensure that the tab title is “M2 Digital Board – M2 Digital Board (Recovery Mode)” and Boot device is “QSPI Flash”. Reference work instruction step 5.4.8. for Transmogrifier screenshot.
TestStep.Result: Digital board connected to the Transmogrifier in recovery (QSPI flash) mode

TestStep.Action: In the upper left corner of the Transmogrifier, click “File” -> “Preferences” and locate “Regular M2 Digital Board Firmware” setting. Set the "Regular M2 Digital Board Firmware" path to "C:\Program Files\Axion BioSystems, Inc\AxIS Navigator\Firmware\M2" or the M2 firmware path if different.
TestStep.Result: Set regular digital board firmware path to AxIS firmware directory.

TestStep.Action: Click “Upload Firmware” button. Once regular firmware upload is done, the digital board will reboot. This action will overwrite the recovery micro SD card.
TestStep.Result: Upload firmware successfully then digital board automatically reboots.

TestStep.Action: Once the digital board is rebooted and Transmogrifier is connected, ensure that the tab title is “M2 Digital Board – M2 Digital Board (Recovery Mode)” and Boot device is “QSPI Flash”. Then Press “POR” (Power On Reset) button.
TestStep.Result: Digital board connected to the Transmogrifier in recovery (QSPI flash) mode and digital board resets on POR.

TestStep.Action: Once booted and connected, ensure that the tab title is “M2 Digital Board – M2 Digital Board (Normal Mode)” and Boot device is “SD Card”.
TestStep.Result: Digital board connected to the Transmogrifier in normal mode.

TestStep.Action: Locate the serial number sticker on the digital board and type it into “Serial Number” text box on the left and select proper “Hardware Revision”. Then click "Serailize" button. You should see "Serialize succeeded" message on the log window and the digital board will reboot.
TestStep.Result: See serialization success message on Transmogrifier and digital board reboots.

TestStep.Action: Once the digital board is connected, verify “Serial Number”, “Hardware Revision” and “Manufacturing Date” on the status page of the Transmogrifier (right).
TestStep.Result: Serialization data is correct.

TestStep.Action: Hold down the “RESCUE BOOT” button and press the “POR” (Power On Reset) button on the digital board to boot from the EEPROM. Reference work instruction step 5.4.6. for locations of the buttons.
TestStep.Result: Digital board powered up. There is no way to find out whether the digital board is booting in recovery mode until it is connected to the Transmogrifier.

TestStep.Action: Once the digital board is connected, verify that the tab title is "M2 Digital Board - M2 Digital Board (Recovery mode)" and Boot device is "QSPI Flash". Then verify “Serial Number”, “Hardware Revision” and “Manufacturing Date” on the status page of the Transmogrifier (right).
TestStep.Result: Digital board connected to Transmogrifier in recovery (QSPI Flash) mode. Serialization data is correct.

TestStep.Action: Click "Testing" tab then select “Memory Test” from the drop-down menu and click “Run Test” button. Memory test should take about 45 minutes and you should see a message "Beginning Memory Test" on the log window.
TestStep.Result: See "Beginning Memory Test" message on the log window.

TestStep.Action: When the test is successfully completed, you should see “Test completed successfully” on the log window.
TestStep.Result: See "Test completed successfully" message on the log window.

Test.JiraSummary: Stimulation reference currents are correct

TestStep.Action: Get the latest version of Scotty.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Open it up and paste the following stimulation into the left side panel: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <stimulation xmlns="StimulationSchema.xsd" lumos-reference-current="329"> <channelarray id="1" mapping="LinearSixWell"> <channel electrode="A,2,1,8" /> <!--<channel electrode="B,2,1,8" />--> </channelarray> <electrical-operations> <dacsetmultistep dacid="ArtichokeIV_PreHP" setting-start="0x2FFC" setting-end="0x2510" numsteps="20" stepduration="50 µs" interpolationtype="Linear" /> </electrical-operations> </stimulation>
TestStep.Result: Info is pasted.

TestStep.Action: Click Stimulation -> Run Stimulation
TestStep.Result: Stimulation data is output on the right side.

TestStep.Action: In the table of data, look at the Artichoke Command column.
TestStep.Result: The commands are NOT all the same. None of them are "0xFFC20000".

Test.JiraSummary: Screen dims in 30 minutes, does not induce noise

TestStep.Action: *This test takes over 30 minutes.* Connect an M2 Pro to AxIS Navigator and reset.
TestStep.Result: Done. M2 connects.

TestStep.Action: Load a shipping plate. Set devmode true and change plate type to Artichoke View 12.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Play in Neural analog mode WITHOUT Median Noise Subtraction. Zoom out to 5 uV/Div and 10/s/Div. Notice the continuous plot in well U8.
TestStep.Result: AxIS Navigator streams. Continuous plot looks fine.

TestStep.Action: Dim the screen with the following command in the debug console: cmdkirk setbacklightbrightness 5
TestStep.Result: Continuous plot does not become extra noisy. No sudden spikes or change in amplitude in channels.

TestStep.Action: Dim the screen further with the following command in the debug console: cmdkirk setbacklightbrightness 0
TestStep.Result: Continuous plot goes back to normal. Less noisy.

TestStep.Action: Reset the screen brightness. (via command: cmdkirk setbacklightbrightness 255)
TestStep.Result: Continuous plot still normal.

TestStep.Action: Set a schedule recording to begin recording 4 minutes of raw starting in 28 minutes. Start scheduled recording and leave M2 streaming.
TestStep.Result: The screen dims after 30 minutes. Scheduled recording stops 2 minutes after that.

TestStep.Action: View recorded raw file.
TestStep.Result: The signals are the same across the entire ~2 minute recording. Dimming the screen caused no extra noise.

Test.JiraSummary: Disabling and re-enabling electrodes is correctly displayed while plotting

TestStep.Action: Copy 48_Well_Neural_Demo(000).raw from TRUNK\SoftwareTesting\RAW Files\neural and load it into AxIS.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Switch to the continuous plot and zoom out to 5 s/Div.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Start playing. Wait 8 seconds, then disable the electrode.
TestStep.Result: The electrode does not plot any new points, the stream appears frozen.

TestStep.Action: Wait another 8 seconds, then re-enable the electrode.
TestStep.Result: The stream starts plotting at the exact point that it's plotting the rest of the data. And then continues to fill to the right until the plot fills the window and then scrolls left. (This means the gap in the waveform accurately represents how long the electrode was disabled)

TestStep.Action: When you arrive in the morning, check Navigator.exe's memory.

Test.JiraSummary: Req. RIGOL Beats with periods close to the max period do no cause errors

TestStep.Action: Dock a signal plate to an M2 and connect a signal generator to the plate.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: In AxIS, attach a CBD and change the analog mode to Cardiac Standard. Set AxIS to output a Raw file.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Open the CBD. Set the Max Beat Period to 1 s. Click OK.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Press play. After a few seconds, press stop.
TestStep.Result: Playback is stopped.

TestStep.Action: Set up the function generator's signal. Set the wave to "Sine" and set the period to 990 ms. Set the voltage to 5 Vpp.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Start the function generator output. In AxIS, hit record.
TestStep.Result: After offset correction finishes, you can see the sine waves in the continuous plot.

TestStep.Action: Turn up and down the period on the function generator. Go as low as 900 ms and as high as 1100 seconds. Do this for 30 seconds.
TestStep.Result: The continuous plot waveform corresponds to the function generator inputs.

TestStep.Action: Stop the function generator, and stop playback. Get a support bundle and open kirk.wedding.log.
TestStep.Result: There are no errors that read "Event Sent too late" or "Got Event too late".

Test.JiraSummary: Processing nodes do not leak memory

TestStep.Action: Open AxIS, and either connect a Maestro or load any file.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Open up the Task Manager, look at the Processes tab and make a note of Axion.AxIS.exe's current memory.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Open the node back up by double clicking it.
TestStep.Result: The settings window opens.

TestStep.Action: Close the node by clicking "cancel"

Test.JiraSummary: SetLeapThreshold Debug Console Command

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS Navigator.
TestStep.Result: AxIS Navigator restarts.

TestStep.Action: Copy locally and load trunk\SoftwareTesting\JIRA Supplemental Files\NAV-1647\NAV-1647.raw.
TestStep.Result: File loads.

TestStep.Action: Go to the debug console and click on the Software tab. Check "Include Low Frequencies in Noise Estimates".
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: In the debug console type `setleapthreshold`
TestStep.Result: Result: _LEAP detection threshold is controlled by software settings (Standard = 150 µV, High = 50 µV)_ This is the default.

TestStep.Action: View Continuous Plot and click Play.
TestStep.Result: +LEAPed electrodes:+ * All RMS values on the left half of the plot are below 150uv. * All are above 25 uV except electrode 22

TestStep.Action: Switch to the CBD Plot module and Click Play.
TestStep.Result: No LEAP beats are detected on the left side of the plot.

TestStep.Action: Type `setleapthreshold 25` in the debug console.
TestStep.Result: Result: Success: Signals are now LEAP if their full-band RMS is over 25 uV.

TestStep.Action: Click Play again and view the CBD Plot.
TestStep.Result: LEAP beats are detected on the left side in all except electrode 22.

TestStep.Action: Type 'setleapthreshold 0' in the debug console
TestStep.Result: Result: Success: LEAP detection threshold returning to software settings (Normal = 150 µV, High = 50 µV)

Test.JiraSummary: LEAP Detection threshold command - file

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS Navigator .
TestStep.Result: AxIS Navigator restarts.

TestStep.Action: From trunk\SoftwareTesting\JIRA Supplemental Files\NAV-1639, copy and load NAV-1639.raw and apply NAV-1639.datastreams. (It is a Cardiac Offline LEAP with the Stats compiler removed and the CBD LEAP Detection set to High Sensitivity.

TestStep.Result: Result: Low Threshold Multiplier: 0.15 These is the default.

TestStep.Action: Go to debug console and type `cardiacthreshold -h`.
TestStep.Result: Result: Low Threshold Multiplier: 0.6 This is the default.

TestStep.Action: Go to debug console and type `cardiacthreshold -h 0.6`.
TestStep.Result: Result: HighThreshold multiplier: 0.6

TestStep.Action: Go to debug console and type `cardiacthreshold -v false`.

Test.JiraSummary: LEAP works after prior action - stimulation or streaming

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS Navigator and connect an M2.
TestStep.Result: AxIS Navigator resets and recognizes the M2.

TestStep.Action: Set "Devmode true".
TestStep.Result: Success.

TestStep.Action: Put AxIS in Cardiac: LEAP analog mode and play.
TestStep.Result: AxIS goes through offset correction and plays.

TestStep.Action: Wait until the maestro has streamed for 2 minutes. Perform a short 15 second stimulation.
TestStep.Result: Stimulation is performed.

TestStep.Action: Start a LEAP induction.
TestStep.Result:
"Setting up LEAP. Induction will start shortly." message appears immediately after pressing the Start Induction button.
LEAP channels look like they are being LEAP-ed. Unleaped chanels do not get grounded.

TestStep.Action: Abort the LEAP Induction.
TestStep.Result: Done. LEAP stops.

TestStep.Action: Wait for the channel electrodes to recover.
TestStep.Result: They go back to normal signals oscillating around the 0-Volt line.

TestStep.Action: Press Stop then play.
TestStep.Result: Channels are reset. Offset occurs.

TestStep.Action: Stop AxIS after going through offset correction.
TestStep.Result: AxIS Stops.

TestStep.Action: Start a LEAP induction.
TestStep.Result: LEAP starts. No signals displayed.

TestStep.Action: Disconnect the M2.
TestStep.Result: LEAP toast message is dismissed when M2 disconnects.

TestStep.Action: Reconnect the M2.
TestStep.Result: M2 reconnects. LEAP toast message reappears. LEAP completes.

Test.JiraSummary: Usage Meters in Debug Console

TestStep.Action: Connect M2 to AxIS Navigator and reset.

TestStep.Action: Open debug console.
TestStep.Result: Debug console opens.

TestStep.Action: 3. Press "Usage Meters: View..." button.
TestStep.Result: Window opens showing a list of meters *all with a Creation Date*: * Button Pushes * Door Movements * Heater Time * Machine Up Time * Plate Elevator Movements * Sample Pump On Time * Streaming Time *All modifications are disabled.*

TestStep.Action: Go back to the debug console and set "devmode true".
TestStep.Result: Meter values are now enabled and editable.

TestStep.Action: Click "Export" -> "Save to file..." to save usage meter values to csv. Save it.
TestStep.Result: CSV file is created with the current date.

TestStep.Action: Click "Import" -> "Load from file..." and select the saved previously saved file to load Usage Meter values.
TestStep.Result: Usage Meter values are populated.

TestStep.Action: Right-Click -> Reset on the Creation Date of all the values.
TestStep.Result: All values are reset to today's date.

TestStep.Action: Click on "Import" -> "Paste".
TestStep.Result: Usage Meter Creation Dates are restored.

TestStep.Action: Type "devmode false" in the Debug Console.
TestStep.Result: Values are again disabled.

Test.JiraSummary: LEAP tags are applied in the correct context

TestStep.Action: This test takes approx 35-40 minutes. Reset AxIS. Connect a live source and load a plate.
TestStep.Result: The barcode is read and displayed as the Active Plate. Analog mode is Neural: Spikes.

TestStep.Action: Record a 5s raw file, then load it into AxIS.
TestStep.Result: No LEAP module is present. Analog mode is Neural: Spikes.

TestStep.Action: Remove the file. Change the Maestro's analog mode to Cardiac LEAP.
TestStep.Result: The LEAP module appears.

TestStep.Action: Navigate to the LEAP module, then click "Start Induction". Wait for it to finish. (10 minutes)
TestStep.Result: Induction is complete. Progress bar gets to the end and AxIS starts streaming. *Offset correction does not occur.*

TestStep.Action: Record a raw file. Open it up in TAFT.
TestStep.Result: There is a LEAP tag in the file. Inside the tag is a Leap Duration of exactly 00:10:00.

TestStep.Action: Eject the maestro plate and insert a new one. Record a new raw file. Open that file in TAFT.
TestStep.Result: The file does not contain a LEAP tag.

TestStep.Action: Start a LEAP Induction again. Wait for it to finish.(10 minutes)
TestStep.Result: Induction is complete. Progress bar gets to the end and AxIS starts streaming. *Offset correction does not occur.*

TestStep.Action: Record a raw file. Open it up in TAFT.
TestStep.Result: There is a LEAP tag in the file. Inside the tag is a Leap Duration of exactly 00:10:00.

TestStep.Action: Eject and reinsert the same plate. Record a new raw file and open it in TAFT.
TestStep.Result: There is a LEAP tag in the file. Inside the tag is a Leap Duration of exactly 00:10:00.

TestStep.Action: Close AxIS. Open AxIS. Record a raw file and open it in TAFT.
TestStep.Result: There is a LEAP tag in the file. Inside the tag is a Leap Duration of exactly 00:10:00.

TestStep.Action: Navigate to the LEAP module, then click "Start Induction". Wait for it to finish.(10 minutes)
TestStep.Result: Induction is complete. Progress bar gets to the end and AxIS starts streaming. *Offset correction does not occur.*

TestStep.Action: Unplug the maestro ethernet cable. Wait for AxIS to disconnect the system, then plug in the cable again.
TestStep.Result: The maestro connects to AxIS.

TestStep.Action: Record a raw file and open it in TAFT.
TestStep.Result: There is a LEAP tag in the file. Inside the tag is a Leap Duration of exactly 00:10:00.

TestStep.Action: Prepare a timer/stopwatch. Start Induction then, after 2 minutes, abort the induction.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Record a raw file and open it in Taft.
TestStep.Result: There is a LEAP tag and the Leap Duration is ~1.5 min (LEAP takes ~30 seconds to set up)

TestStep.Action: Prepare a timer/stopwatch. Start Induction then, after 5 seconds, abort the induction.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Record a raw file and open it in Taft.
TestStep.Result: There is a LEAP tag in the file.

TestStep.Action: Change the analog mode to Cardiac Standard. Record a raw file.
TestStep.Result: There is a LEAP tag in the file.

TestStep.Action: Change the analog mode to Cardiac Broadband. Record a raw file.
TestStep.Result: There is a LEAP tag in the file.

TestStep.Action: Change the Maestro's analog mode to a Neural mode. Click Apply. Change the analog mode back to LEAP. Click Apply. Record another raw file and open it in TAFT.
TestStep.Result: There is not a LEAP tag in the file.

TestStep.Action: Reboot the M2. Restart AxIS. Set up and induce leap as soon as the Maestro connects. Start a timer.
TestStep.Result: There is not Offset Correction flashing in the playbar. LEAP takes ~10.5 minutes to complete and the Maestro streams immediately afterward. *Offset correction does not occur.*

Test.JiraSummary: LEAP Induction UI Test

TestStep.Action: Connect a live source and reset AxIS.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Set the Maestro analog mode to Cardiac LEAP.
TestStep.Result: The LEAP module appears again.

TestStep.Action: Click on the LEAP module.
TestStep.Result: In the module is a representation of the currently selected plate. It looks like the Plate Map Editor layout except that the electrodes aren't visible and the wells are represented as green circles instead.

TestStep.Action: Deselect all wells (they should be grey). Click "Start Induction".
TestStep.Result: Can't, the button is disabled. Tooltip reads "No wells selected for induction."

TestStep.Action: Re-select all wells.
TestStep.Result: "Start Induction" button is enabled again.

TestStep.Action: Hit play.
TestStep.Result: The Maestro is streaming.

TestStep.Action: Click "Start Induction".
TestStep.Result: Streaming stops. A white banner message pops up with a progress bar and a timer showing the amount of time remaining. To the right of the progress bar is a close button, but it is greyed out. The play controls are replaced by an "Abort LEAP Induction" button.

TestStep.Action: Click the close button in the white banner.
TestStep.Result: Nothing happens.

TestStep.Action: Select some wells in the LEAP module. Change the selected electrode pattern.
TestStep.Result: You can't change the wells, and you can't change the pattern. The tooltips explain that induction is occurring.

TestStep.Action: Set AxIS to save a raw file. Navigate to the Scheduled Recording module.
TestStep.Result: The Start Schedule button is disabled. Hovering over it gives you a tooltip saying that you "Cannot start scheduled recording while inducing LEAP".

TestStep.Action: Go back to the LEAP module. Click "Abort LEAP Induction"
TestStep.Result: LEAP is cancelled. The play controls return to their previous state. The white banner message says "LEAP induction was aborted" and the close button is now black (enabled) The maestro begins streaming automatically.

TestStep.Action: Set up a stopwatch. Click "Start Induction" and start the watch. If you are testing with a Maestro Pro, confirm that the screen does NOT display a yellow stimulation icon in the top right.
TestStep.Result: LEAP process begins, stopwatch is counting up.

TestStep.Action: Navigate to stim studio and set up a valid electrical stimulation.
TestStep.Result: The trigger button does NOT enable. Hovertext says "Stimulation is not allowed during LEAP induction".

TestStep.Action: Wait for the LEAP induction to end.
TestStep.Result: The timer reads about 12.5 minutes. (LEAP used to need 30 seconds to set up. Now more like 2.5 minutes.) The white banner says that LEAP is done, and the close button is enabled. The maestro automatically starts streaming.

TestStep.Action: Eject the plate. Try to click "Start Induction"
TestStep.Result: Button disabled. Tooltip says "Plate is not inserted."

TestStep.Action: Load the plate. Click "Start Induction". Once the LEAP process begins, eject the maestro plate using the physical button.
TestStep.Result: Plate is ejected, and LEAP is aborted. The LEAP module shows the induction as aborted.

TestStep.Action: Dock the plate and start streaming.
TestStep.Result: AxIS streams normally, the maestro does not reboot or disconnect.

Test.JiraSummary: Navigator checks different version update file from old AxIS

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Copy trunk\SoftwareTesting\testVersionUpdates.xml and to a folder and rename it to version_info.xml.
TestStep.Result: Copied.

TestStep.Action: Go to that folder in a command file and run "python -m http.server 80" to run the web server on port 80.
TestStep.Result: Success.

TestStep.Action: Edit the hosts file to add the line: ",127.0.0.1 updates.axionbiosystems.com". No quotes. C:\Windows\System32\drivers\etc\hosts
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Start AxIS and then open the AxIS logs.
TestStep.Result: The logs should have a 404 error and it won't display anything.

TestStep.Action: Close axis and rename version_info.xml to nav_version_info.xml
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Start AxIS.
TestStep.Result: AxIS shows the upgrade notice message.

TestStep.Action: Edit the hosts file to remove the added line.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Press "CTRL-C" to close down the python server and close the command prompt.
TestStep.Result: python exits.

Test.JiraSummary: Packet-performance logging on Kirk

TestStep.Action: With a Maestro connected, open the debug console and enter the command "cmdkirk setdataflowdebuglevel 1"
TestStep.Result: Console returns "Success"

TestStep.Action: Set AxIS to save a .raw file. Hit record and stop the recording at 13 seconds.
TestStep.Result: Offset Correction warning message pops up. Recording ends at around 13 seconds.

TestStep.Action: Get a support bundle. Open kirk.wedding.log inside.
TestStep.Result: In the time you spent recording, there are 3 pairs of messages: In the last 4 seconds, I received 99,997 / 100,000 (100.00 %) packets. In the last 4 seconds, I processed 99,997 / 100,000 (100.00 %) packets. Any packet count greater than 99,990 is an acceptable number. Disregard the first few seconds (~5) since there may be a few packets over 100% and under 50% due to start-up anomalies.

TestStep.Action: In the debug console, enter the command "cmdkirk setdataflowdebuglevel 0"
TestStep.Result: "Success"

Test.JiraSummary: New stimulation loads after using runnstimulationfile

TestStep.Action: Start streaming your maestro, & create a one-time stimulation with a default monophasic node
TestStep.Result: The trigger button is enabled

TestStep.Action: Trigger the stimulation.
TestStep.Result: You see a single stimulation, with one peak.

TestStep.Action: Open the debug console and enter the command "savestimulationfile c:\users\%currentuser%\desktop\1185-1.xml" [ENTER]
TestStep.Result: It is saved.

TestStep.Action: Edit the stimulation in stim studio by adding a 500 ms delay, and then another monophasic node. Trigger the stimulation.
TestStep.Result: You see one peak followed by another.

TestStep.Action: Go back to the debug console and enter the command "runstimulationfile c:\users\%currentuser%\desktop\1185-1.xml" [ENTER]
TestStep.Result: You see just one stimulation in AxIS.

TestStep.Action: Go back to stim studio and Trigger the stimulation again.
TestStep.Result: You see one peak followed by another.

TestStep.Action: In the debug console, enter the command "savestimulationfile c:\users\%currentuser%\desktop\1185-2.xml" [ENTER]
TestStep.Result: It is saved.

TestStep.Action: Edit the stimulation in stim studio by adding a 500 ms delay, and then another monophasic node. Trigger the stimulation.
TestStep.Result: You see one peak followed by another for a total of 3.

TestStep.Action: Go back to the debug console and enter the command "runstimulationfile c:\users\%currentuser%\desktop\1185-1.xml" [ENTER]
TestStep.Result: You see just one stimulation in AxIS.

TestStep.Action: Click up and then Enter to run the same command again. ("runstimulationfile c:\users\%currentuser%\desktop\1185-1.xml")
TestStep.Result: You see just one stimulation in AxIS.

TestStep.Action: Enter the command "runstimulationfile c:\users\%currentuser%\desktop\1185-2.xml" [ENTER]
TestStep.Result: AxIS shows two stimulations.

TestStep.Action: Click up and then Enter to run the same command again. ("runstimulationfile c:\users\%currentuser%\desktop\1185-2.xml")
TestStep.Result: You see two stimulations in AxIS again.

TestStep.Action: Back in the AxIS main window, click the Trigger button.
TestStep.Result: The pulse, delay, pulse, delay, pulse stimulation occurs. 3 pulses total.

TestStep.Action: Click the Trigger button again.
TestStep.Result: The pulse, delay, pulse, delay, pulse stimulation occurs. 3 pulses total.

TestStep.Action: Go back to the debug console and click up three times and then Enter to run the first command again. ("runstimulationfile c:\users\%currentuser%\desktop\1185-1.xml")
TestStep.Result: You see just one stimulation in AxIS.

TestStep.Action: Click up and then Enter to run the same command again. ("runstimulationfile c:\users\%currentuser%\desktop\1185-1.xml")
TestStep.Result: You see just one stimulation in AxIS.

Test.JiraSummary: Restarting Kirk service does not reboot Maestro 2 Pro

TestStep.Action: Connect an M2 to AxIS and reset.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Open the debug console and note the Device IP for the M2.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: SSH to the Device IP.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Type "systemctl restart kirk" to restart the Kirk Service.
TestStep.Result: The M2 disconnects (offline) and is gone from the StreamTree. The M2 reconnects and returns to the StreamTree. The SSH connection is not severed.

TestStep.Action: Observe the screen.
TestStep.Result: The screen still looks normal. It's not just showing environment variables.

TestStep.Action: Wait 2 minutes.
TestStep.Result: The M2 does not reboot.

Test.JiraSummary: Low RMS on Low/High Gain Switch

TestStep.Action: Insert a shipping plate and reset AxIS.
TestStep.Result: AxIS reset.

TestStep.Action: With AxIS stopped, set live source to low gain mode like Cardiac: Standard and hit Apply.
TestStep.Result: Settings apply.

TestStep.Action: Leave the settings dialog open. The following step will happen within 10 seconds of hitting Play. Set the live source to high gain mode like Neural: Spikes and Press Play.
TestStep.Result: AxIS starts removing DC offset.

TestStep.Action: Within 10 seconds press Apply in the settings dialog.
TestStep.Result: DC offset immediately restarts. The signal is briefly noisy, but quickly settles between 1.5-2.5 uV and stays there.

TestStep.Action: Record a RAW file in this state.
TestStep.Result: A RAW file is recorded.

TestStep.Action: Stop and resume play in Neural Spikes mode.
TestStep.Result: DC offset begins. The signal does NOT start noisy, instead it starts between 1.5-2.5 uV and stays about the same throughout offset correction.

TestStep.Action: View the RAW file just recorded.
TestStep.Result: The RAW file reflects the Neural Spikes mode setting.

TestStep.Action: Switch back to live source and play.
TestStep.Result: Live source plays.

TestStep.Action: Set the analog mode back to Cardiac: Standard and hit Apply.
TestStep.Result: DC offset immediately restarts. The signal is briefly noisy, but quickly returns to between 1.5-2.5 uV. The signal gets steadily higher over the course of the offset correction. The signal stabilizes around 3.5-4.5 uV.

TestStep.Action: Click the Stop button
TestStep.Result: AxIS stops.

TestStep.Action: Leave the settings dialog open. The following step will happen within 10 seconds of hitting Play. Set the live source to high gain mode like Field Potentials and Press Play.
TestStep.Result: AxIS starts removing DC offset.

TestStep.Action: Within 10 seconds press Stop then Apply in the settings dialog then Play.
TestStep.Result: DC offset begins. The signal does NOT start noisy, it slowly climbs until it stabilizes around 1.5-2.5 uV.

TestStep.Action: Switch analog mode back to Cardiac: Standard and hit Apply.
TestStep.Result: DC offset immediately restarts. The signal is briefly noisy, but quickly climbs up to 3.5-4.5 uV.

TestStep.Action: Switch the analog mode to Neural Spikes, apply it, and in the next 10 seconds, switch back to Cardiac: Standard Mode and apply it.
TestStep.Result: DC offset immediately restarts. The signal is briefly noisy and climbs up to 3.5-4.5 uV.

TestStep.Action: Record a RAW file in this state.
TestStep.Result: A RAW file is recorded.

TestStep.Action: Stop and resume play in Cardiac: Standard mode.
TestStep.Result: DC offset begins. The signal begins between 2.5-3.5 uV and climbs up to 3.5-4.5 uV.

TestStep.Action: View the RAW file just recorded.
TestStep.Result: The RAW file reflects the Cardiac Standard mode setting.

Test.JiraSummary: "Chamber at X. Please Load Plate" test

TestStep.Action: Reset AxiS Navigator and reboot Maestro Pro with no plate loaded.
TestStep.Result: * Navigator resets. * Maestro is detected. * Heater is off by default.

TestStep.Action: Close the door maestro door and turn on the heater.
TestStep.Result: * Heater is defaulted to 37 degrees. * When the heater reaches 37 degrees, a banner message pops up saying, "Chamber at 37. Please load plate."

TestStep.Action: Turn off heater control.
TestStep.Result: The temp starts to fall. The temp shown in the banner message keeps up with the larger temp shown on the same screen. Once the temperature falls .2 degrees away from 37, the banner message disappears.

TestStep.Action: Set the temp to the current temperature and turn the heater control back on.
TestStep.Result: The banner message pops up again.

TestStep.Action: Set the temp to .1 above the current temp.
TestStep.Result: The banner message stays, and the temperature in the message eventually updates to the new temperature.

TestStep.Action: Set the temp to .2 above the current temp.
TestStep.Result: The banner message disappears until the M2 reaches the new temperature, then it reappears again.

Test.JiraSummary: "Auto Enable Gas" checkbox (USES LUMOS)

TestStep.Action: *Needs Lumos* With a Maestro connected, reset AxIS. Confirm the maestro has a plate with a valid barcode docked and the door closed.
TestStep.Result: AxIS is now reset, and the maestro is in the proper state.

TestStep.Action: Navigate to the Environmental Control module.
TestStep.Result: Gas is turned ON and the "Auto Enable Gas" checkbox is checked.

TestStep.Action: Toggle the CO2 on/off switch.
TestStep.Result: It is disabled; toggling does nothing.

TestStep.Action: Click "Auto Enable Gas"
TestStep.Result: * The box is now unchecked. * "CO2 Control" is on and enabled * Heater control remains unchanged.

TestStep.Action: Toggle the CO2 on/off switch.
TestStep.Result: * CO2 pump turns off (you can feel the air stop pulling from the valve in back). * Heater control remains unchanged.

TestStep.Action: Toggle the CO2 on/off switch.
TestStep.Result: CO2 pump turns on.

TestStep.Action: Right click the eject button and select "Open Door".
TestStep.Result: Gas stays "regulating"/ON but it’s not actually pulling gas.

TestStep.Action: Open the plate holder.
TestStep.Result: CO2 switch stays on but gas stops regulating. Feel the air inlet is not pulling.

TestStep.Action: Toggle the CO2 switch.
TestStep.Result: CO2 switch turns off.

TestStep.Action: Close the plate holder but keep door open. Connect a Lumos with a skirt and place it over the Maestro door opening.
TestStep.Result: CO2 switch stays off.

TestStep.Action: Toggle the CO2 switch.
TestStep.Result: CO2 switch turns on. Gas regulation turns on.

TestStep.Action: Remove the lumos from on top of the m2.
TestStep.Result: CO2 switch stays on but gas regulation stays off. Feel the air inlet is not pulling.

TestStep.Action: Open the plate holder. Remove the plate & press eject button to lower the plate holder and close the door.
TestStep.Result: CO2 switch stays on and gas regulation starts. Air inlet is pulling.

TestStep.Action: Right click the eject button and check "Keep door open"
TestStep.Result: Door stays closed. CO2 stays on and regulating.

TestStep.Action: Press the eject button once, wait for it to finish, then press eject again.
TestStep.Result: The plate holder opens, then closes. The door stays open. CO2 stays on but not regulating..

TestStep.Action: Toggle the CO2 switch.
TestStep.Result: CO2 switch turns off.

TestStep.Action: Right click the eject button and uncheck "Keep door open"
TestStep.Result: Door stays open. CO2 stays off.

TestStep.Action: Eject the plate again. Toggle the CO2 switch twice, waiting for the switch to take effect and checking the air inlet.
TestStep.Result: The gas pump never turns on.

TestStep.Action: Insert a plate. Press the eject button.
TestStep.Result: The plate docks, the door closes, and CO2 stays off.

TestStep.Action: Close AxIS and open it back up again.
TestStep.Result: "Auto Enable Gas" is still unchecked.

TestStep.Action: Turn off the Maestro, and turn it back on again.
TestStep.Result: "Auto Enable Gas" has reverted back it its default checked state. CO2 Control is ON and regulating.

TestStep.Action: Press the eject button on the M2.
TestStep.Result: Door & plate open, CO2 Control turns off.

TestStep.Action: Press it again.
TestStep.Result: Door & plate close. CO2 Control turns on and regulates.

TestStep.Action: Right click the eject button in AxIS and click "open door".
TestStep.Result: Door opens. CO2 Control stays on but gas regulation stops. Feel the air inlet is not pulling.

TestStep.Action: Right click the eject button in AxIS and click "keep door open".
TestStep.Result: Gas regulation is still off.

TestStep.Action: Press the eject button on the M2.
TestStep.Result: Plate holder opens. CO2 Switch turns off. Gas regulation stays off.

TestStep.Action: Press the eject button again on the M2.
TestStep.Result: Plate closes. Door stays open. CO2 Control turns on but gas regulation stays off.

TestStep.Action: Place the Lumos back on the M2.
TestStep.Result: Gas regulation turns back on. Feel the air inlet puling.

TestStep.Action: Remove the Lumos from the M2.
TestStep.Result: Gas regulation turns off. CO2 Control switch stays on.

TestStep.Action: Right click the eject button and uncheck "Keep door open", and then click the eject button.
TestStep.Result: Plate holder opens. CO2 control turns off.

TestStep.Action: Click the eject button again.
TestStep.Result: CO2 Control turns on. Gas regulation starts. Feel the air inlet pulling.

TestStep.Action: Click the eject button again.
TestStep.Result: Plate holder opens. CO2 control turns off.

TestStep.Result: Door and plate open and close. The plate motor moves slower than usual.

TestStep.Action: In the debug console,type "cmdspock platemotor ignore-limits false"
TestStep.Result: Success.

TestStep.Action: Type "cmdspock doormotor ignore-limits false" into the debug console.
TestStep.Result: Success.

TestStep.Action: Eject and ject plate via M2 button.
TestStep.Result: Door and plate work as normal.

TestStep.Action: Eject and ject plate via M2 AxIS UI.
TestStep.Result: Door and plate work as normal.

Test.JiraSummary: Motor overrides functionality - limit switches GUI

TestStep.Action: Connect M2 to AxIS. Reset AxIS.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Click Tools -> Motors -> Ignore Safety Limits.
TestStep.Result: Bypass window opens. Big Warning message on the pop-up. The options for Current State for *Plate* are: * Unknown * Up/Undocked * Down/Docked The options for Current State for *Door* are: * Unknown * Open * Closed

TestStep.Action: Click on "Ignore Safety Limits" for Plate Elevator and click Apply.
TestStep.Result: Red warning pop-up comes up. "Ignore Safety Limits is enabled for the PlateHolder" (TIMESTAMP)

TestStep.Action: Close the pop-up.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Click on "Ignore Safety Limits" for Door and click Apply.
TestStep.Result: Red warning pop-up comes up. "Ignore Safety Limits is enabled for the Door" (TIMESTAMP)

TestStep.Action: Close the pop-up.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Uncheck the ignore options for the door and plate holder and click OK.
TestStep.Result: Bypass window closes.

TestStep.Action: Eject and ject plate via M2 button.
TestStep.Result: Door and plate work as normal.

TestStep.Action: Eject and ject plate via M2 AxIS UI.
TestStep.Result: Door and plate work as normal.

Test.JiraSummary: AxIS warns then stops recording when hard disk drive gets full

TestStep.Action: Create a virtual harddrive with 6 GB of fixed space on your PC and start AxIS. Open Control Panel -> Computer Management -> Storage -> Disk Management.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Select the C drive then right-click Disk Management and select Create VHD. Select 6GB fixed size, MBR.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Right-click on the new disk and select "New Simple Volume..." then assign a drive letter to it.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS and connect to M2.
TestStep.Result: AxIS resets and opens.

TestStep.Action: Set the Experiment Folder to be the virtual drive and set AxIS to save a raw file. Record for a few seconds.
TestStep.Result: The .raw file is output, no warning messages appear (except perhaps the offset correction message if you didn't wait for it to finish)

TestStep.Action: Start recording a file. Wait for the file to fill up enough to space to hit less than 5 GB of space left.
TestStep.Result: Warning banner message: "The disk being recorded to has less than 5GB of free space. If the disk fills, recording will be halted."

TestStep.Action: Keep recording, wait for the drive to have less than 1GB of available space.
TestStep.Result: Error banner message: "Error writing file: The disk being recorded to has less than 1GB of free space. Halting recording." The m2/file stops recording and outputs a .raw file. This may take a long time, and AxIS may appear to be frozen/hung.

TestStep.Action: Load the recorded output file.
TestStep.Result: It is not corrupted and it plays in AxIS.

TestStep.Action: Select the Maestro and attempt to stream again without recording.
TestStep.Result: AxIS streams the maestro normally

TestStep.Action: Delete the Virtual Hard Disk. Select the hard drive under Disk Management. Right-click -> unmount.
TestStep.Result: Hard Drive disappears.

TestStep.Action: Delete the vhd file.
TestStep.Result: Done.

Test.JiraSummary: Spike Plot tie-in to Raster Plot ( Waveform Clearing)

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS Navigator.
TestStep.Result: AxIS starts up.

TestStep.Action: Load OverwhelmingRatBrains.raw into AxIS Navigator.
TestStep.Result: Added.

TestStep.Action: Add a Spike Detector at 24x and Play.
TestStep.Result: AxIS starts streaming.

TestStep.Action: Switch to Spikes Plot. Right-click on the Spike Plot and select Waveform Clearing.
TestStep.Result: At End Of Raster is selected by default.

TestStep.Action: Right-click on the Spike Plot and select Waveform Clearing --> After 1 Minute.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: In well A2, scrub to 1:30 and when you see electrode 33 spike at 103.2 uV start a timer.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Check the timer at 1 minute.
TestStep.Result: The spike trace at A2, 33 disappears around the 2:40 mark. So does any amplitude value.

TestStep.Action: Zoom in to 200 ms/Div.
TestStep.Result: Spike Plot traces remain displayed the same.

TestStep.Action: Right-click on the Spike Plot and select Waveform Clearing --> At End Of Raster.
TestStep.Result: Spike Plot traces clear as soon as the raster marks scroll off the screen. So does any amplitude value.

TestStep.Action: Right-click on the Spike Plot and select Waveform Clearing --> Manual.
TestStep.Result: Spike Plot traces start accumulating and slowly fade over time along with the amplitude values.

Test.JiraSummary: 12 Well raw files record after restart

TestStep.Action: *Maestro Pro only* Reset AxIS with an M2 attached and *no plate docked*.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Enter debug command "cmdspock spoofbarcode 0000"
TestStep.Result: "Success: 0000 = TwelveWell, Success" in debug console and Active Plate is now CytoView MEA 12 and has the barcode (0000) listed above.

TestStep.Action: Restart AxIS.
TestStep.Result: AxIS reopens, the active plate still is CytoView MEA and the barcode is still listed as 0000

TestStep.Action: Set to save a raw file, then record at least 5 seconds of data.
TestStep.Result: A .raw file is output.

TestStep.Action: Take note of the raw file's size.
TestStep.Result: It is 75 MB or greater.

TestStep.Action: Load the file into AxIS.
TestStep.Result: It loads and it visible in the stream tree.

Test.JiraSummary: Ejecting while playing does not disable the play controls or turn playbar red

TestStep.Action: Connect an M2 to AxIS Navigator and load a plate.
TestStep.Result: AxIS plates.

TestStep.Action: Eject via the M2 button.
TestStep.Result: Plate ejects. Playbar doesn't turn red. Play controls are not disabled.

TestStep.Action: Load plate via M2 button.
TestStep.Result: Plate loads. Playbar doesn't turn red.

TestStep.Action: Play AxIS.
TestStep.Result: AxIS plays.

TestStep.Action: Eject via the M2 button.
TestStep.Result: Play stops. Plate ejects. playbar doesn't turn red. Play controls are not disabled.

TestStep.Action: Load plate via AxIS button.
TestStep.Result: Plate loads. Playbar doesn't turn red.

TestStep.Action: Play AxIS.
TestStep.Result: AxIS plays.

Test.JiraSummary: Double-clicking Pid controller names don't crash AxIS

TestStep.Action: Connect M2 to AxIS.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Open the debug console.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Double click on Pid controllers.
TestStep.Result: AxIS should not crash.

Test.JiraSummary: AxIS displays pop up when door jam is detected upon opening

TestStep.Action: Connect a Maestro to AxIS.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Right-click Eject button.
TestStep.Result: "Keep Door Open" is unchecked, but enabled.

TestStep.Action: If plate & door are open, click Eject.
TestStep.Result: Plate & door are closed.

TestStep.Action: Place an item on top of door that's large enough to prevent door from fully opening but small enough to leave some room for it to leave the "closed" position (cell phone, cup, etc). Click the Eject button.
TestStep.Result: Door moves until it hits the obstruction, and stops. AxIS displays a banner message "Door jammed, please check for obstruction"

TestStep.Action: Remove the obstruction and press "Retry" in the pop-up message.
TestStep.Result: Door & plate open. The pop-up message closes.

Test.JiraSummary: M2 screen activity map streaming

TestStep.Action: Connect a Maestro Pro to AxIS. Set the analog mode to Neural Spikes.
TestStep.Result: Done. M2 screen shows a temperature & CO2 readout. There are white navigation arrows on the side of the screen.

TestStep.Action: Tap each white arrow a few times.
TestStep.Result: Each tap flips the view between the environmental controls and the activity map.

TestStep.Action: Keep the screen on the activity map.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Load a Classic MEA 48 (incl. AccuSpot) plate. Add a Spike Detector and Play.
TestStep.Result: The M2 activity map shows a 48 well grid with the correct barcode in the banner. It lights up and mirrors what is showing on the activity map in AxIS.

TestStep.Action: Tap the right side arrow twice and then the left side arrow twice.
TestStep.Result: The screen navigates between the environmental controls and the activity map without issue. Environmental data is correct and the activity map is showing activity. Screen should end up on the activity map.

TestStep.Action: Pause streaming.
TestStep.Result: The activity map in AxIS is still lit up and showing data, but it is frozen in place. The M2 Pro screen continues to update.

TestStep.Action: Tap the right side arrow twice and then the left side arrow twice.
TestStep.Result: The screen navigates between the environmental controls and the activity map without issue. Environmental data is correct and the activity map continues to show activity. Screen should end up on the activity map.

TestStep.Action: Stop streaming.
TestStep.Result: The activity map goes dark in AxIS and M2 Pro screen..

TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Result: "Destination Error: Plate holder is blocking the door. Please close it."

Test.JiraSummary: Kirk exits cleanly when stopped

TestStep.Action: Connect M2 to AxIS Navigator and get the IP address.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: SSH to kirk.
TestStep.Result: Connects.

TestStep.Action: Execute "systemctl stop kirk".
TestStep.Result: Kirk stops, the Maestro disconnects from AxIS.

Test.JiraSummary: Plate motor re-calibration

TestStep.Action: Connect a maestro to AxIS, then make sure there is no plate docked.
TestStep.Result: Plate holder is empty.

TestStep.Action: Open the debug console and click the Motors "Recalibrate..." button.
TestStep.Result: A window pops up, with a button at the bottom labeled "Proceed". There is a warning telling the user to insert a plate and keep hands out of docking mechanism.

TestStep.Action: Click "Proceed".
TestStep.Result: Calibration begins. The bottom button is now an "Abort" button.

TestStep.Action: Click "Abort".
TestStep.Result: The calibration stops. -Warning message says calibration was aborted.-

TestStep.Action: Click Close to close the calibration window then click Recalibrate to open it again.
Open the plate holder, insert a plate, then dock.
TestStep.Result: The plate is successfully docked, the barcode is read, and the door closes.

TestStep.Action: Click "Proceed" again.
TestStep.Result: The calibration begins. The bottom button now says "Abort". After the calibration completes the bottom button changes to "Close".

Test.JiraSummary: Lumos connected to Maestro and PC firmware update check

TestStep.Action: Connect Lumos to AxIS through the maestro.
TestStep.Result: Lumos and Maestro are recognized by AxIS.

TestStep.Action: Click Help -> Restore Firmware. Select only the Lumos and start the upgrade process.
TestStep.Result: * Firmware flashing completes. Lumos reboots, and reconnects to Navigator. * Nothing changes with the Maestro during this process.

TestStep.Action: Click Help -> Restore Firmware. Select only the Maestro and start the upgrade process.
TestStep.Result: * Firmware flashing completes. Maestro reboots, and reconnects to Navigator. * Lumos disconnects from Navigator while the Maestro is disconnected but nothing changes with the Lumos physically (lights/reboot) during this process.

TestStep.Action: Click Help -> Restore Firmware. Select the Maestro and the Lumos and start the upgrade process.
TestStep.Result: Firmware flashing completes. Maestro & Lumos reboot.

TestStep.Action: Disconnect Lumos from Maestro and connect directly to PC.
TestStep.Result: Navigator recognizes the Lumos. (Restart Navigator if Lumos is not detected.)

TestStep.Action: # Click Help -> Restore Firmware. # Select the Lumos only and start the upgrade process.
TestStep.Result: * Firmware flashing completes. Lumos reboots, and reconnects to Navigator. * Nothing changes with the Maestro during this process.

TestStep.Action: Click Help -> Restore Firmware. Select only the Maestro and start the upgrade process.
TestStep.Result: * Firmware flashing completes. Maestro reboots, and reconnects to Navigator. * Lumos DOES NOT disconnect from Navigator while the Maestro is disconnected . * Nothing changes with the Lumos physically (lights/reboot) during this process.

TestStep.Action: Click Help -> Restore Firmware. Select the Maestro and the Lumos and start the upgrade process.
TestStep.Result: * Firmware flashing completes. * Maestro & Lumos reboot and reconnect to Navigator.

Test.JiraSummary: Well & electrode disabling take effect immediately

TestStep.Action: With a Maestro connected, start streaming.
TestStep.Result: AxIS is playing.

TestStep.Action: Attach a spike detector.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Select Well B1 to be visible in the continuous plot.
TestStep.Result: Well B1 is the currently selected well.

TestStep.Action: Open up the plate map editor, turn off well B1 in the PME.
TestStep.Result: The entire wells goes dark and you see no plotting.

TestStep.Action: Select Well A1 for viewing. In the continuous plot module, right click electrode 11 and click "disable electrode"
TestStep.Result: The electrode is no longer plotting.

TestStep.Action: Stop playing. Change the Spike Detector to use Static Threshold Crossing instead of Adaptive Threshold Crossing. Play. If no spikes appear after offset correction, lower the threshold.
TestStep.Result: There are spikes being detected.

TestStep.Action: Set to save a .raw and a spike list file. Record for 10 seconds.
TestStep.Result: 2 files are output.

TestStep.Action: Open the spike list file. Order the electrode data in A->Z order.
TestStep.Result: There is no data for electrode A1_11. There is also no data for any electrodes in well B1.

TestStep.Action: Load the newly created .raw file into AxIS. Switch to it and open up the plate map editor.
TestStep.Result: The PME shows well B1 is totally off (black), and the bottom left electrode in Well A1 is disabled (grey).

TestStep.Action: Play the file.
TestStep.Result: Well A1, electrode 11 shows no plotting. No electrodes plot in well B1.

TestStep.Action: Copy OverwhelmingRatBrains-30s.raw from \TRUNK\SoftwareTesting\HashedTestFiles\Neural
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Load overwhelmingratbrains-30s.raw and select it for play.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Add a spike detector, and set the file to save .raw and a spike list.
TestStep.Result: Record button is enabled.

TestStep.Action: Hit Play. Disable Electrode A1_11.
TestStep.Result: It goes blank.

TestStep.Action: Open up the PME and turn off Well B1. View the B1 continuous plot.
TestStep.Result: There is nothing plotting in well B1.

TestStep.Action: Press record and wait for the file to play out.
TestStep.Result: 2 files are output.

TestStep.Action: Open the spike list file. Order the electrode data in A->Z order.
TestStep.Result: There is no data for electrode A1_11. There is also no data for any electrodes in well B1.

TestStep.Action: Load the newly created .raw file into AxIS. Switch to it and open up the plate map editor.
TestStep.Result: The PME shows well B1 is totally off (black), and the bottom left electrode in Well A1 is disabled (grey).

TestStep.Action: Play the file.
TestStep.Result: Well A1, electrode 11 shows no plotting. No electrodes plot in well B1.

Test.JiraSummary: Re-recording files using a different plate type saves new plate info

TestStep.Action: Change the active plate type to Classic MEA 96.
TestStep.Result: Done.
