Test.JiraSummary: Lumos/Maestro Direct Connect Disconnect Test

TestStep.Action: Turn off the M2 and unplugged Lumos and start AxIS Navigator.
TestStep.Result: AxiS starts.

TestStep.Action: Turn on M2.
TestStep.Result: AxIS recognizes the Maestro.

TestStep.Action: Turn on Lumos.
TestStep.Result: Lumos turns on.

TestStep.Action: Connect the Lumos USB to the M2.
TestStep.Result: AxIS recognizes the Lumos in addition to the M2.

TestStep.Action: Close and open AxIS Navigator.
TestStep.Result: AxIS recognizes both the M2 and Lumos upon restart.

TestStep.Action: Turn off Lumos and reboot M2.
TestStep.Result: Both Lumos and M2 are gone from AxIS.

TestStep.Action: Wait for M2 to reboot.
TestStep.Result: AxIS recognizes the M2.

TestStep.Action: Turn on the Lumos.
TestStep.Result: AxIS recognizes the Lumos in addition to the M2.

TestStep.Action: Close and open AxIS.
TestStep.Result: AxIS recognizes both the M2 and Lumos upon restart.

TestStep.Action: Turn off Lumos and M2.
TestStep.Result: Both Lumos and M2 are gone from AxIS.

TestStep.Action: Turn on Lumos.

TestStep.Action: Turn on the M2.
TestStep.Result: AxIS recognizes both the M2 and Lumos.

TestStep.Action: Close and open AxIS.
TestStep.Result: AxIS recognizes both the M2 and Lumos upon restart.

TestStep.Action: Unplug the Lumos from the Maestro, start a stopwatch.
TestStep.Result: The Lumos is shown as disconnected in AxIS within 30 seconds.

TestStep.Action: Reconnect the Lumos to the Maestro.
TestStep.Result: Lumos returns in AxIS.

TestStep.Action: Unplug the Maestro from AxIS.
TestStep.Result: Both the Lumos and the Maestro are shown as not connected anymore.

TestStep.Action: Push the record button in the play bar.
TestStep.Result: The "Start Schedule" button is greyed out and unclickable.

TestStep.Action: Stop recording.

TestStep.Result: 48 E-Stim+ is selected.

TestStep.Action: Switch plate type to CytoView MEA 24, then quickly click play.
TestStep.Result: There is a ~3-4 second delay before the streaming & offset correction begins.

Test.JiraSummary: Stop button resets artichokes & Play button repush channel status

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS Navigator.
TestStep.Result: AxIS resets and opens.

TestStep.Action: Play a connected M2 and zoom in to 5 uV/Div. Observe the signals.
TestStep.Result: Maestro plays.

TestStep.Action: Open the debug console and type "achkiv * 0x80 0x000".
TestStep.Result: The signals go lower.

TestStep.Action: Stop playback.
TestStep.Result: Streaming stops.

TestStep.Action: Click Play.
TestStep.Result: Signals should have been reset and gone back to normal.

TestStep.Action: Type the command to reset the artichokes. (achkiv * 0x80 0x800)
TestStep.Result: Since the artichokes have already reset then the signals should look the same.

TestStep.Action: Type "achkiv * 0x80 0x40C" into the debug console.
TestStep.Result: All channels go lower.

TestStep.Action: Stop playback.
TestStep.Result: Streaming stops.

TestStep.Action: Click Play.
TestStep.Result: Signals are back to normal.

Test.JiraSummary: Maestro Screen Demo mode

TestStep.Action: Connect a maestro to AxIS. Turn off the heater and wait for the temp sensor to read below 35 degrees.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Load a plate with a "DEMO barcode into an M2. ("cmdspock spoofbarcode DEMO" in a pinch)
TestStep.Result: 1. Temp is 37 degrees. 2. CO2 ramps up from 0 to 5%. 3. "Environment Stable" green banner message temporarily. 4. Left/Right arrows available. 5. No icons in the top right except a green AxIS icon.

TestStep.Action: Touch the left arrow.
TestStep.Result: M2 screen switches to a mock activity map.

TestStep.Action: Touch the left arrow.
TestStep.Result: M2 screen changes back to the environmental variables.

TestStep.Action: In Axis, start streaming.
TestStep.Result: The screen does not change except for the green Play triangle and a counter counting up.

TestStep.Action: Create an "until stopped" stimulation and start the stimulation.
TestStep.Result: A lightning bolt symbol appears in the top right.

TestStep.Action: Stop the stimulation.
TestStep.Result: Lightning bolt disappears.

TestStep.Action: Close AxIS.
TestStep.Result: The screen does not change except for the green Play triangle and the counter gone.

TestStep.Action: Try the right arrow and randomly press it and the left one. Switch screens at least 3 times.
TestStep.Result: The screen switches between environmental variables and the activity map as expected.

TestStep.Action: Undock the demo plate.
TestStep.Result: 1. Temp is no longer 37 degrees. 2. CO2 shows white dash marks instead of a number 3. "Environment Stable" green banner message disappears 4. Left/Right arrows are still available

TestStep.Result: Any tag that starts with '<dacset dacid="stimcurrent_0' does not contain a negative value.

TestStep.Result: The changes are discarded. The original values are restored.

TestStep.Action: Select a different well in the same column.
TestStep.Result: Input boxes change to reflect the well.

TestStep.Action: Select the entire column via the label on the top.
TestStep.Result: Fields that share values across all selected wells will display that value. Others will be blank.

TestStep.Action: Click the 'Off' slide button.
TestStep.Result: Wells turn black. You cannot select it as "control" and you can't edit treatment/concentration. Notes can be edited.

TestStep.Action: Switch to a different well/row/column then switch back to the column.
TestStep.Result: Wells are still turned off.

TestStep.Action: Save the channel map, reset it and load it.
TestStep.Result: Unused button gets cleared on reset but returns on load and the wells show the changes.

TestStep.Action: Hover over individual electrodes in the enabled and disabled wells.
TestStep.Result: Nothing happens!

TestStep.Action: Double click on individual electrodes in both enabled and disabled plates.
TestStep.Result: Enabled wells - electrodes toggle between enabled / disabled. Disabled wells - electrode state cannot be changed.

TestStep.Action: Copy/paste a well with disabled electrodes to another one. Take note of the plate info.
TestStep.Result: The well information is posted but the disabled electrodes show up as enabled in the new well. Electrode disabling is not pasted.

TestStep.Action: Save the configuration.
TestStep.Result: It saves.

TestStep.Action: Select all wells and turn them off..
TestStep.Result: All wells are grounded.

TestStep.Action: Load the configuration.
TestStep.Result: Previous configuration is reloaded. The same electrodes that were disabled are still disabled.

TestStep.Action: Record a raw file.
TestStep.Result: File records normally.

TestStep.Action: Load the recorded file and play it.
TestStep.Result: It plays normally and the plate configuration matches.

TestStep.Action: For a file: load a file with disabled electrodes and attempt to enable them.
TestStep.Result: You can't.

TestStep.Action: For a file: load a file with disabled electrodes and attempt to disable some.
TestStep.Result: You can.

Test.JiraSummary: AxIS Navigator should not stop streaming when processing for a long time

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS Navigator and connect a live Maestro.
TestStep.Result: It resets.

TestStep.Action: Set devmode to true.
TestStep.Result: Success.

TestStep.Action: Add a "Constant Time processing node and Play.
TestStep.Result: AxIS Navigator plays, but is laggy and the continuous plot jerks forward.

TestStep.Action: Open the constant time node and set the time to 6000. Click Apply (do not close window).
TestStep.Result: AxIS Navigator slows down even more.

TestStep.Action: When AxIS Navigator TTLs (constant time node is grayed out), change the processing time to 0 and click OK.
TestStep.Result: AxIS Navigator catches up. Data streams and time in the Playbar races forward until it advances normally and the node is no longer transparent.

TestStep.Action: Continue to Play AxIS Navigator for 1 minute.
TestStep.Result: It does not TTL again.

Test.JiraSummary: Temperature Control

TestStep.Action: The heater should be able to change temperature to any value within room temperature and 46.0C.
TestStep.Result: Temperature Control is used to accurately set a desired temperature within a preset range for the Maestro or Muse.

TestStep.Action: Set the heater to its nearest stable temperature (any nearest integer value of temperature).
TestStep.Result: The heater stabilizes.

TestStep.Action: Check the MEA System's heater block temperature once the temperature has stabilized using the Fluke IR Thermometer.
TestStep.Result: The heater is calibrated. If not, issue a 'heater -c XX' calibration command.

TestStep.Action: Set the heater temperature to five degrees greater than the current temperature. Allow the temperature to stabilize.
TestStep.Result: The heater stabilizes if this value is below 46C.

TestStep.Action: Check the MEA System's heater block temperature once the temperature has stabilized using the Fluke IR Thermometer.
TestStep.Result: AxIS remains accurate in reporting its temperature regardless of its initial set and calibrated temperature.

TestStep.Action: Right-click copy again.
TestStep.Result: No errors.

TestStep.Action: Paste to paint.
TestStep.Result: Conduction velocity image is pasted. Looks like AxIS.

Test.JiraSummary: v2.0 BurstDetector doesn't crash on seek and stop/play

TestStep.Action: Set up a file with a configuration with a burst detector.
TestStep.Result: Configuration loads.

TestStep.Result: AxIS plays.

Test.JiraSummary: Child nodes should go transparent during TTL

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS and play the Maestro.
TestStep.Result: Maestro plays.

TestStep.Action: Open the debug console (CTRL+ALT+D) and type "SetDataFlowDebugLevel 1".
TestStep.Result: Data flow information is printed for each slice.

TestStep.Action: Add a Neural: Real-time Spontaneous configuration and switch to the Spikes Plot.
TestStep.Result: Configuration attached. Spikes Plot is displayed.

TestStep.Action: Set the Spike Detector to 2.5 or something low enough to stress the system.
TestStep.Result: You might see an orange message saying "Slice processing took x m" when x is greater than 1000. Continuous ext in debug console changes from "Slice Timing..." to "Slice is Dead..." when Kirk Backlog is more than 11 seconds and Slice Timing is almost 1 second. When the TTL message appears the child nodes below the live source turn transparent. At the Same time the burst and spike detector stop updating. Once -a "TTL Reset successfully" message is received- the system recovers the child nodes return to normal and the spike and burst detectors start to see spikes/bursts again. "Slice is Dead" messages stop.

TestStep.Action: Allow the stream to keep playing. When another TTL panic message appears, stop the maestro.
TestStep.Result: AxIS recovers from the TTL, the nodes in the stream are in black text and you can play the stream again.

Test.JiraSummary: AxIS version and update message checker

TestStep.Action: From trunk\SoftwareTesting\ download version_info.xml to a local folder.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Open a windows command prompt, make sure you have python installed. Enter command "cd \[path-to-version_info.xml]"
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Enter command "python -m http.server 8000"
TestStep.Result: "Serving HTTP on 0.0.0.0 port 8000..."

TestStep.Action: Start up axis, open debug console, call command "setNewRemoteVersionUrl http://127.0.0.1:8000/version_info.xml"
TestStep.Result: "Success:" in the debug console.

TestStep.Action: Restart (not reset!) AxIS
TestStep.Result: See both version update and banner message. Dismiss both.

TestStep.Action: Restart AxIS again.
TestStep.Result: Neither banner messages should appear.

TestStep.Action: Close AxIS.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Go in user-settings, alter "VersionMessageLastDismissed" to be 31 days behind
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Open AxIS.
TestStep.Result: Version update available again.

TestStep.Action: Close Python window to kill server..
TestStep.Result: Done.

Test.JiraSummary: v2.1 NRE On Batch Processing Start After Renaming Loaded Files

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS and run a batch process with some files. Any configuration.
TestStep.Result: Batch process runs.

TestStep.Action: Rename or delete some of the files inside the batch process.
TestStep.Result: Files should be locked and not allowed to be renamed or deleted.

TestStep.Result: Files added

TestStep.Result: CSVs are created.

TestStep.Action: Compare the batch process CSVs to each other and to the CSV created outside the batch process.
TestStep.Result: The Spike Lists CSVs are identical except for the name.

TestStep.Result: The tags are scrolling across the plot 1 second apart.

TestStep.Result: Orange waveforms are displayed above the raster plot. Tags continue to show up on raster plot. Underneath each tag is a column of detected spikes.

TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Turn on the Lumos.
TestStep.Result: The LED is solid cyan for about 10 seconds while the Lumos initializes. The Lumos lightbulb icon in AxIS flashes blue. After initialization, the Lumos LED slowly fades into/out of cyan while idle. The Lumos lightbulb icon is solid blue.

TestStep.Action: Lift up the Lumos from the stand.
TestStep.Result: The LED turns solid yellow.

TestStep.Action: Return the Lumos to the stand and start a continuous stimulation.
TestStep.Result: Lumos LED flashes yellow.

TestStep.Action: Lift up the Lumos from the stand.
TestStep.Result: Lumos LED continues to flash yellow.

TestStep.Action: Place the Lumos on top of the gas skirt.
TestStep.Result: Lumos LED fades into/out of green.

TestStep.Action: Stop stimulating.
TestStep.Result: Lumos LED is solid green.

TestStep.Action: # Type devmode true in the debug console. # Set Lumos to stimulate all 4 colors for1 second, every second at 100% intensity.
TestStep.Result: Lumos LED flashes green until it starts flashing red. This means the Lumos is overheating. When the Lumos overheats it stops stimulating and the LED turns solid green. A pop-up message appears in AxIS stating the the Lumos exceeded 70 degrees.

TestStep.Action: Unplug the Lumos USB.
TestStep.Result: The Lumos lightbulb icon turns gray.

TestStep.Action: Plug in the Lumos USB.
TestStep.Result: The Lumos lightbulb icon flashes blue until it turns green.

Test.JiraSummary: Disable auto stimulation in scheduled recording if the stimulation mode is not once

TestStep.Action: Select a live source and open Stimulation Studio in Optical mode.
TestStep.Result: Opened.

TestStep.Action: Set up a valid stimulation and set to Stimulate Exactly x times...
TestStep.Result: Set.

TestStep.Action: Set up to record raw files.
TestStep.Result: Recording is enabled.

TestStep.Action: Go to Scheduled Recording and set some valid values.
TestStep.Result: Everything is normal except the Auto Stimulate checkbox is disabled.

TestStep.Action: Change the optical stimulation trigger to "until stopped".
TestStep.Result: Everything is still normal in the Scheduled Recording module except the Auto Stimulate checkbox is still disabled.

Test.JiraSummary: Lumos does not reboot when Start/Stop is pressed repeatedly

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS and click Play.
TestStep.Result: AxIS resets and plays.

TestStep.Action: Set analog mode to Cardiac: -Pacing- Standard.
TestStep.Result: Analog mode is changed.

TestStep.Action: Add a valid, endless, optical stimulation.
TestStep.Result: Trigger button is enabled.

TestStep.Action: Click to start the stimulation but click again to stop it as soon as the option to stop it becomes available.
TestStep.Result: The stimulation starts and quickly stops. You MAY see the following message: "Lumos is not stimulating; it aborted into the X state." (also sent to the log file). X is the state that the lumos is in and would either be "Ready" or "Parsed". Whether the message appears or not, lumos will not crash.

TestStep.Action: Repeat this 20 times.
TestStep.Result: Stimulation starts and stops as expected.

TestStep.Action: Start stimulation.
TestStep.Result: Stimulation starts and Stimulation button turns red and says Stop.

TestStep.Action: Click the stimulation button repeatedly for 30 seconds starting and stopping the stimulation.
TestStep.Result: The stimulation starts and quickly stops. You MAY see the following message: "Lumos is not stimulating; it aborted into the X state." (also sent to the log file). X is the state that the lumos is in and would either be "Ready" or "Parsed". Whether the message appears or not, lumos will not crash.

Test.JiraSummary: Heater Functionality

TestStep.Action: Start with M2 off and door closed with no plate loaded. Reset AxIS Navigator and turn on attached Maestro.
TestStep.Result: Heater turns on. Set point is 37 degrees.

TestStep.Action: Observe Maestro screen and AxIS Navigator thumbnail.
TestStep.Result: Temperature on both screens and thermometer symbol are all yellow as the temperature increases.

TestStep.Action: Observe when temperature reaches 37 degrees.
TestStep.Result: Screen message: Chamber at 37C. Please Load Plate. Temperature on both screens and thermometer symbol are all green. Temperature does not exceed 37.2 degrees.

TestStep.Action: Measure the plate temperature in different spots with the infrared gun.
TestStep.Result: It measures close to 37C.

TestStep.Action: Set the temperature to 40C.
TestStep.Result: Temperature on both screens and thermometer symbol are all blue as temperature increases. They all transition to blue/green then green as temperature reaches 40C setpoint. Temperature does not exceed 40.2C.

TestStep.Action: Measure the plate temperature in different spots with the infrared gun.
TestStep.Result: It measures close to 40C.

TestStep.Action: Set the temperature to 35C.
TestStep.Result: Temperature on both screens and thermometer symbol are all red as temperature decreases. They all turn orange then yellow then green as temperature reaches 30C setpoint. Temperature does not go below 34.8C.

TestStep.Action: Measure the plate temperature in different spots with the infrared gun.
TestStep.Result: It measures close to 35C.

TestStep.Action: Change set point to 25C.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Measure the plate temperature in different spots with the infrared gun.
TestStep.Result: It measures close to 25C.

TestStep.Action: Change setpoint to 37C and start a timer.
TestStep.Result: Heater reaches 37C within 3 minutes.

TestStep.Action: Measure the plate temperature in different spots with the infrared gun.
TestStep.Result: It measures close to 37C.

Test.JiraSummary: M2 Gas Control (NEEDS REAL GAS FLOW)

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS with no device connected.
TestStep.Result: No Environmental Controls present.

TestStep.Action: Connect/turn on the M2 with no plate loaded and door open.
TestStep.Result: Environmental Controls pane appears. Heater is off and set to 37 degrees. Gas is off. Thumbnail shows the current plate temperature. and -.-% CO2 for gas.

TestStep.Action: Check "Gas Source" options.
TestStep.Result: Options available are "100% CO2" and "Custom Mix".

TestStep.Action: View the defaults for gas settings.
TestStep.Result: CO2 Control: OFF Gas Source: 100% CO2 Concentration (%): 5

TestStep.Action: Set devmode on and view other defauls.
TestStep.Result: Ignore Door: unchecked Valve level: min Alarm Settings: ON Max Deviation (%): 1 Max Deviation Time (m): 5 Temperature plot legend now has power usage too.

TestStep.Action: Close the door. Turn gas on and CO2 Control On.
TestStep.Result: CO2 Control switches to "ON". Concentration set point and actual are plotted.

TestStep.Action: Check the thumbnail.
TestStep.Result: CO2 number should be green because it's near it's set point.

TestStep.Action: Change the Concentration to 15%. (In Navigator)
TestStep.Result: Thumbnail turns red then orange then green as it reaches the set point.

TestStep.Action: Change the Concentration to 5%.
TestStep.Result: Thumbnail turns red then orange then green as it reaches the set point.

TestStep.Action: Turn on Alarm Settings and set Max Deviation (%) to 0.09
TestStep.Result: Not allowed. 0.1% is min.

TestStep.Action: Set Max Deviation (%) to 2.1.
TestStep.Result: Not allowed. 2.0% is max.

TestStep.Action: Set Max Deviation Time to 21.
TestStep.Result: Not allowed. 20 minutes is max.

TestStep.Action: Change to 0.1% Max Deviation % and 5 minute max Deviation Time.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Shut off gas tanks.
TestStep.Result: AxIS alarm pops up after 5 minutes and stays until closed. (It will not return if it is closed and gas concentration has not stabilized yet.) Alarm bell symbol appears on Maestro screen.

TestStep.Action: Turn on gas tanks.
TestStep.Result: AxIS gas plot stabilizes. Pop-up remains. Alarm bell disappears.

TestStep.Action: Close the alarm pop-up.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Toggle Gas Control Off then On.
TestStep.Result: Nothing happens.

TestStep.Action: Set Concentration to -0.5%.
TestStep.Result: Not allowed. 0% is min.

TestStep.Action: Turn off CO2 control.
TestStep.Result: AxIS stops plotting CO2 concentration and Flow Rate. Thumbnail CO2 numbers in graph turn gray and shows dashes instead of numbers.

TestStep.Action: Turn on CO2 control.
TestStep.Result: Thumbnail is no longer gray and AxIS plots again.

TestStep.Action: Switch gas to Custom Mix.
TestStep.Result: CO2 still plots. Valve slider is "open" to the right". Set Point no longer plots. CO2 concentration is plotted and displayed in Maaestro screen and AxiS Navigator thumbnail.

TestStep.Action: Open the door.
TestStep.Result: Gas flow stops. -.-% CO2 in gray displayed everywhere.

TestStep.Action: Turn off Maestro
TestStep.Result: Heater/mixer thumbnail disappears.

Test.JiraSummary: Alert the user when out of gas (NEEDS REAL GAS FLOW)

TestStep.Action: Run M2 with gas control on with gas.
TestStep.Result: M2 is measuring CO2.

TestStep.Action: Restrict/stop CO2 flow into M2. Wait for concentration to drop 1% for 5 minute.
TestStep.Result: Red bell icon appears on M2 screen, CO2 text turns red on screen and thumbnail on M2 Pro. AxIS Navigator pop-up says: "The CO2 concentration deviated from set point. Please check that your gas supply is connected, the valve is open and the gas pressure is within the limits specified in the Maestro User's Guide. View the Event Log for more details."

TestStep.Action: Stop restricting CO2 flow into M2. Wait for concentration to get back within 1% of the set concentration.
TestStep.Result: Red bell icon disappears, text turns green again in screen and thumbnail.

Test.JiraSummary: Req. RIGOL Loud Signal Preservation

TestStep.Action: Install a signal plate in the Maestro system and directly connect the function generator to it.
TestStep.Result: The plate engages properly.

TestStep.Action: Begin streaming live data on a Maestro with mechanics.
TestStep.Result: Data begins streaming.

TestStep.Result: A sine wave is visible across the continuous plots.

TestStep.Action: Increase the signal frequency until the signal starts to distort. The wave will look spiky at 3 kHz. Perform a recording of the RAW stream at this point, as well as a SPK file.
TestStep.Result: Two files are recorded successfully.

TestStep.Action: Load the RAW file that was just recorded and replay it.
TestStep.Result: Recorded signal distortions reflect the live signal distortions accurately.

TestStep.Action: Return to the live stream and alter the input signal to be a 20 Hz pulse wave with the minimum possible duty cycle. Observe and record 15 seconds of the pulses on the live stream.
TestStep.Result: Rapid peaks are visible across the plate with the proper orientation.

TestStep.Action: Set the live stream to Cardiac:Standard mode and observe and record 15 seconds of the pulses.
TestStep.Result: Rapid peaks are visible across the plate with the proper orientation.

TestStep.Action: Load the two 15-second pulse files into AxIS and review them.
TestStep.Result: Changing between high gain / low gain modes does not adversely affect the polarity of the observed/recorded data. Both have positive pulses. High gain/Neural spikes mode shows additional negative artifacts.

Test.JiraSummary: Req. RIGOL Cardiac Beat Detector: Injected Waveform

TestStep.Result: Well Beat List will be output.

TestStep.Action: *For Diligent:* * Make sure that it says Independent instead of Not synchronized under the File menu. * Trigger = Manual, check Auto, Repeat = 10 *For RIGOL:* * Click the "output" button then the "Burst" button. Set the Cycle number to 10. * Press "Trigger", then "Source". If the text on the screen isn't set to manual, then click "Manual".
TestStep.Result: The source is set to trigger manually

TestStep.Action: * Start recording, wait 5 seconds. * Click the "Manual" button in RIGOL or Run then Manual Trigger on Diligent, and watch the signal until it ends. * Wait 10 seconds or until all beats are processed, then press the record button again (keep streaming\!).stop recording.
TestStep.Result: A file is output.

TestStep.Action: Open up the file.
TestStep.Result: The "Beat Number" column of the csv table contains beats numbered 1-9. All in all there should be 9 beats for each well. That is, for a 12-well plate there should be 12 rows for beat #1, 12 rows for beat #2, etc., for a total of 108 rows. For a 6-well plate there should be a total of 54 rows: 6 for beat #1, 6 for beat #2, etc.

TestStep.Result: Blue boxes appear overlayed on top of the waveforms.

TestStep.Action: In the CBD settings, uncheck "FPD Confidence Interval" and click Apply.

Test.JiraSummary: Req. RIGOL Spike Detector: Injected Waveform

TestStep.Action: Power on the attached Muse / Maestro with a signal plate engaged and attached to the function generator.
TestStep.Result: Muse / Maestro powers on.

TestStep.Action: Play AxIS in Neural: Spikes analog mode with Median Noise Subraction unchecked.
TestStep.Result: AxIS plays.

TestStep.Action: * Set the diligent function generator to 1 Hz Pulse, 1s Period, 1V Amplitude, 0V Offset, 0.1% Symmetry, 0 degree Phase Workspace attached. OR * Set the RIGOL AWG to generate a 1 Hz pulse wave with a peak voltage of 1V and a minimum voltage of 0. Duty cycle as close to 0 as possible.
TestStep.Result: OK

TestStep.Action: Add a spike detector to the stream with 3ms Pre and Post Spike Durations and observe the output. Set "Coincidence Event Removal" filter to "None".
TestStep.Result: AxIS displays detected trigger-induced spikes.

TestStep.Action: Stop streaming and stop the generator. Change the Spike Detector Method to Static Threshold Crossing, set to 50uV and stream. When offset correction is done, start the generator.
TestStep.Result: AxIS may detect more channels with spikes (depending on overall noise) when set to Static Threshold Crossing with real cells. Detects the same with generated signal.

TestStep.Action: Stop streaming and the generator. Change the Spike Detector Method to Peak Detection Adaptive Threshold with Peak Detection set to Positive Inflection and observe output. Start streaming, wait for offset correction, then start the generator.
TestStep.Result: AxIS detects the rising edge of the spike and plots it.

TestStep.Action: Stop streaming and the generator. Change Peak Detection to Negative Inflection and observe the output. Start streaming, wait for offset correction, then start the generator.
TestStep.Result: AxIS detects the falling edge of the spike and plots it (roughly flipped from the Positive Inflection run).

TestStep.Action: Stop streaming and the generator. Change Peak Detection to First Peak and observe the output. Start streaming, wait for offset correction, then start the generator.
TestStep.Result: AxIS detects the first peak (visually appears as Positive Inflection).

TestStep.Action: Stop streaming and the generator. Change Peak Detection to Maximum Amplitude and observe the output. Start streaming, wait for offset correction, then start the generator.
TestStep.Result: AxIS detects the maximum amplitude of the spike (Could visually appears as Positive or Negative Inflection, whichever is larger).

TestStep.Action: Stop streaming and the generator. Change the Spike Detector Method to Peak Detection Static Threshold with Peak Detection set to Positive Inflection and observe the output. Start streaming, wait for offset correction, then start the generator.
TestStep.Result: AxIS detects the rising edge of the spike and plots it. AxIS may detect more channels with spikes (depending on overall noise) when set to Static Threshold Crossing with real cells. Detects the same with generated signal.

TestStep.Action: Stop streaming and the generator. Change Peak Detection to Negative Inflection and observe output. Start streaming, wait for offset correction, then start the generator.
TestStep.Result: AxIS detects the falling edge of the spike and plots it (roughly flipped from the Positive Inflection run).

TestStep.Action: Stop streaming and the generator. Change Peak Detection to First Peak and observe the output. Start streaming, wait for offset correction, then start the generator.
TestStep.Result: AxIS detects the first peak (visually appears as Positive Inflection).

TestStep.Action: Stop streaming and the generator. Change Peak Detection to Maximum Amplitude and observe output. Start streaming, wait for offset correction, then start the generator.
TestStep.Result: AxIS detects the maximum amplitude of the spike (Could visually appears as Positive or Negative Inflection, whichever is larger).

TestStep.Action: Set live to 12-well plate or load 12-well file.

Test.JiraSummary: M2 Plate Mechanism and Eject Button

TestStep.Action: Load plate via AxIS UI.
TestStep.Result: Plate mechanism engages. Door closes.

TestStep.Action: Eject plate via AxIS UI.
TestStep.Result: Door opens. Plate mechanism ejects.

TestStep.Action: Load plate via physical button.
TestStep.Result: Plate mechanism engages. Door closes.

TestStep.Action: Eject plate via physical button.
TestStep.Result: Door opens. Plate mechanism ejects.

TestStep.Action: Can't eject via AxIS UI while playing.
TestStep.Result: True.

TestStep.Action: Can't eject via AxIS UI while paused playing.
TestStep.Result: True.

TestStep.Action: Can't eject via AxIS UI while recording.
TestStep.Result: True.

TestStep.Action: Can't eject via AxIS UI while paused recording.
TestStep.Result: True.

TestStep.Action: Push physical eject button while playing.
TestStep.Result: Playing aborted. Plate ejects.

TestStep.Action: Push physical eject button while paused playing.
TestStep.Result: Playing aborted. Plate ejects.

TestStep.Action: Push physical eject button while recording.
TestStep.Result: Recording aborted. Plate ejects.

TestStep.Action: Push physical eject button while paused recording.
TestStep.Result: Recording aborted. Plate ejects.

TestStep.Action: Can't eject via AxIS UI while scheduled recording.
TestStep.Result: True.

TestStep.Action: Push the door open while scheduled recording.
TestStep.Result: Door opens. Scheduled recording continues.

TestStep.Action: Manually close the door.
TestStep.Result: Door closes. Scheduled recording continues.

TestStep.Action: Push physical eject button while scheduled recording is engaged and recording.
TestStep.Result: The door opens and the plate holder ejects. AxIS switches to "Stopped" streaming state, and a banner message pops up saying "Your Scheduled recording was aborted due to removal of the plate (barcode)"

TestStep.Action: Push physical eject button while scheduled recording is engaged but not recording.
TestStep.Result: The door opens and the plate holder ejects. AxIS switches to "Stopped" streaming state, and a banner message pops up saying "Your Scheduled recording was aborted due to removal of the plate (barcode)"

TestStep.Action: Playbar buttons disabled while plate not engaged.
TestStep.Result: True.

Test.JiraSummary: M2 Door Functionality (Manual)

TestStep.Action: Turn on Maestro. Eject plate.
TestStep.Result: Maestro turns on. Plate up. Door open.

TestStep.Action: Try to close the door manually.
TestStep.Result: There's resistance. Mechanism does not want the door to close with the plate up to prevent jams.

TestStep.Action: Dock with no plate.
TestStep.Result: Plate down. Door closed.

TestStep.Action: Open door manually.
TestStep.Result: Motor engages and takes over. Opens.

TestStep.Action: Close door manually.
TestStep.Result: Motor engages and takes over. Closes.

TestStep.Action: Power off then power on with door closed.
TestStep.Result: Door stays where it is.

TestStep.Action: * Power off. * Open the door halfway then power on.
TestStep.Result: Door stays where it is.

TestStep.Action: Close the door and start streaming.
TestStep.Result: Streaming.

TestStep.Action: Open the door manually while playing.
TestStep.Result: Door opens. Streaming continues.

TestStep.Action: * Close door. * Pause while playing. * Open door manually.
TestStep.Result: Door opens.

TestStep.Action: * Close door. * Start playing and recording. * Open door manually.
TestStep.Result: Door opens. Recording continues.

TestStep.Action: * Close door. * Pause while recording. * Open door manually.
TestStep.Result: Door opens. Navigator stays the same.

TestStep.Action: * Stop playback and recording and close door. * Start a schedule recording. * Open door manually while schedule recording is engaged and recording.
TestStep.Result: Door opens. Scheduled Recording is unaffected.

TestStep.Action: * Close door. * Open door manually while schedule recording is engaged but not recording.
TestStep.Result: Door opens. Scheduled Recording is unaffected.

TestStep.Action: Verify playbar disabled while door open.
TestStep.Result: Yes. Playbar unaffected.

TestStep.Action: Interrupt / block door opening.
TestStep.Result: * Door stops at current position. * Door jammed warning pops up. * Other warnings may pop-up.

TestStep.Action: * Turn OFF M2. * Dismiss all pop-ups and reset AxIS Navigator.
TestStep.Result: * Maestro turns off. * Door stays where it is.

TestStep.Action: Turn ON M2.
TestStep.Result: * Maestro turns on. * Door stays where it is.

TestStep.Action: * Open door all the way then try to close. * Interrupt / block door closing when is about halfway closed.
TestStep.Result: * Door stops and opens. * Pop-up warning appears: "Door could not reach Closed position. Please check for obstruction."

TestStep.Action: Interrupt door closing by placing with something small, like a 22 gauge wire or screwdriver tip, against the front edge. That way the door closes almost all the way.
TestStep.Result: * Door stops and reopens. * AxIS should display a warning: "Door could not reach Closed position. Please check for obstruction."

Test.JiraSummary: Full Plate Stimulation Current Measurement

TestStep.Action: Change the stimulation frequency to once.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Result: Settings set.

TestStep.Action: Set the stimulation plate to 48-well.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Result: The meter measurement divided by 2 electrodes is 90 uA +/- 20 uA.

TestStep.Action: Select 1 well to stimulate and trigger.
TestStep.Result: The meter measurement divided by 16 electrodes is 90 uA +/- 20 uA.

TestStep.Action: Select 3 wells to stimulate and trigger.
TestStep.Result: The meter measurement divided by 48 electrodes is 90 uA +/- 20 uA.

TestStep.Action: In the debug console, type "devmode true".
TestStep.Result: Success.

TestStep.Action: Change the plate type to Transparent MEA in Experiment Setup and Stimulation Studio.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Choose a single electrode to stimulate and trigger.
TestStep.Result: The meter measures 90 uA +/- 20 uA.

TestStep.Action: Select two channels to stimulate and trigger.
TestStep.Result: The meter measurement divided by 2 electrodes is 90 uA +/- 20 uA.

TestStep.Action: Select 1 well to stimulate and trigger.
TestStep.Result: The meter measurement divided by 16 electrodes is 90 uA +/- 20 uA.

TestStep.Action: Select 3 wells to stimulate and trigger.
TestStep.Result: The meter measurement divided by 48 electrodes is 90 uA +/- 20 uA.

TestStep.Action: Change the plate type to Artichoke View in Experiment Setup and Stimulation Studio.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Choose a single electrode to stimulate and trigger.
TestStep.Result: The meter measures 90 uA +/- 20 uA.

TestStep.Action: Select two channels to stimulate and trigger.
TestStep.Result: The meter measurement divided by 2 electrodes is 90 uA +/- 20 uA.

TestStep.Action: Select 1 artichoke to stimulate and trigger.
TestStep.Result: The meter measurement divided by 64 electrodes is 90 uA +/- 20 uA.

TestStep.Action: Choose a single electrode to stimulate in each artichoke and trigger.
TestStep.Result: The meter measurement divided by 12 electrodes is 90 uA +/- 20 uA.

TestStep.Action: Choose 4 electrodes to stimulate in each artichoke and trigger.
TestStep.Result: The meter measurement divided by 48 electrodes is 90 uA +/- 20 uA.

TestStep.Action: Choose 6 electrodes in 4 artichokes and 5 electrodes in the other 8 to stimulate in each artichoke and trigger.
TestStep.Result: The meter measurement divided by 64 electrodes is 90 uA +/- 20 uA.

TestStep.Action: Select 6 electrodes on 6 artichokes on the left side (one bank) to stimulate and trigger.
TestStep.Result: The meter measurement divided by 36 electrodes is 90 uA +/- 20 uA.

TestStep.Action: Select 6 electrodes on 6 artichokes on the right side (one bank) to stimulate and trigger.
TestStep.Result: The meter measurement divided by 36 electrodes is 90 uA +/- 20 uA.

TestStep.Action: In the debug console, type "platingmode true".
TestStep.Result: Success.

TestStep.Result: The meter measurement divided by 72 electrodes is 90 uA +/- 20 uA.

TestStep.Result: The meter measurement divided by 384 electrodes is 90 uA +/- 20 uA.

TestStep.Action: Select the other 6 full artichokes on the right side (one bank) to stimulate and trigger.
TestStep.Result: The meter measurement divided by 384 electrodes is 90 uA +/- 20 uA.

TestStep.Action: Select the entire plate to stimulate and trigger.
TestStep.Result: The meter measurement divided by 768 electrodes is 90 uA +/- 20 uA.

Test.JiraSummary: No extra bursts with non E-stim plates after 5 sec

TestStep.Action: Connect a live source to AxIS, and add a Neural Real-Time --> Electrically Evoked configuration.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Select Classic MEA 48 well plate.
TestStep.Result: Active plate is set.

TestStep.Action: Create a one-time stimulation that stimulates the bottom right electrode in a well. Switch to the Spike Plot and begin playing.
TestStep.Result: Live source plays.

TestStep.Action: Trigger your stimulation.
TestStep.Result: All electrodes should display a spike. Wait 10 seconds, ensuring that no phantom spikes are seen in the stimulated electrode.

Test.JiraSummary: Display error message while stimulating and loading a diff waveform type

TestStep.Action: Connect a live source to AxIS with a lumos attached.
TestStep.Result: Both devices are connected.

TestStep.Action: Create an "until stopped" stimulation of both types and save each.
TestStep.Result: Two .sswf files are created, one optical & one electrical

TestStep.Action: Load the electrical file, hit play, and begin stimulating.
TestStep.Result: Stimulation begins as normal.

TestStep.Action: While stimulating, load the optical waveform.
TestStep.Result: Error message displays: "Cannot load Optical stimulations while performing an Electrical Stimulation"

TestStep.Action: Stop the stimulation, and load the optical waveform file. Hit play and begin stimulating.
TestStep.Result: The lumos stimulates as normal.

TestStep.Action: While stimulating, load the electrical waveform.
TestStep.Result: Error message displays: "Cannot load Electrical stimulations while performing an Optical Stimulation"

Test.JiraSummary: Zoom levels adjust for Stimulation Inspector

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS and load a file or connect to a live source. Attach a stimulation inspector.
TestStep.Result: Stimulation inspector has 5ms pre-tag and 20 ms post-tag durations.

TestStep.Action: Navigate to the spike plot & press play.
TestStep.Result: The ms/Div information defaults to 5 ms/div.

TestStep.Action: Press stop. Then adjust the stimulation inspector values. Set the post-tag duration to 5 ms. Press 'OK' and play again.
TestStep.Result: The ms/Div is now set to 2 ms/Div.

TestStep.Action: While playing, add a spike detector with a pre-spike duration of 10 ms, and a post-spike duration of 10 ms. Press 'OK'.
TestStep.Result: The ms/Div jumps to 4 ms/Div.

TestStep.Action: Remove the spike detector.
TestStep.Result: The ms/Div goes back down to 2.

Test.JiraSummary: Maestro / Navigator responds to web commands

TestStep.Action: *Requires Maestro Pro* Make sure SoapUI is installed. https://www.soapui.org/downloads/latest-release.html
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Check out the SoapUI Tests repo. [https://github.com/axionbio/sw-soapui-tests/blob/main/M2-REST-Project-soapui-project.xml|https://github.com/axionbio/sw-soapui-tests/blob/main/M2-REST-Project-soapui-project.xml]
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Open Soap UI and click on File -> Import Project. Select M2-REST-Project-soapui-project.xml
TestStep.Result: M2 REST Project is imported.

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS Navigator connected to an M2 with a Lumos 48 plate engaged.
TestStep.Result: AxIS resets and M2 is recognized. Lumos 48 is the Active Plate.

TestStep.Action: Expand M2 REST Project -> AxIS TestSuite -> Experiment Folder Test -> Test Steps and double-click on SetExperimentFolder
TestStep.Result: SetExperimentFolder Window opens.

TestStep.Action: Edit the "Value" for your own username. (Can't use %USERPROFILE% to set current user. Can't use Public in Windows 10.)
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Close SetExperimentFolder window and double-click on AxIS TestSuite.
TestStep.Result: AxIS TestSuite window opens.

TestStep.Action: Click on Play and follow prompts. Don't forget to set the Result Status for manual steps.
TestStep.Result: All tests pass.

TestStep.Action: Reduce SoapUI window size so you can monitor AxIS NAv and the desktop.
TestStep.Result: Done.

Test.JiraSummary: Artifact Eliminator doesn't blank too much

TestStep.Action: Add a Neural -> Real-time -> Electrically Evoked configuration to a live Maestro or to a file with stimulation tags.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: If using a live Maestro, also add a cardiac pacer node and stimulate one electrode per well every five seconds.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Play (and stimulate) and switch to view the raster plot.
TestStep.Result: The raster plot shows that the beginning of burst activity lines up with the electrical tag. The bug used to show a gap between the tag and burst activity because too much blanking was essentially taking place.

Test.JiraSummary: Stim Studio default tags are displayed in skyline & raster plot

TestStep.Action: With a Maestro & Lumos connected, create an 'until stopped' optical stimulation with one lane and no tags. Make sure the Lumos is connected to the M2’s Lumos input via the sync output with a bnc cable.
TestStep.Result: Created. The "Start" stimulation button is enabled. At the top left in the skyline view is a tag inserted before any of the stimulations.

TestStep.Action: Add a spike detector to the Maestro and navigate to the Spike Plots module.
TestStep.Result: You can see the empty electrode plots as well as the empty raster plot.

TestStep.Action: Begin streaming, and begin the stimulation
TestStep.Result: You can see the tags (white triangles) crawl across the raster plot

TestStep.Action: Record a raw file for 1 minute.
TestStep.Result: File is recorded.

TestStep.Action: # Stop the stimulation. # Load the recorded file, add a Spike Detector and play in a loop.
TestStep.Result: File plays.

TestStep.Action: Switch to the raster plot and verify tags are shown.
TestStep.Result: They are there.

TestStep.Action: # Switch the stimulation type to Electrical. # Create an "until stopped" electrical stimulation with no tags.
TestStep.Result: * Created. * The "Start" stimulation button is not enabled. * At the top left in the skyline view is a tag inserted before any of the stimulations.

TestStep.Action: Play the live source again.
TestStep.Result: The "Start" stimulation button is now enabled.

TestStep.Action: Navigate to the Spike Plots module.
TestStep.Result: You can see the empty electrode plots as well as the empty raster plot.

TestStep.Action: Start the stimulation
TestStep.Result: You can see the tags (white triangles) crawl across the raster plot.

TestStep.Action: Record for 1 minute.
TestStep.Result: File is recorded.

TestStep.Action: # Stop the stimulation. # Load the recorded file, add a Spike Detector and play in a loop.
TestStep.Result: File plays.

TestStep.Action: Switch to the raster plot and verify tags are shown.
TestStep.Result: The tags are there.

Test.JiraSummary: Verify beat times match

TestStep.Action: Copy locally and load \trunk\SoftwareTesting\RAW Files\cardiac\20150326_19-030_Pacing_Axio_250uA_2ms_2Elec_12-well(001).raw
TestStep.Result: Loaded.

TestStep.Action: Load Cardiac Field Potentials configuration to the file.
TestStep.Result: Configuration added.

TestStep.Action: Set file for accelerated playback and hit record.
TestStep.Result: Cardiac Analysis CSV created,

TestStep.Action: Open csv and spot check beats for some electrodes in the source data. Make sure to check some in well C3.
TestStep.Result: For each electrode checked: Time(s) - Arrival Time (ms) = Time (s) in the corresponding synchronized well beat number.

Test.JiraSummary: Output RMS measurements in Devmode

TestStep.Action: Press the Record button to Stop recording.
TestStep.Result: Recording stops.

TestStep.Action: Open the Noise Estimate csv. Type the following command in an empty cell. "=COUNTA(D2:BBB2)"
TestStep.Result: It contains 768 rows. One for each channel. It means none are empty.

TestStep.Action: Examine the channel headers.
TestStep.Result: They are listed in the format -A,1,1,1- A1_11 to -C,4,8,8- C4_88.

TestStep.Action: Examine Column C, "Slice Time".
TestStep.Result: The row shows the time the data was recorded in 0.25 second increments.

TestStep.Action: Scroll to the last row and compare to the RMS values displayed on the screen.
TestStep.Result: The vast majority of channel values match their corresponding spreadsheet entry within 0.1E-06V. Discrepancies due to rounding.

Test.JiraSummary: v2.0 Blank out samples from capture and FPD detection that are associated with pacing

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS. With a Classic MEA 48 (incl. AccuSpot) plate engaged, load NAV-453.datastreams configuration from trunk\SoftwareTesting\JIRA Supplemental Files\NAV-453. Or set the plate manually.
TestStep.Result: Configuration loaded with two identical static Spike Detectors. One of which is after a Pacing Artifact Elimination Node. Analog mode is set to Cardiac: Standard.

TestStep.Action: Switch to Stimulation Studio and set the plate type to 48-well AccuSpot.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Load NAV-453.sswf waveform from trunk\SoftwareTesting\JIRA Supplemental Files\NAV-453.
TestStep.Result: Pacer is loaded with 0.5ms duration. Triggering is set to "Until stopped every 2 seconds". The bottom row of each well in row A is set to stimulate.

TestStep.Action: Play AxIS.
TestStep.Result: Start button turns green.

TestStep.Action: Stimulate. Compare the Spike plots from the stimulated wells versus the non-stimulated wells.
TestStep.Result: The non-stimulated wells show no difference between Spike Detectors. All electrodes show spikes. For the stimulated wells: The Spike Detector with the Pacing Artifact Elimination node show large spikes in every electrode that is not stimulated. The stimulated electrodes will show a small or no spike due to the Artifact Elimination node compensating for it. The other Spike Detector will show differences between the stimulated and non-stimulated electrodes, but because there's no PAE there will be spikes in all electrodes.

TestStep.Action: While stimulating, click the record button and save 30 seconds of the raw file and the artifact eliminated raw file.
TestStep.Result: Files are recorded.

TestStep.Action: Load and play back the regular raw file.
TestStep.Result: It plays back with artifacts/spikes.

TestStep.Action: Copy the nodes from the Maestro to the file including both Spike Detectors. and play the file from the beginning.
TestStep.Result: File plays.

TestStep.Action: Pause the file after 20 seconds and pause it. View the Spike Plots.
TestStep.Result: Notice two different spike signatures. One with eliminated artifacts and lower values due to being after the Pacing Artifact Elimination node.

TestStep.Action: Clear the spikes, scrub back to the beginning of the file and play.
TestStep.Result: The two Spike Plots remain showing differences throughout the entire file. Including before and after the 20 second mark.

TestStep.Action: Load and play back the feature-blanked raw file from the Pacing Artifact Elimination node.
TestStep.Result: Waveform looks flat/minimal noise where the pacing artifacts would have been.

TestStep.Action: Record a raw file of the last 15 seconds of the feature blanked file and play it.
TestStep.Result: The file plays fine.

Test.JiraSummary: Req. Oscilloscope Electrical Stim Studio Waveform Verification

TestStep.Result: Oscilloscope begins streaming and the noise is centered on the y=0 line.

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS, set to Neural: Spikes, then play.
TestStep.Result: Offset correction begins. The oscilloscope's stream remains centered around the zero line.

TestStep.Action: Set the plate type to CytoView MEA 24 (you can use View -> Show All Plates if you need to). Navigate to Stim Studio and set the stim plate type to CytoView MEA 24.
TestStep.Result: The active plate type matches the stimulation plate type.

TestStep.Action: Set all electrodes to stimulate, and set the stimulation to occur "until stopped" every 2 seconds.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Drag the Cardiac stim node into Lane A.
TestStep.Result: "Start" button is green.

TestStep.Action: Edit the Cardiac stim node to have the following properties, then press OK: Stim Paddle Stim Duration: 500 ms Voltage: 1 V Max Current: 20 uA
TestStep.Result: The new values are accepted.

TestStep.Action: Start the stimulation.
TestStep.Result: You can see the stimulation in the continuous plot as well as the oscilloscope screen.

TestStep.Action: Pause the oscilloscope screen with the "Run/Stop" button, and using the "Cursor" button, measure the waveform you see.
TestStep.Result: The stimulation starts by dipping 1 V down for 250ms, then it shoots up, to 1 V above the zero line for another 250ms. Then there is noise for 1.5 s until the stimulation begins again.

TestStep.Action: Stop the stimulation. Remove the cardiac node, and add a neural node. Edit the neural node to have the following properties, then click OK: Stim Duration: 1 s Voltage: 1 V Max Current: 50 uA
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Start the stimulation. When the stimulation fills up the oscilloscpe screen, pause it and measure it with the cursor.
TestStep.Result: The stimulation starts by going up 1 V for 500 ms, then it dips to 1 V below the zero line for another 500 ms. Then there is noise for 1 s until the stimulation repeats.

TestStep.Action: Stop the stimulation. Remove the neural node, and add a monophasic node. Set the node properties to the below values and click OK: Stim Duration: 1 s Max Voltage: 1 V Current: 250 uA
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Start the stimulation. When the stimulation fills up the oscilloscpe screen, pause it and measure it with the cursor.
TestStep.Result: The stimulation starts by rising up 1 V for 1 s. At the end of the 1s, the signal tapers back down to zero over the next second.

TestStep.Action: Stop the stimulation. Remove the monophasic node, and add a biphasic node. Set the following properties and click OK: Phase 1 Stim Duration: 500 ms Max Voltage: 1 V Current: 150 uA Phase 2 Stim Duration: 500 ms Max Voltage: 1 V Current: -250 uA
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Start the stimulation. When the stimulation fills up the oscilloscpe screen, pause it and measure it with the cursor.
TestStep.Result: The stimulation starts by rising up 1 V for 500 ms, then it dips down to 1 V below the zero line for another 500 ms. Then there is noise for 1s.

TestStep.Action: Stop the stimulation. Remove the biphasic node. Add the following nodes in order: * Monophasic node with duration = 250 ms, voltage = 500 mV, current = 250 uA * Delay (Floating) node with duration = 1.5 s * Monophasic node with duration = 250 ms, voltage = 500 mV, current = 250 uA
TestStep.Result: Done. Stimulation Start button is green.

TestStep.Action: Start the stimulation. When the stimulation fills up the oscilloscpe screen, pause it and measure it with the cursor. Measure the length of time between the monophasic stims.
TestStep.Result: The length of time is 1.5 s.

Test.JiraSummary: M2 Screen Scheduled Recording Timing

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS, Connect a Maestro Pro to AxIS. Set it to save raw files and set an output folder.
TestStep.Result: Record button is enabled.

TestStep.Action: Create a scheduled recording. Record every 30 seconds Record for 10 seconds Starting "Immediately" Execute "Until Stopped"
TestStep.Result: Start Schedule button is enabled.

TestStep.Action: From a stopped position, Click "Start Schedule". View M2 Pro screen.
TestStep.Result: The left corner of the grey banner displays "Until Stopped" Offset correction begins. M2 screen displays "Initializing scheduled recording" in the blue banner at the bottom of the screen. When recording begins, the blue banner changes to say "Recording for [time remaining]". Confirm the time remaining starts at 10 seconds. When the recording finishes, the blue banner says, "Next recording is in [countdown]". Confirm the countdown begins at 20 seconds. Blue banner does not flash randomly/ ~ every 5 seconds..

TestStep.Action: Stop schedule, but keep streaming. View M2 Pro screen.
TestStep.Result: The left side of the grey banner now displays a green play arrow and an increasing time, showing how long it has been streaming since streaming began (~30 seconds).

TestStep.Action: Click "Start Schedule". View M2 Pro screen.
TestStep.Result: The left corner of the grey banner displays "Until Stopped" There is NOT an offset correction message. When recording begins, the blue banner changes to say "Recording for [time remaining]". Confirm the time remaining starts at 10 seconds. When the recording finishes, the blue banner says, "Next recording is in [countdown]". Confirm the countdown begins at 20 seconds.

TestStep.Action: Stop streaming and the Schedule Recording. Create a new scheduled recording. Record every 30 seconds Record for 10 seconds Starting "Immediately" Execute "Once"
TestStep.Result: Start Schedule button is enabled.

TestStep.Action: Click "Start Schedule". View M2 Pro screen.
TestStep.Result: The left corner of the grey banner displays the green play arrow and a countdown to when the recording *will end*. Countdown begins at 25 seconds. Offset correction begins. M2 screen displays "Initializing scheduled recording" in the blue banner at the bottom of the screen. When recording begins, the blue banner changes to say "Recording for [time remaining]". Confirm the time remaining starts at 10 seconds. When the recording finishes the blue banner goes away. The top left timestamp is incrementing up, starting at 26 seconds.

TestStep.Action: Set up a triggered electrical stimulation.
TestStep.Result: The trigger button is enabled.

TestStep.Action: In Scheduled Recording screen, check "Auto Stimulate" and set it to 5 sec from recording start.
TestStep.Result: "Start Schedule" button is enabled.

TestStep.Action: Stop Streaming. Click "Start Schedule". View M2 Pro screen.
TestStep.Result: The left corner of the grey banner displays the green play arrow and a countdown to when the recording *will end*. Countdown begins at 25 seconds. When recording begins, the blue banner changes to say "Recording for [time remaining]". Confirm the time remaining starts at 10 seconds. The stimulation occurs ~5 seconds into the recording. Confirm the time remaining in the blue banner is ~5 seconds. When the recording finishes the blue banner goes away. The top left timestamp is incrementing up, starting at 26 seconds.

TestStep.Action: Click Stop. Create a new scheduled recording. Record every 30 seconds Record for 10 seconds Starting "Immediately" Execute "Until [2 minutes from now]" Click Start Schedule. View M2 Pro screen.
TestStep.Result: The left corner of the grey banner displays the red clock and a countdown to when the recording *will end*. Countdown begins at 2+ minutes. Offset correction begins. M2 screen displays "Initializing scheduled recording" in the blue banner at the bottom of the screen. When recording begins, the blue banner changes to say "Recording for [time remaining]". Confirm the time remaining starts at 10 seconds.

TestStep.Action: Let the schedule run out.
TestStep.Result: It executes for 2 minutes. When the recording finishes the blue banner goes away. The top left timestamp is incrementing up, starting at ~2.5 minutes.

TestStep.Action: Click Stop. Create a new scheduled recording. Record every 30 seconds Record for 10 seconds Starting "Immediately" Execute "Exactly 3 times" Click Start Schedule. View M2 Pro screen.
TestStep.Result: The left corner of the grey banner displays the red clock and a countdown to when the recording *will end*. Countdown begins at 00:01:25. Offset correction begins. M2 screen displays "Initializing scheduled recording" in the blue banner at the bottom of the screen. When recording begins, the blue banner changes to say "Recording for [time remaining]". Confirm the time remaining starts at 10 seconds. When the recording finishes, the blue banner says, "Next recording is in [countdown]". Confirm the countdown begins at 20 seconds.

TestStep.Action: Allow the schedule to run out.
TestStep.Result: The recording happened exactly 3 times. When it finishes the top banner has the green play arrow on the left next to the timer counting up, starting at 00:01:25.

TestStep.Action: Click Stop. Create a new scheduled recording. Record every 30 seconds Record for 10 seconds Starting "At [2 min from now]" Execute "Once" Click Start Schedule. View M2 Pro screen.
TestStep.Result: The left corner of the grey banner displays the red clock and a countdown to when the recording *will end*. Countdown begins at ~00:02:00. 15 seconds before recording, offset correction begins. M2 screen does not show offset correction. When recording begins, the blue banner changes to say "Recording for [time remaining]". Confirm the time remaining starts at 10 seconds. When the recording finishes, the blue banner disappears and the timer on the top left is incrementing up starting at 00:02:00.

Test.JiraSummary: Gas text doesn't get cut off above 10%.

TestStep.Action: Connect M2 to AxIS Navigator.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Play navigator and change to Environmental Control panel.
TestStep.Result: Switched.

TestStep.Action: If not connected to gas, skip. Regulate gas and set it to 11%.
TestStep.Result: If connected to gas: Gas ramps up to 11%. Text is not cut off on M2 LCD screen.

TestStep.Action: If connected to gas, skip. Take note of the current gas measurement. Enter 'cmdspock gassensorcalibrate 11' into the debug console.
TestStep.Result: M2 screen ramps up to 11% and is not cut off.

TestStep.Action: If connected to gas enter the original gas measurement in the Concentration settings. If not connected to gas enter 'cmdspock gassensorcalibrate x' in the debug console where x is the original gas measurement.
TestStep.Result: Gas measurement returns to original value in M2 screen and AxIS thumbnail.

TestStep.Result: The text turns orange and clicking OK doesn't close the settings pop-up.

TestStep.Action: Click Apply and Play.
TestStep.Result: The file plays without change from 10 to 40 seconds. The Segment Type controls get locked out while the file is playing.

TestStep.Action: Set the Duration to 0.5 Minutes and the Offset to 10 seconds. Apply and Play.
TestStep.Result: File plays from the 10 to 40 second mark. The Segment Type controls get locked out while the file is playing.

TestStep.Action: Set the Offset to -5 Seconds and click OK
TestStep.Result: The text turns orange and clicking OK doesn't close the settings pop-up.

TestStep.Action: Set the Duration to 30 Seconds and the Offset to 0.3 minutes. Apply and Play.
TestStep.Result: File plays from the 18 to 48 second mark. (It rounds down to the whole second.) The Segment Type controls get locked out while the file is playing.

TestStep.Action: Set the Duration to 0.5 minutes and the Offset to 0.3 minutes. Apply and Play.
TestStep.Result: File plays from the 18 to 48 second mark. (It rounds down to the whole second.) The Segment Type controls get locked out while the file is playing.

TestStep.Action: Change the Segment Type from Start of File ti End Of File.
TestStep.Result: Only the Duration option is left.

TestStep.Action: Set the Duration to 20 seconds
TestStep.Result: File plays form 42.250 to 1:02.250. The Segment Type controls get locked out while the file is playing.

TestStep.Action: Set the Duration to 1.2 Minutes and click Apply then Play
TestStep.Result: The text turns orange and no changes are made to file playback. The file plays form 42.25 to 1:02.250. The Segment Type controls get locked out while the file is playing.

TestStep.Result: The file is set to play End Of File for 20 seconds.

TestStep.Action: Change the Segment Type to Whole File and click Apply then Play.
TestStep.Result: The entire file plays for 1:02.250. The Segment Type controls get locked out while the file is playing.

Test.JiraSummary: Navigator Performance Comparison

TestStep.Action: Copy overwhelmingratbrains.raw and 5min_Cardiac(000).raw to your local file system.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Load overwhelmingratbrains in a batch process.
TestStep.Result: Loaded.

TestStep.Action: Re-record raw.
TestStep.Result: Write down the time it took to complete. Do this 2 more times, then average the 3 values.

TestStep.Action: Add spike & burst detectors.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Record spike, spike count, and spike list files.
TestStep.Result: Write down the time it took to complete. Do this 2 more times, then average the 3 values.

TestStep.Action: Deselect the above file types and record an electrode burst list only.
TestStep.Result: Write down the time it took to complete. Do this 2 more times, then average the 3 values.

TestStep.Action: Record a electrode burst AND a well burst.
TestStep.Result: Write down the time it took to complete. Do this 2 more times, then average the 3 values.

TestStep.Action: Deselect electrode burst and record a well burst list only.
TestStep.Result: Write down the time it took to complete. Do this 2 more times, then average the 3 values.

TestStep.Action: Deselect previous outputs, add a stats compiler to the burst detector, disable Network Bursts, and record a neural analysis file.
TestStep.Result: Write down the time it took to complete. Do this 2 more times, then average the 3 values.

TestStep.Action: Enable network bursts, and record another analysis file.
TestStep.Result: Write down the time it took to complete. Do this 2 more times, then average the 3 values.

TestStep.Action: Remove the batch process. Create a new one with 5min_Cardiac(000).raw
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Re-record raw.
TestStep.Result: Write down the time it took to complete. Do this 2 more times, then average the 3 values.

TestStep.Action: Add Cardiac Beat Detector, then record an electrode beat list.
TestStep.Result: Write down the time it took to complete. Do this 2 more times, then average the 3 values.

TestStep.Action: Deselect electrode beat, then record just a well beat list.
TestStep.Result: Write down the time it took to complete. Do this 2 more times, then average the 3 values.

TestStep.Action: Add a stats compiler to the CBD, then record a cardiac analysis.
TestStep.Result: Write down the time it took to complete. Do this 2 more times, then average the 3 values.

TestStep.Action: Remove the batch process, then create a new one with both files (overwhelmingratbrains & 5min_Cardiac(000)) into a batch process. Re-record raw.
TestStep.Result: Write down the time it took to complete. Do this 2 more times, then average the 3 values.

TestStep.Action: Compile the averaged results against the previous performance times.
TestStep.Result: It is the same or faster than the previous versions.

TestStep.Action: On a release version, run this test 3 times and add the median result to [https://axionbio.jira.com/wiki/spaces/MUSE/pages/78675973/Performance+Comparison+2.0+or+Better|https://axionbio.jira.com/wiki/spaces/MUSE/pages/78675973/Performance+Comparison+2.0+or+Better]
TestStep.Result: Same or better.

Test.JiraSummary: Activity Map Functionality

TestStep.Action: Add a Butterworth/Digital Filter to the live stream.
TestStep.Result: A butterworth filter is attached to the live stream.

TestStep.Action: Add a 4X Spike Detector directly to the Muse/Maestro.
TestStep.Result: A spike detector is attached to the live stream.

TestStep.Action: # Start streaming live data # View the Activity Map - Spike Rate for the Active Source.
TestStep.Result: The spike rate is demonstrated on a per-well basis.

TestStep.Action: Set the Fixed Maximum value to half of the data's average value.
TestStep.Result: The colorization of the activity map changes to show more electrodes on the higher end of the color scale.

TestStep.Action: Disable several electrodes in the Continuous waveform plots
TestStep.Result: The corresponding locations in the activity map are disabled. No colorization is seen for the disabled electrodes

TestStep.Action: Re-enable several electrodes.
TestStep.Result: The corresponding locations in the activity map begin displaying data again.

TestStep.Action: Add a 6X Spike Detector to the Butterworth Filter
TestStep.Result: A spike detector is added to the butterworth filter.

TestStep.Action: View the new statistics options available to the spike detector.
TestStep.Result: The new options on the activity map should reflect the additional spike detector attached to the digital filter.

TestStep.Action: Load and play a neural RAW file.
TestStep.Result: A RAW file is added to the stream tree.

TestStep.Action: Set the RAW file to Looped Playback.
TestStep.Result: A file replays after hitting the end of the recorded data.

TestStep.Action: Add a Butterworth/Digital Filter directly to the RAW stream.
TestStep.Result: A butterworth filter is attached to the RAW stream.

TestStep.Action: Add a 4X Spike Detector directly to the RAW file.
TestStep.Result: A spike detector is attached to the RAW stream.

TestStep.Action: View the Activity Map - Spike Rate for the Active Source.
TestStep.Result: The spike rate is demonstrated on a per-electrode basis.

TestStep.Action: Set the Activity Map back to Auto Scale.
TestStep.Result: The colorization of the activity map changes to show less electrodes on the higher end of the color scale.

TestStep.Action: Disable several electrodes.
TestStep.Result: The corresponding locations in the activity map are disabled.

TestStep.Action: Re-enable several electrodes.
TestStep.Result: The corresponding locations in the activity map begin displaying data again.

TestStep.Action: Add a 6X Spike Detector to the Filter Stream.
TestStep.Result: A spike detector is added to the butterworth filter.

TestStep.Action: View the new statistics options available to the spike detector.
TestStep.Result: The new options on the activity map reflect the spike detector attached to the butterworth filter.

TestStep.Action: View the difference in displayed spikes.
TestStep.Result: The Activity Map accurately displays the average spike rate over the given binning period.

TestStep.Action: Load and play a cardiac RAW file in loop playback.
TestStep.Result: A cardiac RAW file is added to the stream tree.

TestStep.Action: Add a Cardiac Beat Detector to the RAW stream.
TestStep.Result: A cardiac beat detector is added to the cardiac stream.

TestStep.Action: Set the activity map to Spike Amplitude. Observe the reaction of the activity map.
TestStep.Result: The Spike Amplitude values are represented on the Activity Map.

TestStep.Action: Set the Fixed Maximum value to half of the data's average value.
TestStep.Result: The colorization of the activity map changes to show more electrodes on the higher end of the color scale.

TestStep.Action: Disable several electrodes.
TestStep.Result: Electrodes can be deactivated and reactivated without incidences of "burn-in" on the Map.

TestStep.Action: Re-enable several electrodes.
TestStep.Result: Looped playback does not cause any Activity Map sources to become lost. (zeroes / undefined)

The Play Bar becomes dark green from left to right matching the passage of time in the file playback process. The Play Bar also has seven (7) tick marks where notes were previously added along with an Add Notes button to the right of the Play Bar. Play Bar contains [Filename] (Playing)

TestStep.Result: Play Bar opens up.

TestStep.Result: Play Bar closes back down.

TestStep.Result: The current location of file playback changes to where one clicked.

TestStep.Result: Play Bar opens. A pop-up shows up with the following: Note time, note description, date/time created, date/time modified, Edit button, X close icon, trash can icon.

TestStep.Result: Play Bar closes.

TestStep.Result: Play Bar and pop-up remain open.

TestStep.Action: Click the tick mark.
TestStep.Result: Tick turns yellow and AxIS scrubs to that point in the file.

TestStep.Action: Mouse over the first tick mark, click on it then move mouse away.
TestStep.Result: Play Bar and pop-up remain open.

TestStep.Result: The text reverts to its previous value. The pop-up remains open.

TestStep.Action: Click the X next to the Check mark.

TestStep.Result: The tick mark is deleted. The pop-up turns gray and a message confirming the deletion appears on the bottom of the edit box along with an Undo link.

TestStep.Result: The note turns white again and the tick mark reappears.

TestStep.Action: Click on the X on the top right of the note
TestStep.Result: Edit box closes.

TestStep.Result: Stimulation stops. Signals return to normal.

TestStep.Result: Numbers turn yellow and OK button is disabled.

TestStep.Result: Numbers turn yellow and OK button is disabled.

TestStep.Action: Set the Duration to 4E99999 us.
TestStep.Result: Numbers turn red and OK button is disabled.

TestStep.Result: Green Play Bar appears and it begins to turn gray as the DC Offset removal process takes place. The Play Bar has time elapsed but it does not open up. The Add Notes button is disabled.

TestStep.Action: Click on Play Bar.
TestStep.Result: Nothing changes.

TestStep.Action: Right-click on the Play Bar.
TestStep.Result: Pop-up appears with gray-ed out options to: Play Display Formatted Time (checked). View All Notes And enabled options to: Stop Pause Record Display Total Seconds

TestStep.Action: Right-click the Play Bar and select Record.
TestStep.Result: Recording begins. Add Notes button is enabled. Play Bar says Muse/Maestro (Recording)

TestStep.Action: Notice the current recording time on the right of the Play Bar. and click on Add Note. Enter a note.
TestStep.Result: Note editing box opens and a note can be typed in. The time stamp on the left shows the recording time when the Add Note button was clicked.

TestStep.Action: Click Enter.
TestStep.Result: Note is saved.

TestStep.Action: Immediate type after pressing Enter.
TestStep.Result: Nothing happens.

TestStep.Action: Notice the current recording time on the right of the Play Bar. and click on Add Note. Enter a note.
TestStep.Result: Note editing box opens and a note can be typed in. The time stamp on the left shows the recording time when the Add Note button was clicked.

TestStep.Action: Click on the check mark.
TestStep.Result: The note is saved.

TestStep.Action: Click on the X on the top right of Play Bar.
TestStep.Result: Edit box closes. Play bar says Muse/Maestro (Recording)

TestStep.Action: Right-click on the Play Bar and select Pause
TestStep.Result: Play Bar says Muse/Maestro (Paused And Recording). Recording time continues to increase.

TestStep.Action: Right-click on the Play Bar and select Play
TestStep.Result: Play Bar says Muse/Maestro (Recording)

TestStep.Action: Right-click on the Play Bar and select Display Total Seconds
TestStep.Result: Running time on left of Play Bar changes to show total seconds plus milliseconds.

TestStep.Action: Right-click on the Play Bar and select Display Formatted Time
TestStep.Result: Running time on left of Play Bar changes to show Hours:Minutes:Seconds.milliseconds.

TestStep.Action: Right-click on the Play Bar and select View All Notes
TestStep.Result: Notes edit box appears.

TestStep.Action: Right-click on the Play Bar and select Hide All Notes
TestStep.Result: Notes edit box disappears.

TestStep.Action: Right-click on the Play Bar and select View All Notes
TestStep.Result: Notes edit box appears.

TestStep.Action: Add 7 more notes.
TestStep.Result: Scroll bar appears. When notes don't fit in the box it automatically scrolls down each time Add Note is pressed.

TestStep.Action: Scroll up.
TestStep.Result: The first note can be seeing by scrolling up.

TestStep.Action: Click on the trash can icon next to the first note.
TestStep.Result: The first note is deleted. Message confirming the deletion appears on the bottom of the edit box along with an Undo link.

TestStep.Action: Click Undo.
TestStep.Result: The first note reappears.

TestStep.Action: Click on the trash can for the second note.
TestStep.Result: The note is deleted and a message confirming the deletion appears along with an Undo link.

TestStep.Action: Scroll down and click the trash can on the last note.
TestStep.Result: The last note is deleted. The scroll bar disappears.

TestStep.Action: Click the last note's timestamp field and reduce the time by 10 seconds. Click the Check mark to apply the changes.
TestStep.Result: Text changes. Modified time is updated. The note moves up in the list to the correct place in the order based on the time stamp

TestStep.Action: Change the last note's time again to an arbitrary number but this time hit the X to cancel the changes.
TestStep.Result: The changes are reverted. Edited time is unchanged.

TestStep.Action: Edit the note again and subtract 10 hours from the time.
TestStep.Result: The text turns red and the Check box persists.

TestStep.Action: Edit the note again and add 1 hour to the time.
TestStep.Result: The text turns red and the Check box persists .

TestStep.Action: Right-click on the Play Bar and select Stop.
TestStep.Result: Recording stops. Play Bar turns grey and says Muse/Maestro (Stopped)

TestStep.Action: Check Add Note tooltip when idle, playing and recording.
TestStep.Result: All good.

Test.JiraSummary: v2.0 AxIS does not freeze when stopping after the buffer fills

TestStep.Action: Play AxIS with a live source.
TestStep.Result: AxIS plays.

TestStep.Action: Add a Neural: Real-time Spontaneous configuration.
TestStep.Result: Configuration loads.

TestStep.Action: Open the debug console. (CTRL-ALT-D)
TestStep.Result: Debug console opens.

TestStep.Action: Stimulate live source to the point of filling the buffer.
TestStep.Result: AxIS becomes sluggish. If it's too sluggish for too long you'll see a TTL Panic message and AxIS will recover before the next step.

TestStep.Action: While buffer is full and AxIS is sluggish, press the 'Stop' button.
TestStep.Result: AxIS stops playing gracefully. It doesn't freeze.

TestStep.Action: Press the 'Play' button.
TestStep.Result: AxIS plays.
