Test.JiraSummary: Only one instance of AxIS Z can be opened at a time

TestStep.Action: Open AxIS Z.
TestStep.Result: AxIS Z opens.

TestStep.Action: Minimize AxIS Z.
TestStep.Result: AxIS Z is minimized.

TestStep.Action: Open AxIS Z by double-clicking the desktop icon.
TestStep.Result: The existing instance of opens up to its original size. No new instance of AxIS Z is created.

TestStep.Action: Open an explorer window in front of AxIS Z.
TestStep.Result: AxIS Z is moved to the backfground.

TestStep.Action: Open AxIS Z via the Start Menu.
TestStep.Result: The existing instance of AxIS Z moves to the foreground. No new instance of AxIS Z is created.

Test.JiraSummary: Only one AxIS Z instance across users

TestStep.Action: Connect a Maestro Z and log into your regular account.
TestStep.Result: User is logged in.

TestStep.Action: Load an Impedance plate and take a baseline to start an experiment.
TestStep.Result: Baseline is taken. Experiment is active.

TestStep.Action: Do not close AxIS Z and do not log off the computer. Click CTRL-Alt-Delete and select Switch User.
TestStep.Result: We’re taken to the windows login screen.

TestStep.Action: Log in as a different user (ttesterson) and launch AxIS Z.
TestStep.Result: "Another user is currently running an experiment. You cannot launch Axis Z." pop-up message appears. AxIS Z does not open.

TestStep.Action: Go back to the first user and Reset the plate. Do not close AxIS Z.
TestStep.Result: AxIS Z remains open. There are no active experiments.

TestStep.Action: Switch back to the second user an launch AxIS Z.
TestStep.Result: "Another user has Axis Z open. Would you like to kill their instance and proceed with your own?" Pop-up appears.

TestStep.Action: Select "No".
TestStep.Result: AxIS Z does not open.

TestStep.Action: Try to launch AxIS Z again.
TestStep.Result: "Another user has Axis Z open. Would you like to kill their instance and proceed with your own?" Pop-up appears.

TestStep.Action: Select "Yes".
TestStep.Result: AxIS Z opens.

TestStep.Action: Log out of the 2nd user and log back into the first.
TestStep.Result: AxIS Z is not open.

Test.JiraSummary: Verify GxP-enabled UI elements
Verify Device Audit Trail Generation

TestStep.Action: Connect aMaestro Z to PC an open AxIS Z.
TestStep.Result: Experiment is loaded.

TestStep.Action: Tools → Export Device Audit Trail…
TestStep.Result: Dialog pre-populates he file name as {{year-month-date_MaestroAudit.zip}}.

TestStep.Action: Save the audit trail and open the zip file.
TestStep.Result: Zip file contains: # \[Content_Types].xml # year-month-date_MaestroAudit.pdf # Axion.cer # Manifest.xml # User.cer

TestStep.Action: Open {{year-month-date_MaestroAudit.pdf}} Verify Device Audit trail headers (page 1): # Tittle = Device Audit Trail # Exported by <Domain\Name of user who generated it> # Exported on <Date and time of the export> e.g Exported on Monday, August 31, 2020 at 8:50 AM # Note stating that all dates are stated in the local time of the PC that generated it: ## All dates and times are expressed in the local timezone of the computer generating this report. For this report the timezone is <Eastern Daylight Time> which currently has an offset from GMT of <-4> hours. # Serial Number of device # Firmware Version of device
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Verify subsequent page(s) titled "Changes to the Device State" containing: # Dates in "g" format which localizes to `m/d/yyyy h:mm AM/PM` in the U.S. # System starts, labeled "Maestro booted" including the firmware number. # Changes to firmware version. # Results of Check Impedance tests. ("M/N passed" where M is the number of good wells and N is the total number of wells.)
TestStep.Result: Done.

Test.JiraSummary: Verify Experiment Audit Trail Generation for Existing / Imported Experiment

TestStep.Action: Copy locally and load {{\trunk\SoftwareTesting\AxIS Z\384 GxP Test Experiment.imx}} into AxIS Z.
TestStep.Result: Experiment is loaded.

TestStep.Action: Select File → Export Experiment Audit Trail.
TestStep.Result: Dialog pre-populates the file name as {{year-month-date_AxisZAudit_Barcode.zip}}.

TestStep.Action: Save the audit trail and open the zip file.
TestStep.Result: Zip file contains: # \[Content_Types].xml # year-month-date_AxisZAudit_Barcode.pdf # Axion.cer # Manifest.xml # User.cer

TestStep.Action: Open {{year-month-date_AxisZAudit_Barcode.pdf}} and verify Experiment Audit trail headers as follows: # Title = Experiment Audit Trail # Exported by <Domain Name of user who generated it> # Exported on <Date and time of the export> e.g Exported on Monday, August 31, 2020 at 8:50 AM # Note stating that all dates are stated in the local time of the PC that generated it: ## All dates and times are expressed in the local timezone of the computer generating this report. For this report the timezone is <Eastern Daylight Time> which currently has an offset from GMT of <-4> hours. # Information from the experiment setup module, this includes ## Name ## Barcode ## Owner ## Investigator ## Description ## Start Time ## Last Sample Time of the experiment ## "Experiment Privacy" = Shared/Private ## "Experiment Status" = Offline/Online ## Version of AxIS Z that produced the report
TestStep.Result: Everything matches.

TestStep.Action: Verify there is a separate page(s) titled "Plate Map Changes" containing: # Time of the change on the left column with dates in "g" format which localizes to `m/d/yyyy h:mm AM/PM` in the U.S. # <User> - <text the user entered in the plate map> in the right column.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Verify there is a separate page(s) titled "System Notes & Events" containing: # Time of the event on the left column with dates in "g" format which localizes to `m/d/yyyy h:mm AM/PM` in the U.S. # Right column with notes that come from the device including serial number. E.g. "(70:50): Maestro: 11-00.03.00004 - Plate Docked". The events tracked are: ## Plate Docked or Ejected ## Door Opened of Closed # Separate page(s) titled "Notes" containing: ## Time of the note on the left column with dates in "g" format which localizes to `m/d/yyyy h:mm AM/PM` in the U.S. ## Right column with the user note as it appears at the time of export with the experiment offset preceding it. E.g. "(78:59): User Note -Added Vibranium to well A1"
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Verify there is a separate page(s) titled "Note Changes" containing: # Time of the change to the note on the left column with dates in "g" format which localizes to `m/d/yyyy h:mm AM/PM` in the U.S. # Right column with Note creation/deletion/edits along with the user that did it. ## E.g. "Note time edited by AXIONBIO\cramos - "8/31/2020 3:52:51 PM -04:00" to "8/31/2020 2:41:00 PM -04:00" for note: "test user note""

Verify there is a separate page(s) titled "Miscellaneous Changes" containing: # Time of the change on the left column with dates in "g" format which localizes to `m/d/yyyy h:mm AM/PM` in the U.S. # Right column with changes to the experiment module and alarms. to be Part 11 compliant it should include old and new values. E.g. "Experiment Name was modified from 'Old Name' to 'New Name'". The specific fields to track are: ## Experiment Name ## Investigator ## Description ## Experiment Start ## Temperature alarm settings ## Gas alarm settings
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Verify there is a separate page(s) titled "Appendix: Plate Map History" containing: # A list of Plate Map Revisions with date and time and the same of the user who modified it. # The first entry has a note "Initial Plate Map". # Each entry has a table with columns for Treatment, Control and Wells.
TestStep.Result: Done.

Test.JiraSummary: GxP Plate Map initial state verification
GxP Plate Map Locked and Unlocked verification

TestStep.Action: Open AxIS Z and connect a Maestro Z with a GxP license.
TestStep.Result: Done

TestStep.Action: Dock or fake an impedance plate. Reset the plate if it has an active experiment.
TestStep.Result: {{Measure Baseline}} button is present in the Experiment Setup module.

TestStep.Action: Click on the Plate Map Setup module.
TestStep.Result: Plate map is unlocked.

TestStep.Action: Make changes to the Plate Map and click on the lock icon.
TestStep.Result: Plate Map cannot be locked before an experiment has been started (Baseline is taken).

TestStep.Action: Close and reopen AxIS Z.
TestStep.Result: The active experiment returns but all changes to the Plate Map are gone.

TestStep.Action: Load {{Example Immuno-oncology}} template and type {{Template Loaded}} into the {{Description of Changes}} text box.
TestStep.Result: Template loads without errors. Text is added.

TestStep.Action: Go to the Experiment Setup module and click on {{Measure Baseline}}.
TestStep.Result: Baseline begins (and later completes). Analysis module appears. Plate is locked.

TestStep.Action: Close and reopen AxIS Z.
TestStep.Result: The active experiment returns. Changes to the Plate Map are still there because Baseline was already taken.

TestStep.Action: Export Experiment Audit Trail.
TestStep.Result: * The {{Plate Map Changes}} section has a single entry. * It has the date/time and says {{<user> - Initial Plate Map}} instead of {{Template Loaded}}. * Text entered into {{Description of changes}} was not saved because the Plate Map was not locked manually.

TestStep.Action: Click on {{Well Groups}}.
TestStep.Result: Everything is disabled except for {{Export Plate Map...}}.

TestStep.Action: * Hover mouse pointer over lock.
TestStep.Result: {{Unlock to make changes}} tool tip is shown.

TestStep.Action: Hover mouse pointer over well groups, ON/OFF button and Clear button.
TestStep.Result: They all pop up a tool tip saying: {{This functionality is disabled when the plate map is locked}}.

TestStep.Action: Click on wells and then on the ON button.
TestStep.Result: Wells cannot be turned off.

TestStep.Action: Click on the lock and hover the mouse pointer over it.
TestStep.Result: {{Lock to apply changes}} tool tip is shown.

TestStep.Action: Try to change to the Experiment Setup or the Analysis module.
TestStep.Result: Can’t change modules while Plate Map is unlocked.

TestStep.Action: Click on well A1 then on the {{Clear}} button.
TestStep.Result: Well assignment/color is cleared.

TestStep.Action: Hover the mouse pointer over the trash can icon.
TestStep.Result: {{Revert changes}} tool tip pops up.

TestStep.Action: Click on the trash can icon.
TestStep.Result: Well A1 goes back to being assigned. Plate Map is locked again.

TestStep.Action: Unlock the plate, click on well A1 and then on the {{ON}} button.
TestStep.Result: Well A1 is turned off. {{On}} button becomes {{OFF}} button.

TestStep.Action: Click on the lock button.
TestStep.Result: Plate Map does not lock.

TestStep.Action: Hover mouse pointer over lock.
TestStep.Result: {{Enter a change Description to allow committing changes}} tool tip pops up.

TestStep.Action: Type {{Turned off A1}} into the {{Description of changes}} text bock and click on the lock.
TestStep.Result: The Plate Map locks.

TestStep.Action: Export Experiment Audit Trail. Save it with a new name or overwrite the existing one.
TestStep.Result: * The {{Plate Map Changes}} section has a second entry. * It has the date/time and says {{<user> - Turned off A1}}.

TestStep.Action: Close and reopen AxIS Z.
TestStep.Result: The active experiment returns with a the template loaded and well A1 turned off.

Test.JiraSummary: LIMS Export Live File Header Verification

TestStep.Action: Load an impedance plate (or fake one) into a Maestro Z and connect to PC. Start AxIS Z.
TestStep.Result: Maestro Z connects and plate is detected.

TestStep.Action: Take a baseline and start an experiment.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Copy locally the reference files from {{\trunk\SoftwareTesting\JIRA Supplemental Files\NAV-6164}}
TestStep.Result: Files copied. 1.zip, 2.zip, 3.zip, and 4.zip

TestStep.Action: Change the settings as stated below then click File → Export Experiment to LIMS… Cytolysis, Full Lysis, Dispaly interval = 5 min
TestStep.Result: Zip file created.

TestStep.Action: Open the zip file and compare ONLY THE HEADERS as stated below to the ones inside of 1.zip. The headers to verify for each file are: * *ExperimentMetadata.csv*: User ID | PC Name | Domain, Name | App Name, Version | Time Of Export | Bar Code | Investigator, Description | Start Time | Last Sample Time | Analysis Type | Impedance Type | Frequency (Hz) | Media Correction | Time Reference Type | Time Reference Value (Hours) | Vehicle Correction | Display Interval (Minutes) | No Treatment Control \[for Cytolysis] | Full Lysis Control \[for Cytolysis] | Endpoint | Endpoint Cursor (Hours) \[for At Cursor] | Endpoint Start Cursor (Hours) \[for Minimum/Maximum/Kill Time 50] | Endpoint End Cursor (Hours) \[for Minimum/Maximum/Kill Time 50] * *PlateMap.csv*: Well | Well Status | Well Color | Group | Control Type | Treatment * *WellEndPoints.csv*: Well | Group | Treatment | Value * *TreatmentEndPoints.csv*: Group | Treatment | Mean | Standard Deviation | Standard Error * *WellTimeSeries.csv*: Time (Hours) | A1 | A2 | A3 | ... \[for however many wells] * *TreatmentTimeSeries.csv*: Time (Hours) | X - Mean | X - Standard Deviation | X - Standard Error | Y - Mean | Y - Standard Deviation | Z - Standard Error | ... \[where X, Y, and "…" = every minor group]
TestStep.Result: The headers match.

TestStep.Action: Change the settings as stated below then click File → Export Experiment to LIMS… Barrier Index, Time Reference = Normalization
TestStep.Result: Zip file created.

Test.JiraSummary: Plate Map with 192 groups loads in fewer than 4 seconds, heatmap shows even columns, and adds a scroll bar to the legend

TestStep.Action: * Fake Scan or load/select a 384-well impedance experiment. * If fakescannig, also baseline the experiment.
TestStep.Result: 384-well experiment is loaded.

TestStep.Action: Click on the Plate Map module.
TestStep.Result: 384 well plate is correctly shown.

TestStep.Action: Copy locally and load 384-wells-192-groups-02-wpg.implate plate map from trunk\SoftwareTesting\AxIS Z\Platemaps-384-wells.
TestStep.Result: Plate map is imported with 192 groups from 001 to 192.

TestStep.Action: Shutdown and restart AxIS Z.
TestStep.Result: AxIS Z is shut down and restarts in the Experiment Setup module.

TestStep.Action: Make sure the previous experiment is selected and switch to the Plate Map module.
TestStep.Result: AxIS Z switches to the Plate Map module and all the wells are populated in fewer than 4 seconds. The UI does not lock up for seconds.

TestStep.Action: Switch to the Analysis module.
TestStep.Result: There is a scroll bar in the legend.

TestStep.Action: Hover the mouse pointer over the legend and scroll up and down with your mouse scroll wheel.
TestStep.Result: You can see the entire list of well groups, 001 to 192.

TestStep.Action: View/change to the Impedance Map and verify that the heatmap row labels are clearly legible and only the even columns are labeled.
TestStep.Result: Done.

Test.JiraSummary: Button to duplicate major group is removed if the group is "dirty" / edited
Changing active experiment changes the heatmap

TestStep.Action: Copy locally and import {{384 plate.imx}} and {{A549 Scratch Assay.imx}} from trunk\SoftwareTesting\AxIS Z into AxIS Z.
TestStep.Result: Experiments are loaded. They appear on the left side bar.

TestStep.Action: Select the {{384 Calu3 and A549 Volumes}} experiment and click on the Analysis module.
TestStep.Result: The heatmap shows a 384-well plate with 16 rows and 24 columns.

TestStep.Action: Select the {{A549 Scratch Assay}} experiment.
TestStep.Result: The heatmap shows a 96-well plate with 8 rows and 12 columns.

TestStep.Action: Select the {{384 Calu3 and A549 Volumes}} experiment again.
TestStep.Result: The heatmap shows a 384-well plate with 16 rows and 24 columns.

TestStep.Action: Select the {{A549 Scratch Assay}} experiment again.
TestStep.Result: The heatmap shows a 96-well plate with 8 rows and 12 columns.

Test.JiraSummary: Version Number in Title Bar
Raw files can be opened via command line
Plate Map Editor State Awareness

TestStep.Action: Start AxIS and open the Plate Map Editor (PME).
TestStep.Result: PME Opens.

TestStep.Action: Save the full electrode layout as all-electrodes-enabled.platemap.
TestStep.Result: all-electrodes-enabled.platemap is saved.

TestStep.Action: Deactivate several electrodes. (Double click)
TestStep.Result: Electrodes are deactivated.

TestStep.Action: Save the electrode layout as Step3-some-disabled-electrodes.platemap
TestStep.Result: Layout Step3-some-disabled-electrodes.platemap saved.

TestStep.Action: Turn off all the wells.
TestStep.Result: All wells are off.

TestStep.Action: Load Step3-some-disabled-electrodes.platemap electrode layout.
TestStep.Result: Step3-some-disabled-electrodes.platemap loads correctly. Some electrodes disabled.

TestStep.Action: Record a RAW file with this electrode layout.
TestStep.Result: The file is recorded properly.

TestStep.Action: Load and play the RAW file.
TestStep.Result: The Continuous Waveform Plot doesn't have any signals for the disabled electrodes.

TestStep.Action: Open the PME.
TestStep.Result: The PME reflects the same disabled electrodes as Step3-some-disabled-electrodes.platemap.

TestStep.Action: Load Step3-some-disabled-electrodes.platemap.
TestStep.Result: No changes are seen.

TestStep.Action: Disable all the electrodes.
TestStep.Result: All the electrodes disable properly.

TestStep.Action: Load all-electrodes-enabled.platemap.
TestStep.Result: Only the electrodes that were enabled in the recorded file are re-enabled.

TestStep.Action: Play AxIS. Disable top two rows of wells in a CytoView MEA 12 plate. Add a Spike Detector.Switch plate type to CytoView MEA 48 plate.
TestStep.Result: It shouldn't crash. Repeat several times.

TestStep.Action: Repeat above with a Cardiac Beat Detector.
TestStep.Result: No crash.

TestStep.Action: Switch wells continuously by using keyboard arrows
TestStep.Result: AxIS doesn't crash.

TestStep.Action: In Cardiac: Standard/Pacing/Broadband, disable most electrodes. Stop playback if it's already playing. Switch plate type. Click Play.
TestStep.Result: No crash.

Test.JiraSummary: Grey out Configuration submenu while recording
Cardiac Stats Compiler view fitted to window
Electrodes for artichoke view stimulation numbered from 0-63
Contractility carrier signal elimination verification

TestStep.Action: Connect to a Maestro and reset AxIS Navigator.
TestStep.Result: AxIS resets and opens. M2 connects.

TestStep.Action: Double-click the Maestro and set the analog mode to Contractility. Click OK.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Ject M2 with no plate and Click Play. Select the Continuous plot.
TestStep.Result: AxIS starts streaming. Amplitude zoom controls show percentage instead of voltage.

TestStep.Action: Go to the debug console and type "ForceVoltagePlotting true" <ENTER>
TestStep.Result: Continuous plot shows voltage mode instead of percentage for amplitude zoom levels.

TestStep.Action: Set zoom levels to 5 mV/Div and 1 ms/Div. Review signal.
TestStep.Result: No carrier signal seen: * No ~3 kHz sine wave. * No RMS over 1500uV. More like < 50 uV. * Signal looks almost flat.

Test.JiraSummary: Contractility is disabled for Classic, BioCircuit and OptiClear plates

TestStep.Action: Connect a Maestro _Pro_ and reset AxIS.
TestStep.Result: AxIS resets. M2 connects.

TestStep.Action: Click on View -> Show All Plate Types.
TestStep.Result: Option is checked.

TestStep.Action: Dock an empty M2 and set analog mode to Cardiac: Contractility.
TestStep.Result: Done. Active Plate is Smart Plate. Play button is enabled.

TestStep.Action: Select Classic MEA 48 as the Active Plate.
TestStep.Result: Play button is disabled.

TestStep.Action: Select Classic MEA 48 AccuSpot as the Active Plate.
TestStep.Result: Play button is still disabled.

TestStep.Action: Select Classic MEA 48 E-Stim+ as the Active Plate.
TestStep.Result: Play button is still disabled.

TestStep.Action: Select Classic MEA 96 as the Active Plate.
TestStep.Result: Play button is still disabled.

TestStep.Action: Select BioCircuit 24 as the Active Plate.
TestStep.Result: Play button is still disabled.

TestStep.Action: Select BioCircuit 48 as the Active Plate.
TestStep.Result: Play button is still disabled.

TestStep.Action: Select BioCircuit 96 as the Active Plate.
TestStep.Result: Play button is still disabled.

TestStep.Action: Select OptiClear 24 by going to the debug console and typing "cmdspock spoofbarcode 1512345678" <ENTER>
TestStep.Result: Play button is still disabled.

TestStep.Action: Select OptiClear 48 by going to the debug console and typing "cmdspock spoofbarcode 0712345678" <ENTER>
TestStep.Result: Play button is still disabled.

TestStep.Action: Select OptiClear 96 by going to the debug console and typing "cmdspock spoofbarcode 1612345678" <ENTER>
TestStep.Result: Play button is still disabled.

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS. Change analog mode to Neural: Spikes.
TestStep.Result: AxIS resets. M2 connects.

TestStep.Action: Click on View -> Show All Plate Types.
TestStep.Result: Option is checked.

TestStep.Action: Select BioCircuit MEA 48 as the Active Plate.
TestStep.Result: Play button is enabled.

TestStep.Action: Set analog mode to Cardiac: Contractility.
TestStep.Result: Play button is now disabled.

TestStep.Action: Change the analog mode to Neural: Spikes.
TestStep.Result: Play button is once again enabled.

TestStep.Action: Set AxIS to record a raw file and start recording.
TestStep.Result: Recording starts.

TestStep.Action: Try to add a configuration.
TestStep.Result: Can't. Disabled.

TestStep.Action: Stop recording but continue to play. (Press Record Button again).
TestStep.Result: AxIS continues to play.

TestStep.Action: Add a Cardiac Real-Time -> Contractility configuration.
TestStep.Result: CBD added. Analog mode is set to Contractility. AxIS continues to stream.

TestStep.Action: Stop playback.
TestStep.Result: Play button is now disabled.

TestStep.Action: Select BioCircuit MEA 24 as the Active Plate.
TestStep.Result: Play button is still disabled.

TestStep.Action: Change the analog mode to Field Potentials.
TestStep.Result: Play button is once again enabled.

TestStep.Action: Start playing and add a Cardiac Real-Time -> Contractility Paced configuration.
TestStep.Result: CBD added and Artifact Eliminator. Analog mode is set to Contractility. AxIS continues to stream.

TestStep.Action: Stop playback.
TestStep.Result: Play button is now disabled.

TestStep.Result: Play button is once again enabled.

TestStep.Action: Stop playback.
TestStep.Result: Play button is now disabled.

TestStep.Action: Select Classic MEA 48 E-Stim+ as the Active Plate.
TestStep.Result: Play button is still disabled.

TestStep.Action: Change the analog mode to Cardiac: Broadband.
TestStep.Result: Play button is once again enabled.

TestStep.Action: Start playing and add a Cardiac Real-Time -> Contractility configuration.
TestStep.Result: CBD added. Analog mode is set to Contractility. AxIS continues to stream.

TestStep.Action: Stop playback.
TestStep.Result: Play button is now disabled.

TestStep.Action: Select Classic MEA 96 as the Active Plate.
TestStep.Result: Play button is still disabled.

TestStep.Action: Change the analog mode to Cardiac: LEAP.
TestStep.Result: Play button is once again enabled.

TestStep.Action: Start playing and add a Cardiac Real-Time -> Contractility Paced configuration.
TestStep.Result: CBD added and Artifact Eliminator. Analog mode is set to Contractility. AxIS continues to stream.

TestStep.Action: Stop playback.
TestStep.Result: Play button is now disabled.

AxIS Z checks for old databases and moves them on startup

TestStep.Action: Unplug any Maestro from the PC.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Backup {{Impedance Data}} folder from {{C:\ProgramData\Axion Biosystems\AxIS Z}}.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Move half the impedance folders to {{%USERPROFILE%\AppData\Roaming\Axion BioSystems\AxIS Z\Imdb}} (e.g. {{C:\Users\cramos\AppData\Roaming\Axion BioSystems\AxIS Z\Imdb}}) Delete the rest except for one.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Close both impedance folders. Open AxIS Z. Open {{C:\ProgramData\Axion Biosystems\AxIS Z\Impedance Data}}.
TestStep.Result: The same impedance folder remains. No impedance folders are copied into the Program Data location because there is already something there.

TestStep.Action: Close AxIS Z. Delete the remaining impedance folder from the Program Data location and close the folder.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Open AxIS Z. Open {{C:\ProgramData\Axion Biosystems\AxIS Z\Impedance Data}} and {{%USERPROFILE%\AppData\Roaming\Axion BioSystems\AxIS Z\Imdb}}.
TestStep.Result: The impedance folders have been copied and both locations contain the same data.

TestStep.Action: If the test failed. Restore the backed up {{Impedance Data}} folder to {{C:\ProgramData\Axion Biosystems}}.
TestStep.Result: Done.

LIMS Export File Content Verification - Automated
User isn't allowed to baseline an experiment if the plate is already in use

TestStep.Action: Connect a Maestro Z and log into your regular account.
TestStep.Result: User is logged in.

TestStep.Action: Load / fakenextscan an Impedance plate and take a baseline to start an experiment.
TestStep.Result: Baseline is taken. Experiment is active. Measure Baseline button is gone.

TestStep.Action: Eject the plate and dock / fakenextscan a second plate.
TestStep.Result: Measure Baseline button is visible in the Experiment Setup module.

TestStep.Action: Dock / fakenextscan the first plate.
TestStep.Result: Measure Baseline button is not visible in the Experiment Setup module.

TestStep.Action: Eject the plate and close AxIS Z.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Click CTRL-Alt-Delete and select Switch User.
TestStep.Result: We’re taken to the windows login screen.

TestStep.Action: Log in as a different user (ttesterson2) and launch AxIS Z.
TestStep.Result: AxIS Z opens.

TestStep.Action: Dock / fakenextscan the first plate again.
TestStep.Result: Measure Baseline button is not visible in the Experiment Setup module.

TestStep.Action: Eject the plate and dock / fakenextscan the second plate.
TestStep.Result: Measure Baseline button is visible in the Experiment Setup module.

TestStep.Action: Eject the second plate and dock / fakenextscan the first plate.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Reset the plate and delete the experiment.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Finally, log out of the 2nd user and optionally log back into the first.
TestStep.Result: Done.

Test.JiraSummary: Test Doesn't load others' private experiments

TestStep.Action: Connect a Maestro Z and log into your regular account or another that is a GxP administrator.
TestStep.Result: User is logged in.

TestStep.Action: Load or fakenextscan an Impedance plate.
TestStep.Result: Done. "Shared Experiment" is set to "ON" by default.

TestStep.Action: Hover mouse over lock.
TestStep.Result: Tooltip says "Unlock to edit a Shared Experiment".

TestStep.Action: Hover mouse over "shared Experiment".
TestStep.Result: Tooltip says "Shared experiments are visible to all AxIS Z users on this PC".

TestStep.Action: Unlock and set the experiment to private and take a baseline to start an experiment.
TestStep.Result: Baseline is taken. Experiment is active.

TestStep.Action: Hover mouse over lock.
TestStep.Result: Tooltip says "Unlock to edit Experiment Start".

TestStep.Action: Hover mouse over "shared Experiment".
TestStep.Result: Tooltip says "Experiment privacy cannot be changed after experiment begins".

TestStep.Action: Click on the lock to unlock the experiment settings.
TestStep.Result: "Shared Experiment" option is not editable.

TestStep.Action: Reset and eject the plate.
TestStep.Result: The experiment moves from Active to Offline.

TestStep.Action: Close AxIS Z and log in as a different, non-administrative user (ttesterson2) and launch AxIS Z.
TestStep.Result: AxIS Z opens. The previously created experiment is not listed under Offline Experiments.

TestStep.Action: Load or fakenextscan an Impedance plate.
TestStep.Result: Done. "Shared Experiment" is set to "ON" by default.

TestStep.Action: Set the experiment to private and take a baseline to start an experiment.
TestStep.Result: Baseline is taken. Experiment is active.

TestStep.Action: Click on the lock to unlock the experiment settings.
TestStep.Result: "Shared Experiment" option is not editable.

TestStep.Action: Reset and eject the plate.
TestStep.Result: The experiment moves from Active to Offline.

TestStep.Action: Close AxIS Z and log out of the non-admin user.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Log in as the first admin user and open AxIS Z.
TestStep.Result: The first experiment is visible. The second experiment, created by the on-admin user, is also visible under Offline Experiments.

Test.JiraSummary: Test that imdb files are password protected

TestStep.Action: Go to {{C:\ProgramData\Axion BioSystems\AxIS Z\Impedance Data}} and open on of the barcode folders.
TestStep.Result: Impedance database file is present in format \[number].imdb.

TestStep.Action: Open the imdb file with LiteDB Explorer.
TestStep.Result: A password prompt appears.

TestStep.Action: Enter {{St1m.ly}} into the password field.
TestStep.Result: imdb file opens.

TestStep.Action: Close LiteDB Explorer.
TestStep.Result: Done.

Test.JiraSummary: Verify GxP Experiment Settings

TestStep.Action: Log in to PC with a GxP admin account (ttesterson).
TestStep.Result: GxP admin user is logged in.

TestStep.Action: Connect a Maestro Z and open AxIS Z.
TestStep.Result: AxIS Z opens and Maestro Z is detected.

TestStep.Action: Open Tools → GxP Experiment Settings… and verify that # "Experiment Privacy" is set to "Allow Shared and Private". # "Temperature & Gas" is set to "Anyone Can Control".
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Load / fakenextscan an Impedance plate.
TestStep.Result: "Shared Experiment" is "ON" Lock is closed Shared experiment can be toggled off after the lock is opened.

TestStep.Action: Click on the cog to open the Device settings. Try to toggle and change the gas and temperature set points.
TestStep.Result: Gas and temperature set points can be changed.

TestStep.Action: Eject the plate.
TestStep.Result: Plate is ejected.

TestStep.Action: Open Tools → GxP Experiment Settings… and change: # "Experiment Privacy" to "Allow Private Only". # "Temperature & Gas" to "Only Administrators Can Control".
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Load / fakenextscan an Impedance plate.
TestStep.Result: "Shared Experiment" is "OFF". lock is closed Shared experiment cannot be changed after the lock is opened

TestStep.Action: Click on the cog to open the Device settings. Try to toggle and change the gas and temperature set points.
TestStep.Result: Gas and temperature set points can be still be changed.

TestStep.Action: Eject the plate and close AxIS Z.
TestStep.Result: Plate is ejected.

TestStep.Action: Click CTRL-Alt-Delete and select Switch User.
TestStep.Result: We’re taken to the windows login screen.

TestStep.Action: Log in as a different, non GxP-admin user (ttesterson2) and launch AxIS Z.
TestStep.Result: AxIS Z opens.

TestStep.Action: Dock / fakenextscan an Impedance plate.
TestStep.Result: "Shared Experiment" is "OFF". and cannot be changed.

TestStep.Action: Click on the cog to open the Device settings. Try to toggle and change the gas and temperature set points.
TestStep.Result: Gas and temperature set points cannot be changed.

TestStep.Action: Open Tools → GxP Experiment Settings… and try to change the settings.
TestStep.Result: The settings are locked out. Message next to clock says "Must be an AxIS Z Administrator to Unlock."

TestStep.Action: Log out of the non-admin user and log back into the admin user. Launch AxIS Z.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Open Tools → GxP Experiment Settings… and set the values back to default. # "Experiment Privacy" is set to "Allow Shared and Private". # "Temperature & Gas" is set to "Anyone Can Control".
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Log out of the admin user and log back into the non-admin user. Launch AxIS Z.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Load / fakenextscan an Impedance plate.
TestStep.Result: "Shared Experiment" is "ON" and can be toggled.

TestStep.Action: Click on the cog to open the Device settings. Try to toggle and change the gas and temperature set points.
TestStep.Result: Gas and temperature set points can be changed.

TestStep.Action: Finally, log out of the 2nd user and optionally log back into the first.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Open AxIS Z and import A549 Scratch Assay.imx and verify it has barcode 76-4701.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Verify that a new folder named 1800764701 is created inside the Imdb folder.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Load Example Immuno-Oncology template.
TestStep.Result: Plate map template is loaded.

TestStep.Action: * Export the experiment and import it. * Select the exported experiment.
TestStep.Result: * The barcode didn’t change in the Experiment Setup pane. (Specifically, it’s still 76-4701 and not any variation of 18-7777-7780.) * Verify a folder named 1877777780 is not created inside the Imdb folder.

TestStep.Action: Import plate map from BasicExperiment.imx.
TestStep.Result: * Plate map is imported. * Barcode doesn’t change.

TestStep.Action: * Export the experiment and load it back up. * Select the imported experiment.
TestStep.Result: * Verify the barcode didn’t change in the Experiment Setup pane. (Specifically, it’s still 76-4701 and not any variation of 18-7777-7780.) * Verify a folder named 1877777780 is not created inside the Imdb folder.

TestStep.Action: Import the plate map from Basic25.implate.
TestStep.Result: * Plate map is imported. * Barcode doesn’t change.

TestStep.Action: * Export the experiment and load it back up. * Select the imported experiment.
TestStep.Result: * verify the barcode didn’t change in the Experiment Setup pane. (Specifically, it’s still 76-4701 and not any variation of 18-7777-7780.) * Verify a folder named 1877777780 is not created inside the Imdb folder.

TestStep.Action: * Delete all the test experiments. * Delete folder named 1800764701 from inside the Imdb folder.

Test.JiraSummary: Multiple Raw files can be simultaneously loaded in AxIS

TestStep.Action: Place 3 raw files locally. Verify that the raw file icons are the same as the Navigator desktop/taskbar icon.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS Navigator and close it.
TestStep.Result: AxIS Navigator is closed.

TestStep.Action: Double-click on the first raw file.
TestStep.Result: AxIS Navigator opens and the raw file is added to the stream tree.

TestStep.Action: Close Navigator and double-click on the first raw file again.
TestStep.Result: AxIS Navigator opens. The raw file is still in the stream tree, alone.

TestStep.Action: Select the other two raw files and click "ENTER".
TestStep.Result: The two files are added to the stream tree and one is selected.

TestStep.Action: Remove the two files and play the first one in a loop.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Select the two files and click "ENTER".
TestStep.Result: The two files are added. The first file stays selected and streaming.

TestStep.Action: Remove the last two files.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Double-click on one of the two files.
TestStep.Result: The file is added. The first file stays selected and streaming.

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS Navigator and close it.
TestStep.Result: AxIS Navigator is closed.

TestStep.Action: Select all 3 raw files and click "ENTER".
TestStep.Result: Navigator opens. The three files are added to the stream tree and one is selected.

TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Result: No message appears stating 96 wells with NaN errors appear.

Test.JiraSummary: Multi-Maestro Connect-Disconnect Test for AxIS Z

TestStep.Action: * *Use one Maestro Z and one Maestro Pro with Impedance license.* * No plates loaded on either one.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Start AxIS Z with nothing connected.
TestStep.Result: * The Maestro icon in the sidebar is disabled. * Name box is hidden. * The title says "No Maestro Connected". * Maestro settings pop-up can’t be opened.

TestStep.Action: Connect one Maestro.
TestStep.Result: * Maestro is detected in the UI. * {{listdevices}} in the debug console shows it.

TestStep.Action: Connect a second Maestro.
TestStep.Result: * AxIS Z does not switch to the new Maestro but it is listed in the drop-down selector. * {{listdevices}} in the debug console shows both Maestros.

TestStep.Action: * Load/fakescan an impedance plate on the selected Maestro.
TestStep.Result: Active experiment appears and is highlighted.

TestStep.Action: Switch to the first Maestro which has no Active experiment.
TestStep.Result: * Maestro changes successfully. * Active experiment is no longer highlighted.

TestStep.Action: * Load/fakescan an impedance plate on the selected Maestro. * Take a baseline.
TestStep.Result: * Active Experiment appears and is highlighted. * Baseline taken.

TestStep.Action: Click on the first Active Experiment.
TestStep.Result: * Experiment changes successfully. * Maestro changes successfully.

TestStep.Action: Remove the plate.
TestStep.Result: There’s no more Active Experiment on this Maestro.

TestStep.Action: Unplug the selected Maestro with the Active experiment.
TestStep.Result: * AxIS Z switches to the remaining connected Maestro. * Disconnected Maestro is gone from the drop-down. * {{listdevices}} in the debug console no longer lists the disconnected Maestro.

TestStep.Action: Connect the disconnected Maestro.
TestStep.Result: * AxIS Z detects and adds the new Maestro to the drop-down selector AND * The drop-down switches to the new Maestro because it has an Active experiment. * {{listdevices}} in the debug console shows both Maestros.

TestStep.Action: Unplug the selected Maestro with the Active experiment once again.
TestStep.Result: * AxIS Z switches to the remaining connected Maestro. * Disconnected Maestro is gone from the drop-down. * {{listdevices}} in the debug console no longer lists the disconnected Maestro.

TestStep.Action: Start an experiment on the remaining Maestro.
TestStep.Result: Done. Baseline taken.

TestStep.Action: Connect the disconnected Maestro.
TestStep.Result: * AxIS Z detects and adds the new Maestro to the drop-down selector AND * The drop-down does not switch to the new Maestro because both have an Active experiment. * {{listdevices}} in the debug console shows both Maestros.

TestStep.Action: Disconnect both Maestros from the PC.
TestStep.Result: * Both Maestros are gone from the drop-down. * {{listdevices}} in the debug console no longer lists any Maestro.

TestStep.Action: Connect both Maestros "simultaneously" to the PC.
TestStep.Result: * Both Maestros are detected and appear in the AxIS Z drop-down. * {{listdevices}} in the debug console lists both Maestros.

TestStep.Action: Close AxIS Z and restart it after one minute.
TestStep.Result: * Both Maestros are detected and appear in the AxIS Z drop-down. * {{listdevices}} in the debug console lists both Maestros.

TestStep.Action: Close AxIS Z and disconnect the Maestros. Wait one minute.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Connect the Maestros and wait one minute.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Start AxIS Z.
TestStep.Result: * Both Maestros are detected and appear in the AxIS Z drop-down. * {{listdevices}} in the debug console lists both Maestros.

TestStep.Action: Reset both plates and delete the experiments.
TestStep.Result: Done.

Multi-Maestro Connect-Disconnect Test for Navigator

TestStep.Action: *Use at minimum one Maestro Z and one Maestro Edge/Pro with Impedance license.*
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Start AxIS Navigator with nothing connected.
TestStep.Result: * No Maestro in the Stream Tree. * The Maestro icon shown nothing is connected.

TestStep.Action: Connect Maestro Z.
TestStep.Result: * No Maestro in the Stream Tree. * The Maestro icon shown nothing is connected. * Maestro Z is not available via the Tools Menu.

TestStep.Action: Type {{ConnectToZ true}} in the debug console.
TestStep.Result: * Maestro Z is displayed in the Tools → Maestros menu. * {{listdevices}} in the debug console shows it.

TestStep.Action: Select the Maestro Z via the Tools → Maestros menu.
TestStep.Result: * Maestro Z appears in the Stream Tree. * Maestro icon shows Maestro is connected.

TestStep.Action: Connect a second Maestro (Pro/Edge).
TestStep.Result: * AxIS Navigator does not switch to the new Maestro. * Edge/Pro is listed in the Tools → Maestros menu along with the Maestro Z. * {{listdevices}} in the debug console shows both Maestros.

TestStep.Action: Unplug the selected Maestro (Z).
TestStep.Result: * Disconnected Maestro is gone from the Stream Tree. Stream Tree is now empty.. * AxIS Navigator switches to the non-Z Maestro. * Disconnected Maestro is gone from the Tools menu. * {{listdevices}} in the debug console no longer lists the disconnected Maestro.

TestStep.Action: Connect the disconnected Maestro.
TestStep.Result: * AxIS Navigator detects the Maestro Z but does not add it back to the Stream Tree. * The new Maestro is added to the Tools menu. * {{listdevices}} in the debug console shows both Maestros.

TestStep.Action: Disconnect both Maestros from the PC.
TestStep.Result: * Stream Tree becomes empty. * Both Maestros are gone from the Tools menu drop-down. * {{listdevices}} in the debug console no longer lists any Maestro.

TestStep.Action: Connect both Maestros "simultaneously" to the PC.
TestStep.Result: * Both Maestros are detected and appear in the Tools menu drop-down. * {{listdevices}} in the debug console lists both Maestros.

TestStep.Action: Close AxIS Navigator and restart it after one minute.
TestStep.Result: * Only the Maestro Pro/Edge is detected and appears in the Tools menu drop-down. * {{listdevices}} in the debug console lists the non-Z Maestro only. * Non-Z Maestro is added to the Stream Tree.

TestStep.Action: Close AxIS Navigator and disconnect the Maestros. Wait one minute.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Connect the Maestros and wait one minute.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Start AxIS Navigator.
TestStep.Result: * Only the Maestro Pro/Edge is detected and appears in the Tools menu drop-down. * {{listdevices}} in the debug console lists the non-Z Maestro only. * Non-Z Maestro is added to the Stream Tree.

TestStep.Action: Type {{ConnectToZ true}} in the debug console.
TestStep.Result: * Maestro Z is displayed in the Tools → Maestros menu along with the non-Z. * {{listdevices}} in the debug console shows it along with the non-Z.

TestStep.Action: Disconnect the Pro/Edge Maestro.
TestStep.Result: * Pro/Edge is gone from the Stream Tree. * Maestro Z is now in the Stream Tree. * Pro/Edge is gone from the Tools Menu. * {{listdevices}} only shows the Maestro Z.

Verify Signal Amplification commands

TestStep.Action: Apply ${Analog mode} analog mode to the Maestro. Uncheck Median Noise Subtraction if Neural: Spikes.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Type "cmdspock gainmultiplier -x ${Multiplier}" in the debug console, where x = n if the analog mode is neural and c if it’s cardiac.
TestStep.Result: Success.

TestStep.Action: If ${Analog mode} is NOT Cardiac: Broadband AND ${Multiplier} \!= 12.0, PASS this step and continue the test. Otherwise, Set plate type to CytoView 48 and apply a Cardiac + Viability Real-Time → Field Potentials + Viability configuration.
TestStep.Result: Configuration is applied.

TestStep.Action: If ${Analog mode} is cardiac, apply a different analog mode and then switch back to ${Analog mode}. Reboot the maestro if neural. When the button is available, click Play.
TestStep.Result: If a viability configuration was applied then viability is acquired first and viability numbers are shown. The raw signal (and RMS values) is amplified by a factor of ${Multiplier} compared to the baseline recording for ${Analog mode}. (Right-click → Plot Voltage Data for Contractility analog mode.)

TestStep.Action: Type "gaincheck" in the debug console.
TestStep.Result: The result = -${Multiplier} for neural or -(${Multiplier} x 10) if cardiac.

TestStep.Action: Record for RAW and Noise Estimate for 10 seconds.
TestStep.Result: Two files are created.

TestStep.Action: Switch to another analog mode of the same type. Other Neural or Cardiac one.
TestStep.Result: It also appears to be be amplified by ${Multiplier} .

TestStep.Action: Type "gaincheck" in the debug console.
TestStep.Result: The result = -${Multiplier} for neural or -(${Multiplier} x 10) if cardiac.

TestStep.Action: If a viability configuration wasn’t added during this iteration of this test then PASS this step and continue the test. Otherwise uncheck "Acquire Viability at start of file".
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Open the Noise Estimate CSV.
TestStep.Result: The values are consistent with a multiplier of ${Multiplier} compared to the baseline Noise Estimate CSV for ${Analog mode} analog mode.

TestStep.Action: Load and play the recorded RAW file.
TestStep.Result: The signal amplitude (and RMS values) is consistent with a multiplier of ${Multiplier}. If the file was recorded with viability then a viability number is also shown in the Continuous plot.

TestStep.Action: If ${Analog mode} is NOT a neural type PASS this step and continue the test. Otherwise reboot again. Type "gaincheck" in the debug console when the Maestro reconnects.
TestStep.Result: The result = -${Multiplier} for neural or -(${Multiplier} x 10) if cardiac.

TestStep.Action: If ${Analog mode} is NOT Cardiac: Standard PASS this step and continue the test. Otherwise, type "cmdspock gainmultiplier -c 4.5". Play the file again.
TestStep.Result: The gain multiplier doesn’t affect the file. The signal amplitude (and RMS values) is STILL consistent with a multiplier of ${Multiplier}.

TestStep.Action: Type "cmdspock gainmultiplier -x 1.0" in the debug console, where x = n if the analog mode is neural and c if it’s cardiac.
TestStep.Result: Success.

TestStep.Action: Switch the Maestro to a different analog mode and then back to ${Analog mode}. When the button is available with the Maestro selected, click Play.
TestStep.Result: The signal amplitude (and RMS values) looks the same as the baseline for ${Analog mode}.

TestStep.Action: Type "gaincheck" in the debug console.
TestStep.Result: The result = -1 for Neural analog modes and -10 for Cardiac analog modes.

TestStep.Action: If ${Analog mode} is NOT Cardiac: Standard PASS this step and continue the test. Otherwise reboot again. Type "cmdspock gainmultiplier -c 5000" while the Maestro is disconnected.
TestStep.Result: "Invalid command" error message. Command cannot be applied.

TestStep.Action: If ${Analog mode} is NOT Cardiac: Standard PASS this step and continue the test. Otherwise, after reboot, type "gaincheck" in the debug console.
TestStep.Result: The result = -10.

Same or Better Gas Regulation (OVERNIGHT - NEEDS GAS)

TestStep.Action: *Find a good location to connect a Maestro to gas and a laptop to leave overnight.*
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Connect the Maestro to 100% CO2 gas between 10 and 20 PSI. Ideally 15 PSI or as close as possible.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS Navigator and reboot Maestro.
TestStep.Result: AxIS Navigator resets and Maestro connects.

TestStep.Action: Dock a Smart Plate.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: * Dock a Smart Plate. * Uncheck "Auto Enable Heater" and turn the Heater Control ON. * Uncheck "Auto Enable Gas" and turn the CO2 Control ON. * Click Play.
TestStep.Result: * Heat and Gas start regulating. The environmental control thumbnails are moving. * AxIS Navigator is streaming.

TestStep.Action: Wait for heater to stabilize at 37 degrees C. and gas to stabilize at 5% CO2.
TestStep.Result: Heat and gas are stable. Thumbnails are green.

TestStep.Action: Open the debug console. Type {{logenterprisetelemetry -R <path> [ENTER]}} where {{<path>}} points to a path and a csv file to create. E.g. {{"C:\Users\cramos\Desktop\telemetry.csv"}} including the quotation marks.
TestStep.Result: Success.

TestStep.Action: In the debug console type {{logenterprisetelemetry [ENTER]}}
TestStep.Result: Verify there are lines being written to the file.

TestStep.Action: Wait for at least 8 hours and type the following command into the debug console the next day: {{logenterprisetelemetry -P}}
TestStep.Result: Success. Logging has stopped.

TestStep.Action: Import the CSV file into excel and make a sheet with only the following 5 columns, including headers: Time, Gas Mixer Enabled, Gas Source, Gas Mixer CO2 Set Point (% CO2), Gas Mixer CO2 Concentration (% CO2)
TestStep.Result: Done. Columns A-E are populated.

TestStep.Action: Delete the first 10 minutes of data. Since samples are taken every second delete the first 600 rows after the header.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Label column F "Absolute % CO2 Difference". Enter the formula {{=ABS(E2-D2)}} in the second row and copy all the way down by double-clicking on the solid square that appears on the bottom right of the cell.
TestStep.Result: Values are filled all the way down.

TestStep.Action: Label Column G "Value Higher than Setpoint". Enter the formula {{=E2>D2}} in the second row. Set conditional formatting to TRUE/FALSE if positive/negative. (It might be done automatically) Copy all the way down by double-clicking on the solid square that appears on the bottom right of the cell.
TestStep.Result: TRUE/FALSE values are filled all the way down.

TestStep.Action: Label Column H "% CO2 < 4.7 Min". Enter the formula {{=$E2<4.7}} in the second row. Set conditional formatting to TRUE/FALSE if positive/negative. (It might be done automatically) Copy all the way down by double-clicking on the solid square that appears on the bottom right of the cell.
TestStep.Result: TRUE/FALSE values are filled all the way down.

TestStep.Action: Label Column G "% CO2 > 5.3 Max". Enter the formula {{=$E2>5.3}} in the second row. Set conditional formatting to TRUE/FALSE if positive/negative. (It might be done automatically) Copy all the way down by double-clicking on the solid square that appears on the bottom right of the cell.
TestStep.Result: TRUE/FALSE values are filled all the way down.

TestStep.Action: Copy this table below into columns K & L. The table should span K1 - L17 and the formulas should produce results. If not, try manually typing in the formulas. |*Count (Samples)*|=COUNT(E:E)| |*Duration (hours)*|=L1/3600| |*Mean (%CO2)*|=AVERAGE(E:E)/100| |*Std Dev (%CO2)*|=STDEV.P(E:E)/100| |*Std Error (%CO2)*|=L4/SQRT(L1)| |*COV*|=L4/L3| |*Median (%CO2)*|=MEDIAN(E:E)/100| |*MAD (%CO2)*|=MEDIAN(F:F)/100| |*Median COV*|=L8/L7| |*MAX (%CO2)*|=MAX(E:E)/100| |*MIN (%CO2)*|=MIN(E:E)/100| |*Balance*|=COUNTIF(G:G,FALSE)/L$1| |*Offset*|=ABS(L12-0.5)| |*Below Threshold*|=COUNTIF(H:H,TRUE)| |*Above threshold*|=COUNTIF(I:I,TRUE)| |*Out of range samples*|=L14+L15| |*Out of range %*|=(L16/L1)*100|
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Verify the values in cells L3 to L17 are within the thresholds specified below: |*Count (Samples)*|Varies| |*Duration (hours)*|Varies| |*Mean (%CO2)*|0.05 +/- 0.01| |*Std Dev (%CO2)*|< 0.0025| |*Std Error (%CO2)*|Varies| |*COV*|Varies| |*Median (%CO2)*|0.05 +/- 0.01| |*MAD (%CO2)*|<0.0025| |*Median COV*|Varies| |*MAX (%CO2)*|< 0.06| |*MIN (%CO2)*|> 0.04| |*Balance*|Varies| |*Offset*|< 0.01| |*Below Threshold*|varies| |*Above threshold*|varies| |*Out of range samples*|varies| |*Out of range %*|< 5%|
TestStep.Result: All the values are within expected ranges.

Test.JiraSummary: Test CO2 Regulation Debug Commands

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS Navigator and connect a Maestro with no plate docked.
TestStep.Result: Done. CO2 Control is OFF and Auto Enable Gas is checked.

TestStep.Action: Open the debug console ({{CTRL+ALT+D}}) and type {{cmdspock setco2onoff fake [ENTER]}}.
TestStep.Result: An error is given.

TestStep.Action: Type {{cmdspock setco2onoff on [ENTER]}}.
TestStep.Result: CO2 Control turns ON and Auto Enable Gas is unchecked.

TestStep.Action: Type {{cmdspock setco2onoff off [ENTER]}}.
TestStep.Result: CO2 Control turns OFF and Auto Enable Gas remains unchecked.

TestStep.Action: Check Auto Enable Gas.
TestStep.Result: CO2 Control turns OFF and Auto Enable Gas is checked.

TestStep.Action: Type {{cmdspock setco2onoff 1 [ENTER]}}.
TestStep.Result: CO2 Control turns ON and Auto Enable Gas is unchecked.

TestStep.Action: Type {{cmdspock setco2onoff 0 [ENTER]}}.
TestStep.Result: CO2 Control turns OFF and Auto Enable Gas remains unchecked.

TestStep.Action: Check Auto Enable Gas.
TestStep.Result: CO2 Control turns OFF and Auto Enable Gas is checked.

TestStep.Action: Type {{cmdspock setco2onoff true [ENTER]}}.
TestStep.Result: CO2 Control turns ON and Auto Enable Gas is unchecked.

TestStep.Action: * Check Auto Enable Gas. * Type {{cmdspock fakenextscan 1112345678 [ENTER]}} into the debug console. * Dock the plate.
TestStep.Result: * Active Plate dropdown says CytoView MEA 96. * CO2 Control turns ON. * Auto Enable Gas remains checked.

TestStep.Action: Type {{cmdspock setco2onoff false [ENTER]}}.
TestStep.Result: CO2 Control turns OFF and Auto Enable Gas is unchecked.

TestStep.Action: Type {{cmdspock setco2setpoint -10 [ENTER]}}.
TestStep.Result: An error is given.

TestStep.Action: Type {{cmdspock setco2setpoint 16 [ENTER]}}
TestStep.Result: An error is given.

TestStep.Action: Type {{cmdspock setco2setpoint 10 [ENTER]}}
TestStep.Result: * CO2 Concentration (%) is set to 10. * CO2 Control remains OFF. * Auto Enable Gas remains unchecked.

TestStep.Action: Check Auto Enable Gas.
TestStep.Result: CO2 Control turns ON.

TestStep.Action: Type {{cmdspock setco2setpoint 5 [ENTER]}}
TestStep.Result: * CO2 Concentration (%) is set to 5. * CO2 Control remains ON. * Auto Enable Gas remains checked.

TestStep.Action: Eject plate.
TestStep.Result: * CO2 Control turns OFF. * Auto Enable Gas remains checked.

Test.JiraSummary: Test Minimum Covered Resistance present in AxIS Viability CSV

TestStep.Action: Reset AxIS Navigator.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Copy locally and load trunk\SoftwareTesting\RAW Files\Viability\10-second_Viability.raw
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Load NAV-7676.datastreams.
TestStep.Result: Config loaded ready to record Neural and Cardiac stats compiler.

TestStep.Action: Click Record.
TestStep.Result: Neural.csv and Cardiac.csv are created.

TestStep.Action: Open Neural.csv.
TestStep.Result: Under Statistics Compiler Settings, "Minimum Covered Resistance" = "18 kOhms" is below "Include Viability Data"

TestStep.Action: Open Cardiac.csv.
TestStep.Result: Under Statistics Compiler Settings, "Minimum Covered Resistance" = "11 kOhms" is below"Include Viability Data"

Test.JiraSummary: Can Re-enable Remote Control
Verify Gas regulation transitions take less than 5 minutes

TestStep.Action: Start with an undocked Maestro so there’s no gas in the chamber at start of test.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: * Reset AxIS Navigator and connect the Maestro. * Turn it on and dock a smart plate.
TestStep.Result: * AxIS Navigator recognizes the Maestro. * Gas is not flowing. CO2 Control is off.

TestStep.Action: * Make sure gas setpoint is at 5%. * Turn on gas. Start stopwatch.
TestStep.Result: It takes less than 5 minutes for gas to reach 5%.

TestStep.Action: Set gas to 8%. Start stopwatch.
TestStep.Result: It takes less than 5 minutes for gas to reach 8%.

TestStep.Action: Set gas to 3%. Start stopwatch.
TestStep.Result: It takes less than 5 minutes for gas to reach 3%.

TestStep.Action: Set gas to 5%. Start stopwatch.
TestStep.Result: It takes less than 5 minutes for gas to reach 5%.

TestStep.Action: Turn off gas.
TestStep.Result: Done.

Test.JiraSummary: Test Hardware Version detected correctly at startup

TestStep.Action: Connect AxIS Navigator to a V4 hardware Maestro (Or go to that system).
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Type {{cmdspock var list EnviroGreen/Co2/*}} into the debug console.
TestStep.Result: The result shows "VersionFourCo2ConcentrationPid".

Test.JiraSummary: Test Viability doesn't turn off extra wells in CytoView MEA 96

TestStep.Action: * Connect an Maestro 2 to AxIS Navigator.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: * Dock a smart plate. * Change the plate type to CytoView MEA 96. * Turn off the bottom 3 rows.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: * Apply Configuration -> Neural + Viability Real-Time -> Spontaneous + Viability.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: * Set Spike Detector to 4X and click Play.
TestStep.Result: Viability is acquired and AxIS streams.

TestStep.Action: Click on the Continuous Waveform Plot.
TestStep.Result: There are viability values in all wells except the bottom 3 rows, specially in the 4th from the bottom row of the plate, instead of missing "--" values.

TestStep.Action: Click on the Activity Map.
TestStep.Result: It shows activity in all but the bottom 3 rows.

Test.JiraSummary: Viability Activity Map shown in recorded files

TestStep.Action: Connect a Maestro to AxIS Navigator and load/spoof/change plate types to CytoView MEA 96 E-Stim+.
TestStep.Result: Navigator detects a Maestro with CytoView MEA 96 E-Stim + plate type.

TestStep.Action: Record a CytoView MEA 96 E-Stim + file with a Neural + Viability Spontaneous configuration.
TestStep.Result: File is recorded.

TestStep.Action: Load the recorded file and view the Activity Map.
TestStep.Result: * Activity Map has a Viability (Resistance, kΩ) Source in the drop down. * Activity Map title says "Viability (kΩ) at HH:MM AM/PM.

Test.JiraSummary: Test Neural and Cardiac Viability configurations with individual licenses

TestStep.Action: Make sure you have Neural, Cardiac and Viability licenses for the Maestro under test before starting this test.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: * Delete the Neural, Cardiac, and Viability licenses. * {{CTRL+ALT+D}} to open the debug console. * {{cmdkirk listlicenses}} in the debug console to view the licenses. * {{cmdkirk deletelicense #}} in the debug console to delete licenses. * Restart AxIS Navigator.
TestStep.Result: * Help → Manage Modules doesn’t show the Cardiac, Neural or Viability licenses. * No Cardiac or Neural configurations are available.

TestStep.Action: * Add Neural license via Help → Manage Modules → Activate Module…. * Restart AxIS Navigator.
TestStep.Result: * Help → Manage Modules shows the Neural module. * Only non-viability Neural configurations available.

TestStep.Action: * Add Viability license. * Restart AxIS Navigator.
TestStep.Result: * Help → Manage Modules shows the Viability module. * Neural and Neural + Viability configurations are available.

TestStep.Action: * Delete the Neural and Viability licenses. * Restart AxIS Navigator.
TestStep.Result: * Help → Manage Modules doesn’t show the Cardiac, Neural or Viability licenses. * No Cardiac or Neural configurations are available.

TestStep.Action: * Add Cardiac license via Help → Manage Modules → Activate Module…. * Restart AxIS Navigator.
TestStep.Result: * Help → Manage Modules shows the Cardiac module. * Only non-viability Cardiac configurations available.

TestStep.Action: * Add Viability license. * Restart AxIS Navigator.
TestStep.Result: * Help → Manage Modules shows the Viability module. * Cardiac and Cardiac + Viability configurations are available.

TestStep.Action: * Add Neural license via Help → Manage Modules → Activate Module…. * Restart AxIS Navigator.
TestStep.Result: * Help → Manage Modules shows the Neural, Cardiac and Viability modules. * Neural, Neural + Viability, Cardiac and Cardiac + Viability configurations available.

Test.JiraSummary: Viability cancel test

TestStep.Action: Connect a Maestro with Viability license to AxIS Navigator.
TestStep.Result: AxIS Navigator recognizes Maestro.

TestStep.Action: * Open the debug console ({{CTRL+ALT+D}}). * Type {{cmdspock fakenextscan 0612345678}} into the debug console. * Dock a Smart Plate.
TestStep.Result: Cytoview MEA 24 plate is recognized as docked.

TestStep.Action: * Double-click on the Maestro and set the analog mode to Neural: Spikes. * Set up Navigator to record a raw file. * Set up a valid, continuous electrical stimulation. * Click play. Take note of the RMS values.
TestStep.Result: * Done. * Stimulation button is green and says "Start". * RMS values noted.

TestStep.Action: Type {{boostviability 2000 2000}} into the debug console.
TestStep.Result: Success.

TestStep.Action: * Double-click on the Maestro check "Acquire Viability at start of file."
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: * Click Stop then Play. * Click on "Skip Viability" as soon as the button is available.
TestStep.Result: * "Viability is being skipped…" toast message appears. * Stimulation button is disabled and it says "Cannot stimulate while acquiring viability data" when moused over. * "Viability was skipped by the user." text replaces the other text in the toast message. * Stimulation button turns green again. * RMS values are the same or close to the original values before viability was enabled. * No viability/resistance symbols appear on the plot.

TestStep.Action: * Click Stop then Play.
TestStep.Result: "Acquiring viability…" toast message appears with a progress bar on the right side.

TestStep.Action: Click on "Skip Viability" when the progress bar is near the end.
TestStep.Result: * "Viability is being skipped…" toast message appears with no progress bar. * "Viability was skipped by the user." text replaces the other text in the toast message. * RMS values are the same or close to the original values before viability was enabled. * ???No viability/resistance symbols appear on the plot.??? (They do now until NAV-7735 is fixed.)

TestStep.Action: * Click Stop then Play. * Click on "Skip Viability" after 30 seconds. (Get ready to click record shortly after.)
TestStep.Result: * "Viability is being skipped…" toast message appears with no progress bar. * "Viability was skipped by the user." text replaces the other text in the toast message. * RMS values are the same or close to the original values before viability was enabled. * ???No viability/resistance symbols appear on the plot.??_? (They do now until NAV-7735 is fixed.)_

TestStep.Action: Click record.
TestStep.Result: * "Acquiring viability…" toast message appears with a progress bar on the right side. * "Viability successfully acquired." toast message appears at the end. * RMS valued are the same or cloes to the original values before viability was enabled. * Viability measurements with the resistance symbols appear next to the RMS values. * There are no unexpected blank viability values.

TestStep.Action: * Stop recording. * Close the toast message. * Click Record again.
TestStep.Result: * "Acquiring viability…" toast message appears with a progress bar on the right side. * "Viability successfully acquired." toast message appears at the end. * Progress bar disappears. * RMS valued are the same or cloes to the original values before viability was enabled. * Viability measurements with the resistance symbols appear next to the RMS values. * There are no unexpected blank viability values.

TestStep.Action: Stop recording and play the recorded files.
TestStep.Result: The files show the same/expected RMS and viability values.

Test.JiraSummary: Legacy Heater Test

TestStep.Action: Connect a Maestro to AxIS Navigator.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Open Debug Console ({{CTRL+ALT+D}}) and view QPid values for P Out, I Out and D Out.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: * Dock/Fake next scan a ${Plate Types} plate. * Make sure "Heater Control" is on in the Environmental Control module.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Click on the cog symbol and toggle "Legacy Heater Control".
TestStep.Result: Verify that if Plate Type "${Type}" = * = MEA, P values go to NaN when "Legacy Heater Control" is checked. * = Impedance, P values remain real numbers instead of NaNs when "Legacy Heater Control" is checked.

Test.JiraSummary: Test Docking Impedance Plate with Legacy Heater Checked

TestStep.Action: Connect a Maestro to AxIS Navigator.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Open Debug Console ({{CTRL+ALT+D}}) and view QPid values for P Out, I Out and D Out.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: * Dock/Fake next scan an MEA plate. (not prefix 18 or 21) * Make sure "Heater Control" is on in the Environmental Control module.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Click on the cog symbol and toggle "Legacy Heater Control" to check it.
TestStep.Result: P values go to NaN.

TestStep.Action: Dock/fake next scan an impedance plate. (prefix 18 or 21)
TestStep.Result: * P values change to real numbers instead of NaNs.

TestStep.Action: Eject the plate
TestStep.Result: Plate is ejected {{Insert an impedance plate or import an experiment to enable experiment panels}} banner message is shown

TestStep.Action: Copy locally if necessary, and then import any experiment
TestStep.Result: Toast message goes away

TestStep.Action: Dock a plate
TestStep.Result: Plate is docked

Test.JiraSummary: Viability Is Acquired

TestStep.Action: * Open the debug console ({{CTRL+ALT+D}}). * Type {{cmdspock fakenextscan 0612345678}} into the debug console. * Type {{boostviability 2000 2000}} into the debug console. * Apply the Neural Real-Time > Spontaneous configuration * Dock the plate.
TestStep.Result: * Console commands are a success * multiplier: 2000+2000i displays in the console after the boost viability command * Cytoview MEA 24 plate is recognized as docked.

TestStep.Action: * Check "Acquire Viability at start of file." if it is not checked * Set up Navigator to record a raw file.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Click Play and wait about one minute
TestStep.Result: * DC offset completes after a few seconds * "Acquiring viability…" toast message appears and includes a progress bar * Live Play control displays "Skip Viability" button * A second DC offset completes around 50 - 75% of the way through acquiring viability * When viability is complete the message changes to "Viability successfully acquired" and the progress bar no longer displays * "Skip Viability" button is not visible above the live play controls !xray-attachment://63e3c1f9-493e-40fc-a610-bdafe15abeb6|width=1550,height=688! !xray-attachment://649b24ec-1491-49e4-9477-3a94af71b5e0|width=1603,height=635!

TestStep.Action: View the Continuous waveform plot
TestStep.Result: * Viability/resistance symbols appear on the continuous waveform plot. !xray-attachment://7d5764ba-0149-4316-b6b8-cf03da163537|width=659,height=563!

TestStep.Action: Click Record and wait 2 - 3 minutes
TestStep.Result: * "Acquiring viability…" toast message appears with a progress bar on the right side. * Status bar turns red and contains "(Recording)" in the status bar following the name of the Maestro and the selected well like "Maestro Pro (Maestro 274) Well A1 (Recording" this indicates recording has started * Viability is acquired after a approximately 2 - 3 minutes

TestStep.Action: * View the Continuous waveform plot * Note the kiloOhm values for a few of the wells to compare with the recording
TestStep.Result: * Viability/resistance symbols appear on the continuous waveform plot. !xray-attachment://458cefbb-74f0-49be-a3c2-bd773734bd1d|width=659,height=563!

TestStep.Action: View the Activity map
TestStep.Result: After acquiring Viability, resistance values in kiloohms (kΩ) can be visualized in the Activity Map by selecting Viability (Resistance, kΩ) in the Source drop-down above the play controls. !xray-attachment://33001d0a-db14-4798-82ca-ed4b565d1477|width=1291,height=500!

TestStep.Action: Stop recording and play the recorded file. View the continuous waveform plot
TestStep.Result: The file shows the same/expected RMS and viability values seen during the recording

Test.JiraSummary: AxisZ Firmware Flashing - Automated

TestStep.Action: Reset AxisZ with no device connected.
TestStep.Result: AxisZ opens.

TestStep.Action: Click on *Help* menu item.
TestStep.Result: There is no *Restore Firmware* option.

TestStep.Action: Connect a Maestro Z.
TestStep.Result: Maestro Z is detected by AxisZ.

TestStep.Action: Click on *Help* menu item.
TestStep.Result: *Restore Firmware* option is now available.

TestStep.Action: Disconnect the Maestro Z.
TestStep.Result: The *Restore Firmware* option disappears. AxisZ shows "No Maestro Connected".

TestStep.Action: Reconnect the Maestro Z. Once the Maestro Z is detected, click on *Help -> Restore Firmware*.
TestStep.Result: "Update Firmware Confirmation" pop-up appears. Only the Maestro Z device is listed.

TestStep.Action: _Uncheck_ the box to "Update the firmware on the Maestro Z" if not already unchecked.
TestStep.Result: The *Proceed* button is _disabled_.

TestStep.Action: _Check_ the box to "Update the firmware on the Maestro Z" if not already unchecked.
TestStep.Result: The *Proceed* button is _enabled_.

TestStep.Action: Click the *Cancel* button.
TestStep.Result: "Update Firmware Confirmation" pop-up disappears.

TestStep.Action: Click on *Help -> Restore Firmware*.
TestStep.Result: "Update Firmware Confirmation" pop-up appears.

TestStep.Action: Make sure that "Update the firmware on the Maestro Z" is checked and click *Proceed*.
TestStep.Result: The AxisZ window disappears. "Updating Firmware" pop-up appears with no interactable controls and only showing two progress bars and text. (See screenshot) Once the firmware process completes successfully the Maestro Z will restart. A "Firmware updated successfully" pop-up appears replacing the updating pop-up. (See screenshot)

TestStep.Action: Verify there is no process to cancel the the firmware upgrade process. (No cancel button)
TestStep.Result: Done. If the process is canceled (*or failed*), the page will change to a text display indicating such, and prompting you to close the window.

TestStep.Action: Click the *Close* button on successful operation. _Note: No matter the result, succeed, fail or aborted, a *Close* button will appear._
TestStep.Result: The pop-up closes. The main window will reappear. The device will reboot and get detected by AxisZ.

TestStep.Action: Open {{{year-month-date}_{Maestro type}-(Maestro name)_Audit.pdf}}
TestStep.Result: +Experiment Audit Trail+ title is shown on the first page The following content is shown below the +Experiment Audit Trail+ title # Exported by <Domain Name of user who generated it> # Exported on <Date and time of the export> {color:#97a0af}_e.g Exported on Wednesday, December 14, 2022 at 10:32 AM_{color} # Note stating that all dates are stated in the local time of the PC that generated it: ## All dates and times are expressed in the local timezone of the computer generating this report. For this report the timezone is <Eastern Daylight Time> which currently has an offset from GMT of <-5> hours. # Table with information from the experiment setup module, this includes ## Experiment Name ## Barcode ## Owner ## Original Owner ## Investigator ## Description ## Start Time ## Last Sample Time of the experiment ## "Experiment Privacy" = Shared/Private ## "Experiment Status" = Offline/Online ## AxIS Z Version that produced the report ## Maestro Name ## Maestro Serial Number

TestStep.Action: Navigate to the second page of the .pdf file
TestStep.Result: There is a separate page titled "Plate Map Changes" containing: # Time of the change on the left column with dates in "g" format which localizes to `m/d/yyyy h:mm AM/PM` in the U.S. # <User> - <text the user entered in the plate map> in the right column. !xray-attachment://69b4aca9-d008-4adc-84b2-50acd0e60e0b|width=50%!

TestStep.Action: Navigate to the 3rd page of the .pdf file
TestStep.Result: There is a separate page titled "System Notes & Events" containing: # Time of the event on the left column with dates in "g" format which localizes to `m/d/yyyy h:mm AM/PM` in the U.S. # Right column with notes that come from the device including serial number. {color:#97a0af}E.g. "(0.11 hr): Lovelace (11-01.03.00166) - Door Opened"{color}. The events tracked are: ## Plate Docked or Ejected ## Door Opened of Closed

TestStep.Action: Navigate to the 4th page of the .pdf file
Navigate to the 5th page of the .pdf file
TestStep.Result: Page titled "Note Changes" containing: # Time of the change to the note on the left column with dates in "g" format which localizes to `m/d/yyyy h:mm AM/PM` in the U.S. # Right column with Note creation/deletion/edits along with the user that did it. ## {color:#97a0af}E.g. "Note created by BIOMAESTRO2\Axion - "User - Added PBMCs"{color}

TestStep.Action: Navigate to the 6th/7th pages
TestStep.Result: Verify there is a separate page(s) titled "Miscellaneous Changes" containing: # Time of the change on the left column with dates in "g" format which localizes to `m/d/yyyy h:mm AM/PM` in the U.S. # Right column with changes to the experiment module and alarms. to be Part 11 compliant it should include old and new values. {color:#97a0af}E.g. "Lovelace (11-01.03.00166) CO2 Enabled from "False" to "True'".{color} The specific fields to track are: ## Experiment Name ## Investigator ## Description ## Experiment Start ## Temperature alarm settings ## Gas alarm settings

TestStep.Action: Navigate to the 8th-20th pages
TestStep.Result: There are separate page(s) titled "Appendix: Plate Map History" containing: # A list of Plate Map Revisions with date and time and the same of the user who modified it. # The first entry has a note "Initial Plate Map". # Each entry has a table with columns for Treatment, Control and Wells.

TestStep.Result: # The Content should be the following: # Title = Device Audit Trail # Exported by <DomainName of user who generated it> # Exported on <Date and time of the export> e.g Exported on Monday, August 31, 2020 at 8:50 AM # Note stating that all dates are stated in the local time of the PC that generated it: # All dates and times are expressed in the local timezone of the computer generating this report. For this report the timezone is <Eastern Daylight Time> which currently has an offset from GMT of <-4/5> hours. # Serial number: <serial number> (for the bridge) # Firmware version <firmware version>

Test.JiraSummary: Motor Self-Test should verify the encoder is working

TestStep.Action: Open AxIS Navigator with 2 attached Maestros one which has door and plate encoder problems , and the other one does not have them
TestStep.Result: AxIS Navigator is opened with 2 connected Maestros

TestStep.Action: Click Tools → Maestros → Select one that has any door and plate encoder problems
TestStep.Result: Maestro with encoder problems is selected

TestStep.Action: Click Tools → Motors → Ignore Safety Limits… !xray-attachment://dfc33fa7-9a0d-401d-b11a-cf39fe3c30be|width=617,height=310!
TestStep.Result: Motor Safety Limits window is opened Make sure that Ignore Safety Limits checkboxes are *unticked* !xray-attachment://401b515b-6be6-494f-aa9a-5b7d71c297fc|width=427,height=615!

TestStep.Action: Open debug console (Ctrl +Alt + D) → Click _View Results..._ button next to Self-Test
TestStep.Result: Self Diagnostic window is opened !xray-attachment://840001c2-58b9-4fcc-92d5-a5e204113051|width=870,height=746!

TestStep.Action: Click Run Full Diagnostic → Wait until it will be finished
TestStep.Result: Verify Plate and Door Encoder Test results: they should be failed; Expected and actual positions should be displayed !xray-attachment://661aa792-0b86-4420-b702-f7388c9ac21a|width=904,height=143! We now get the difference between the open and closed position (About _400_ for the door and about _2400_ for the plate holder). If values are near that (within 10% of the difference) - test passes, if not - fails.

TestStep.Action: Click Tools → Maestros → Select one that has *not* door or plate encoder problems
TestStep.Result: Maestro without encoder problems is selected

TestStep.Action: Open debug console (Ctrl +Alt + D) → Click _View Results..._ button next to Self-Test
TestStep.Result: Self Diagnostic window is opened

TestStep.Action: Click Run Full Diagnostic → Wait until it will be finished
TestStep.Result: Verify Plate and Door Encoder Test results: they should be Passed !xray-attachment://9723ddff-631d-4741-9ad5-c0306a0b2a9c|width=957,height=170!

Test.JiraSummary: Information error should be displayed when Bridge firmware upload process has failed
Bridge firmware version should be checked on connection when AxiS Z is already running
Firmware flashing menu includes Bridges and Trays as options

TestStep.Action: Open AxIS Z with connected Tray Z _(bridge and Tray should have old versions as we rolled firmware version in preconditions)_
TestStep.Result: "Update Firmware" toast message should spawn on connection (it should take no more than 10 seconds (ideally 0.25-5s) right after Tray Z will be connected)

TestStep.Action: Click on "Update Firmware" button
TestStep.Result: * "Update Firmware Confirmation" menu appears * Tray Name/Bridge names are shown * Update the firmware on .. option is checked !xray-attachment://870b3f85-e002-44ff-b391-8557c009919d|width=601,height=103!

TestStep.Action: Click on *Cancel* button
TestStep.Result: "Update Firmware Confirmation" pop-up disappears

TestStep.Action: Click on *Help -> Restore Firmware*
TestStep.Result: * "Update Firmware Confirmation" menu appears * Tray Name/Bridge names are shown * Update the firmware on .. option is checked

TestStep.Action: Click *Proceed* button
TestStep.Result: * The AxisZ window disappears * "Updating Firmware" pop-up appears with no interactable controls and a progress bar detailing the steps and estimated progress through the firmware update process is displayed. * Progress bar could be static no more than 5 seconds, ideally 0.25 - 1 seconds * There is no process to cancel the the firmware upgrade process * Once the firmware process completes successfully the AxIS Z will restart. * A "Firmware updated successfully" pop-up appears replacing the updating pop-up.

TestStep.Action: Click the *Close* button on successful operation
TestStep.Result: * The pop-up closes. * The main window will reappear. * The device will reboot in no more than 10 seconds, ideally 0.25-1 seconds after progress bar filling * The device will get detected by Axis Z in no more than 10 s (ideally 1-5s) * No Update firmware banner messages are displayed

TestStep.Action: Click Help → About
TestStep.Result: Tray/Bridge should report version number identical to the version of AxIS Z used to flash
