Test.JiraSummary: Bridge accepts debug command to set / clear the fake barcode for a basin 'x'

TestStep.Action: Open debug console (Ctrl+Alt+D) → Enter "cmdtray help"
TestStep.Result: If tray is connected it should print "Success:" in the console along with a list of the available command parameters and a description !xray-attachment://12a8a36a-6a9d-45e3-a4eb-7001d045ec30|width=475,height=590!

TestStep.Action: Open Bridge Console
TestStep.Result: Bridge Console is opened

TestStep.Action: Go to Console tab → Enter "cmdtray FakeNextScan 0 9087654321" ("0" represents basin and "9087654321" represents fake barcode) and press enter Note, the cmdtray parameters ARE case sensitive
TestStep.Result: Barcode is spoofed !xray-attachment://da72da71-a88d-4b54-b9ac-c163956c7c3c|width=353,height=55!

TestStep.Action: Go to Sos tree tab and open it up to see plate 0 barcode
TestStep.Result: Sos tree tab should display +original+ barcode for basin 0

TestStep.Action: Go to scheduled recording tab → Toggle basin #0 twice
TestStep.Result: * Scheduled recording tab is opened * Basin docked

TestStep.Action: Go back to Sos tree tab
TestStep.Result: Barcode for plate #0 should change to "90876543421"

TestStep.Action: Navigate to AxIS Z → Select basin "0" → Select Experiment Setup Panel
TestStep.Result: Barcode for plate #0 is "8765-4321"

TestStep.Action: Go to scheduled recording tab → Toggle basin #0 twice
TestStep.Result: * Scheduled recording tab is opened * Basin docked

TestStep.Action: Go back to Sos tree tab
TestStep.Result: Barcode for plate #0 is still be "9087654321"

TestStep.Action: Navigate to AxIS Z → Select basin "0" → Select Experiment Setup Panel
TestStep.Result: Barcode for plate #0 is still "8765-4321""

TestStep.Action: Open Bridge Console → Enter "cmdtray ClearFakeScan 0" ("0" represents basin) and press enter
TestStep.Result: Console updates with "Faked barcode cleared" and Success: !xray-attachment://a7d3f7d7-7176-4f6f-9387-9a7bc6b2ccf9|width=315,height=96!

TestStep.Action: Go to scheduled recording tab → Toggle basin #0 twice
TestStep.Result: * Scheduled recording tab is opened * Basin docked

TestStep.Action: Go to Sos tree tab and open it up to see plate 0 barcode
TestStep.Result: Sos tree tab displays the original barcode for basin 0

Console updates with "Motion to 0 result <a number>, motor state 2" where 0 is the basin and the number is the current tick position from the bottom because in this case the plate was docked and the command moves the motor up (to open) 100 ticks to a new position

Plate is not docked. Motor state is ErrorJammed and mechanical state is unknown, because the motor controller uses travel distance to tell if it had reached the intended destination. When the destination is "open" it can also use the limit switch. When we issue "cmdtray MoveMotor 0 1" command, the motor tries to move 1600 ticks towards the "docked/closed" position. However, since it is only 100 ticks away from it, this is about how far it can travel. Hence, it reports the "ErrorJammed" state.

TestStep.Action: Enter "cmdtray MoveMotor 0 0"
TestStep.Result: Plate is undocked and restored to a good state

TestStep.Action: Right click on the "0" basin → Dock Plate
TestStep.Result: Plate docked without any issues

TestStep.Action: Navigate to Console Bridge → Go to Sos tree tab
TestStep.Result: Barcode for plate #0 is changed to the initial

TestStep.Action: Navigate to AxIS Z → Select basin "0" → Select Experiment Setup Panel
TestStep.Result: Barcode for plate #0 is initial one

Test.JiraSummary: Bridge LEDs should track the state of the connected trays and the connected PC

TestStep.Action: Power off the bridge if it’s powered on → Unplug any connected trays
TestStep.Result: The 'power' LED on the bridge should be *off* if the bridge has no power supplied to it: LED is inactive

TestStep.Action: Power on the bridge
TestStep.Result: * The 'power' LED on the bridge should glow blue when bridge is starting up and connecting to the PC * The ‘power’ LED should glow sold green when the bridge is ready and connected to the PC * The LED for 'PC Link' should be *off* as there is no AxiS Z instance polling the bridge * The LEDs for Tray 1 and for Tray 2 should be *off* as no trays are plugged into the port for tray 1 or tray 2

TestStep.Action: Connect AxIS Z instance to the bridge, so that it will polling the bridge
TestStep.Result: * The LED for 'PC Link' should be *even and green* if AxIS Z is actively polling the bridge * The LEDs for Tray 1 and for Tray 2 should be *off* as no trays are plugged into tray 1’s and 2's ports

TestStep.Action: Plug Tray into the tray 1 port on the bridge
TestStep.Result: When there is a tray plugged into the tray 1 port, and it is not actively capturing data, the LED should glow blue : LED is the expected *solid blue* color

TestStep.Action: Navigate to AxIS Z app → Select any basin (ex. Front Left) → Right click on it → Dock Plate (if it’s ejected) → Click Measure Baseline button
TestStep.Result: The LED for tray 1 should pulse green if the tray is connected and actively capturing impedance in at least one basin: LED is the expected *pulsing green* color

TestStep.Action: Disconnect Tray from the tray1 port
TestStep.Result: The LED for Tray 1 should be off if no tray is plugged into the port If there are active experiments, the toast message for no impedance data received will appear after 8 minutes

TestStep.Action: Plug Tray into the tray 2 port
TestStep.Result: When there is a tray plugged into the tray 2 port, and it is not actively capturing data, the LED should glow blue : LED is the expected *solid blue* color

TestStep.Action: Navigate to AxIS Z app → Select any basin (ex. Back Right) → Click Measure Baseline button
TestStep.Result: The LED for tray 2 should pulse green if the tray is connected and actively capturing impedance in at least one basin: LED is the expected *pulsing green* color

TestStep.Action: Disconnect Tray from the tray 2 port
TestStep.Result: The LED for Tray 2 should be off if no tray is plugged into the tray port

Test.JiraSummary: ‘Check Impedance Signals’ feature when TraySmart plate exists in any basin

TestStep.Action: Launch AxIS Z while Tray Z is connected but without any TraySmart Plate docked
TestStep.Result: AxIS Z is opened with the connected Tray Z

TestStep.Action: Click Help
TestStep.Result: Check Impedance Signals. option is not available there !xray-attachment://cbdb1c33-5295-44b7-a6bc-fce16e2fb11d|width=313,height=218!

TestStep.Action: Dock or {{cmdtray FakeNextScan [basin #] [90 series plate #]}} 1 TraySmart Plate in any basin -> Click Help (Don’t forget to {{cmdtray ClearFakeScan [basin #]}} each faked basin at the end of the test)
TestStep.Result: "Check Impedance Signals' menu item is visible and enabled

TestStep.Action: Eject TraySmart Plate → Click Help
TestStep.Result: "Check Impedance Signals' menu item is not visible

TestStep.Action: Dock 1 TraySmart Plate in any basin → Click Help
TestStep.Result: "Check Impedance Signals' menu item is visible and enabled

TestStep.Action: Click "Check Impedance Signals' menu item
TestStep.Result: * A toast message should appears in 1-3 sec indicating that the capture has begun. * 'Check Impedance Signals' toast message contains a progress bar that is in constant motion, and progresses for <2 minutes before fast-forwarding to the end and indicating a complete check

TestStep.Action: Wait until Check Impedance Signals process will be finished
TestStep.Result: * Progress bar elapses within the desired time frame (90 s - 130 s) * Prompt appears and allows opening results folder after Check Impedance Signals process completed

TestStep.Action: Click on an offered button on a toast message
TestStep.Result: The folder or file where the results are in is opened

TestStep.Action: Open the result file
TestStep.Result: * The page is titled with the plate barcode and the plate position indicating the basin (back left, back right, front left, or front right) it was loaded in. * The result file from the TrayZ check impedance signals process indicates the correct ranges for each row of the plate. ** When viewing the summary for the results of the TrayZ check impedance signals process, the expected ranges should be broken down by row: • A&E: 50 Ohm += 5% • B&F: 100 Ohm += 5% • C&G: 1100 Ohm += 5% • D&H: 5100 Ohm += 5%

TestStep.Action: Switch to AxIS Z → Dock TraySmart Plates to 2 more basins
TestStep.Result: * TraySmart Plates are docked * 3 basins contains TraySmart Plates

TestStep.Action: Click Help → Click "Check Impedance Signals' menu item
TestStep.Result: * A toast message should appears in 1-3 sec indicating that the capture has begun. * 'Check Impedance Signals' toast message contains a progress bar that is in constant motion, and progresses for <2 minutes before fast-forwarding to the end and indicating a complete check

TestStep.Action: When "Check Impedance Signals" process is in progress → Hover over Measure Baselines button on a Tray device icon
TestStep.Result: While CheckImpedanceSignals is in progress, the MeasureBaseline buttons on the screen is disabled and mousing over them should show a tooltip with the text "Cannot Measure Baselines during an Impedance Sample Check"

TestStep.Action: Click on Measure baselines button on a Tray device icon
TestStep.Result: Nothing happens: * CheckImpedanceSignals is still in progress * MeasureBaseline button on the tray device icon is disabled * No any measure baselines banners appear

TestStep.Action: Select each basin one by one → Navigate to Experiment Setup Panel → Hover over Measure baseline button on Experiment Setup Panel
TestStep.Result: Measure Baseline buttons are disabled and mousing over them shows a tooltip with the text "Cannot Measure Baselines during an Impedance Sample Check"

TestStep.Action: Select basin without TraySmart Plate docked → Click on any Measure baseline button on Experiment Setup Panel
TestStep.Result: Nothing happens: * CheckImpedanceSignals is still in progress * MeasureBaseline button on Experiment Setup Panel is disabled * No any measure baselines banners appear

TestStep.Action: Wait until Check Impedance Signals process will be finished → Click on an offered button on a toast message
TestStep.Result: * Progress bar elapses within the desired time frame (90 s - 130 s) * Prompt appears and allows opening results folder after Check Impedance Signals process completed * The folder or file where the results are in is opened

TestStep.Action: Open the result file
TestStep.Result: * A page in the result file should be created for *each* basin that has a *TraySmart* plate loaded. +(in our case for 3 basins)+ * The page should be titled with the plate barcode and the plate position indicating the basin (back left, back right, front left, or front right) it was loaded in. * The result file from the TrayZ check impedance signals process should indicate the correct ranges for each row of the plate. ** When viewing the summary for the results of the TrayZ check impedance signals process, the expected ranges should be broken down by row: • A&E: 50 Ohm += 5% • B&F: 100 Ohm += 5% • C&G: 1100 Ohm += 5% • D&H: 5100 Ohm += 5%

TestStep.Action: Switch to AxIS Z → Click Measure baselines button on a Tray device icon
TestStep.Result: 4 "Acquiring baseline.. " banner messages are displayed

TestStep.Action: Click Help → Hover over Check Impedance Samples option
TestStep.Result: * Check Impedance Samples option is disabled during Measure Baseline process * Hovering over Check Impedance Samples option shows a tooltip with the text "Cannot Impedance Sample Check during a baseline measurement"

TestStep.Action: Click Check Impedance Samples option
TestStep.Result: Nothing happens: * Baseline for each plate is still in progress * Check Impedance Samples banner does not appear

TestStep.Action: Wait until baseline for each plate will be completed → Click Check Impedance Samples option
TestStep.Result: * A toast message should appears in 1-3 sec indicating that the capture has begun. * 'Check Impedance Signals' toast message contains a progress bar that is in constant motion, and progresses for <2 minutes before fast-forwarding to the end and indicating a complete check

TestStep.Action: While CheckImpedanceSignals is in progress → Eject *non*-TraySmart Plate
TestStep.Result: * *non*-TraySmart Plate ejected * CheckImpedanceSignals is still in progress

TestStep.Action: Eject any TraySmart Plate
TestStep.Result: * TraySmart Plate ejected * CheckImpedanceSignals is aborted and the toast message is changed to a yellow 'process aborted' toast message with some text that indicates why the abort occurred in 1-3 seconds

TestStep.Action: Click Help → Click Check Impedance Samples option
TestStep.Result: * A toast message should appears in 1-3 sec indicating that the capture has begun. * 'Check Impedance Signals' toast message contains a progress bar that is in constant motion, and progresses for <2 minutes before fast-forwarding to the end and indicating a complete check

TestStep.Action: Disconnect TrayZ
TestStep.Result: * Tray Z is disconnected * CheckImpedanceSignals is aborted and the toast message is changed to a yellow 'process aborted' toast message with some text that indicates why the abort occurred in 1-3 seconds

Test.JiraSummary: Verify Live Zoom mode Automated

TestStep.Action: Navigate to the Experiment Setup Module. Load an Impedance Plate. Ensure that an Experiment has been started, and if not Select the *"Measure Baseline"* button.
TestStep.Result: The Experiment Start: will be populated with a time showing when the Start button was pressed in a format of *M/DD/YYYY *H:mm AM/PM Baseline calculation begins . Analysis Modules appear.

TestStep.Action: After baseline is acquired. Click on the Analysis Module button to navigate to the Analysis plot. And Wait a couple of minutes.
TestStep.Result: * The Live Zoom button appears as enabled and is blue * The next impedance reading updates the analysis plot and impedance traces are shown on the graph. * Every minute the plot will update and re-zoom to show all available data. * There is no badge or tooltip on the *Live Zoom* button. See screenshot.

TestStep.Action: Click the *"Live Zoom"* button. Wait a couple of minutes.
TestStep.Result: The Live Zoom functionality becomes de-toggled. * The button loses its blue highlight and becomes clear * New data is still downloaded and is being processed so a blue badge appears on the *Live Zoom* button. * A tool-tip is there on the button as well. * Re-zooming will no longer happen as new data is processed. See Screenshot

TestStep.Action: *Double click* inside the plot.
TestStep.Result: * The Live Zoom button re-enables and is blue. * Plot re-zooms to show all available data. * The plot will auto-zoom anytime new data in processed.(Every minute) * There is no badge or tooltip on the *Live Zoom* button. See Screenshot

TestStep.Action: Select the *Click-drag-and-zoom* tool (magnifying glass) from the plot tool bar. * Use the tool to (rectangle) zoom into somewhere on the plot. * Wait a couple of minutes.
TestStep.Result: The Live Zoom functionality becomes de-toggled. * The button loses its blue highlight and becomes clear * New data is still downloaded and is being processed so a blue badge appears on the *Live Zoom* button. * A tool-tip is there on the button as well. * Re-zooming will no longer happen as new data is processed See Screenshot

TestStep.Action: Click the Reset Plot button (the two arrows in the plot toolbar). Wait a couple of minutes.
TestStep.Result: * The Live Zoom button re-enables and is blue. * Plot re-zooms to show all available data. * The plot will auto-zoom anytime new data in processed. * There is no badge or tooltip on the *Live Zoom* button. See Screenshot

TestStep.Action: Select the *Pan* tool (Hand icon) from the plot tool bar. * Use the tool to Pan around the plot. * Wait a couple of minutes.
TestStep.Result: The Live Zoom functionality becomes de-toggled. * The Pan tool on the Plot toolbar highlights white. * The *Live Zoom* button loses its blue highlight and becomes clear * New data is still downloaded and is being processed so a blue badge appears on the *Live Zoom* button. * A tool-tip is there on the button as well. * Re-zooming will no longer happen as new data is processed

TestStep.Action: Click the Reset Plot button (the two arrows in the plot toolbar). Wait a couple of minutes.
TestStep.Result: * The Live Zoom button re-enables and is blue. * Plot re-zooms to show all available data. * The plot will auto-zoom anytime new data in processed. * Pan tool is still selected. See screenshot

TestStep.Action: Select the *Click-drag-and-zoom* tool (magnifying glass) from the plot tool bar. * Put mouse cursor inside the plot and use the mouse wheel to Zoom in and out of the graph. * Wait a couple of minutes.
TestStep.Result: The Live Zoom functionality becomes de-toggled. * The Click-drag-and-zoom tool is highlighted white. * Plot zooms in and out without auto-zooming as new data is processed. * The button loses its blue highlight and becomes clear * New data is still downloaded and is being processed so a blue badge appears on the *Live Zoom* button. * A tool-tip is there on the button as well. * Re-zooming will no longer happen as new data is processed. See Screenshot.

TestStep.Action: *Double click* inside the plot.
TestStep.Result: * The Live Zoom button re-enables and is blue. * Plot re-zooms to show all available data. * The plot will auto-zoom anytime new data in processed. See Screenshot.

TestStep.Action: Click the Plot Settings tool (chart Icon) on the plot toolbar. * Modify the X and Y Min/Max values of the plot. * Wait a couple of minutes.
TestStep.Result: The Live Zoom functionality becomes de-toggled. * The button loses its blue highlight and becomes clear. * Plot X and Y dimensions change depending on the values that were input. * New data is still downloaded and is being processed so a blue badge appears on the *Live Zoom* button. * A tool-tip is there on the button as well. * Re-zooming will no longer happen as new data is processed See Screenshot

TestStep.Action: Click the Reset Plot button (the two arrows in the plot toolbar). Wait a couple of minutes.
TestStep.Result: * The Live Zoom button re-enables and is blue. * Plot re-zooms to show all available data. * The plot will auto-zoom anytime new data in processed. * There is no badge or tooltip on the *Live Zoom* button. * Plot resets back to default values before Min/Max values were changed See Screenshot.

TestStep.Action: Click the *"Live Zoom"* button. Wait a couple of minutes.
TestStep.Result: The Live Zoom functionality becomes de-toggled. * The button loses its blue highlight and becomes clear * New data is still downloaded and is being processed so a blue badge appears on the *Live Zoom* button. * There is no tooltip on the button either. * Re-zooming will no longer happen as new data is processed.

TestStep.Action: Click the Experiment Setup module button to navigate to the Experiment Setup Menu. End the experiment * Tools-> Reset Plate
TestStep.Result: Done. The current experiment ends & becomes an offline experiment while a new experiment is set as the Active Experiment. The ended experiment's Last Sample Time: will be populated with a time showing when the experiment got its last sample in the format of MM/DD/YYYY HH:mm AM/PM

TestStep.Action: Click the Door of the Maestro Icon or Press the physical button on the machine and *Eject* the plate.
TestStep.Result: Done. Plate is no longer inside the maestro. The new Experiment is gone and the ended offline experiment is the currently selected one.

TestStep.Action: Click on the Analysis Module button to navigate to the Analysis plot.
TestStep.Result: Done. The Live Zoom button is no longer visible. * No badge remains on the Analysis Configuration button. See screenshot.

TestStep.Action: Hover over the maximum asymptote line at the top of the panel → Grab the line and move it down then release the mouse button

Test.JiraSummary: AxisZ Firmware Flashing - Automated

TestStep.Action: Reset AxisZ with no device connected.
TestStep.Result: AxisZ opens.

TestStep.Action: Click on *Help* menu item.
TestStep.Result: There is no *Restore Firmware* option.

TestStep.Action: Connect a Maestro Z.
TestStep.Result: Maestro Z is detected by AxisZ.

TestStep.Action: Click on *Help* menu item.
TestStep.Result: *Restore Firmware* option is now available.

TestStep.Action: Disconnect the Maestro Z.
TestStep.Result: The *Restore Firmware* option disappears. AxisZ shows "No Maestro Connected".

TestStep.Action: Reconnect the Maestro Z. Once the Maestro Z is detected, click on *Help -> Restore Firmware*.
TestStep.Result: "Update Firmware Confirmation" pop-up appears. Only the Maestro Z device is listed.

TestStep.Action: _Uncheck_ the box to "Update the firmware on the Maestro Z" if not already unchecked.
TestStep.Result: The *Proceed* button is _disabled_.

TestStep.Action: _Check_ the box to "Update the firmware on the Maestro Z" if not already unchecked.
TestStep.Result: The *Proceed* button is _enabled_.

TestStep.Action: Click the *Cancel* button.
TestStep.Result: "Update Firmware Confirmation" pop-up disappears.

TestStep.Action: Click on *Help -> Restore Firmware*.
TestStep.Result: "Update Firmware Confirmation" pop-up appears.

TestStep.Action: Make sure that "Update the firmware on the Maestro Z" is checked and click *Proceed*.
TestStep.Result: The AxisZ window disappears. "Updating Firmware" pop-up appears with no interactable controls and only showing two progress bars and text. (See screenshot) Once the firmware process completes successfully the Maestro Z will restart. A "Firmware updated successfully" pop-up appears replacing the updating pop-up. (See screenshot)

TestStep.Action: Verify there is no process to cancel the the firmware upgrade process. (No cancel button)
TestStep.Result: Done. If the process is canceled (*or failed*), the page will change to a text display indicating such, and prompting you to close the window.

TestStep.Action: Click the *Close* button on successful operation. _Note: No matter the result, succeed, fail or aborted, a *Close* button will appear._
TestStep.Result: The pop-up closes. The main window will reappear. The device will reboot and get detected by AxisZ.

TestStep.Action: Click "Impedance" on the analysis configuration menu Increase the display interval to 15 minutes

TestStep.Action: Change the display interval back to 1 minute

Test.JiraSummary: Axis Z dataset should be updated from the Maestro as expected after plate eject and reinsert - Automated

TestStep.Action: Open AxiS Z → Open Debug Console _(Ctrl+Alt+D)_ → Enter {{cmdspock fakenextscan 2112345678}}
Eject Plate
TestStep.Result: Plate ejected

TestStep.Action: Load Plate
TestStep.Result: Plate loaded and active Experiment is available to be worked with

TestStep.Action: Click _Measure Baseline_ for an Active Experiment and wait until Baseline will be completed
TestStep.Result: Banner message "Baseline completed. Please add cells." is displayed.

TestStep.Action: Navigate to Plate Map Setup → Click on New Group → Fill Treatment and Amount → Click Add
TestStep.Result: New Well Group is created

TestStep.Action: Select the desired wells for assignment in the plate map → Click on any of the Distribution Arrows to assign
TestStep.Result: Changes are applied to the wells selected for the Well Group

TestStep.Action: Navigate to Analysis Panel
TestStep.Result: Live Zoom is selected and the plot is being updated to display the default axes limits each time a new impedance sample is received

TestStep.Action: Eject the plate
TestStep.Result: Plate ejected

TestStep.Action: Open Debug Console _(Ctrl+Alt+D) →_ Enter {{cmdspock fakenextscan 2112345678}}
Load Plate
TestStep.Result: Plate loaded

TestStep.Action: Navigate to Analysis Panel → Verify that data is getting updated from the Maestro
TestStep.Result: Live Zoom is selected and new samples are being picked up on the Analysis plot

Test.JiraSummary: Test Display TrayZ Device Info in About Window

TestStep.Action: Once Axis Z is connected to the tray, view the Help -> About window. .
TestStep.Result: It should have content appropriate to the attached Tray Format for the Tray Device id is: xxxxxxx.xx.xxxxx as in1006566.01.00001 Format for the Bridge SN is: xxxxxxx.xx.xxxxx as in 1006571.01.00001 Sample from 3.8.2.3 Note, tray id and bridge sn are missing. Replace this image with a final version when available. !xray-attachment://65f181b5-f2a2-44b5-96d2-303b8eb22cb4|width=434,height=471!

Test.JiraSummary: Lab Notebook Export functionality should be available even when all Dose Response panel groups are hidden

TestStep.Action: Navigate to Analysis Panel → Hide _A549 + Pan T_ and _SKOV-3 + Pan T_ well groups
TestStep.Result: _A549 + Pan T_ and _SKOV-3 + Pan T_ well groups are hidden !xray-attachment://04ee334a-0c1e-45ba-810d-c890b8fd7f70|width=1791,height=1073!

TestStep.Action: Click File → Export Lab Notebook… → Save
TestStep.Result: * Lab Notebook is exported, destination folder is opened * No any errors are displayed

Test.JiraSummary: Can make multiple calls to Navigator API without errors

TestStep.Action: Install the version of Navigator to be tested.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Click on Tools → Enable Remote Control.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Download and unzip the version of Axion.RemoteControl-x.x.x.x.zip to be tested.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Install and open LINQPad. ([https://www.linqpad.net/Download.aspx|https://www.linqpad.net/Download.aspx] )
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Download and open attached query file: NAV-9669.linq.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Make sure the unzipped Axion.Files and Axion.RemoteControl.dll assemblies are referenced in LINQPad. (Query -> References and Properties). If not, add them.
TestStep.Result: Done.

TestStep.Action: Click the play button to execute the script.
TestStep.Result: # No errors in LINQPad. # AxIS Navigator toast message appears stating "AxIS is sharing control with a remote application. Last command received dd/mm/yyyy hh:mm:aa AM/PM" # View attached images for results.

Test.JiraSummary: 'Locate' button for TrayZ Devices is hidden

TestStep.Action: Open device settings (Gear button)
TestStep.Result: The 'Locate' button doesn't exist.

Test.JiraSummary: Tray Z name change should be reflected in Support Bundle

TestStep.Action: Click Device Settings (gear icon) → Navigate to Device Info tab
TestStep.Result: Maestro Name is displayed there !xray-attachment://c9373f9d-82f0-4f0d-8d33-f36ec1a5d545|width=529,height=183!

TestStep.Action: Change Maestro Name to "Tray-001 - \! Apple"
TestStep.Result: Maestro Name is changed !xray-attachment://8c59439a-932d-4697-a8d8-7f28472f9513|width=659,height=875!

TestStep.Action: Click Help → Create Support Bundle
TestStep.Result: Changed name of Tray Z device should be displayed in the Help > Create Support bundle menu item !xray-attachment://ffb32347-54c2-4b6f-b85b-2233b6eae8d6|width=746,height=477!

TestStep.Action: Select connected Tray Z → Wait until Support bundle will be created → Click Open Explorer button
TestStep.Result: Support bundle achieve name should contain TrayZ name "Tray-001---\!-Apple" in the zip file !xray-attachment://9b304d87-035b-453e-86ec-6ef5232867cc|width=430,height=37!

TestStep.Action: Open Support Bundle achieve
TestStep.Result: For the bundle device folder, we replace spaces with underscores: TrayZ_(Tray-001_-_\!_Apple) !xray-attachment://87c54178-db09-4a35-8a6a-f8110928e9ca|width=270,height=34!

TestStep.Action: Open {{SupportReport.Log}}
TestStep.Result: Maestro Custom Name: Tray-001 - \! Apple !xray-attachment://abc2c230-8842-4b78-9a07-2aeee6ab5494|width=586,height=307!

TestStep.Action: Return to AxIS Z and change Maestro Name to the initial one
TestStep.Result: Initial name is set

Test.JiraSummary: Changed Tray Z Name should be reflected in Lab Notebook

TestStep.Action: Click Device Settings (gear icon) → Navigate to Device Info tab
TestStep.Result: Maestro Name is displayed there !xray-attachment://47f156aa-c49c-4941-b190-e2336088bd4f|width=66.66666666666666%!

TestStep.Action: Change Maestro Name to "Orange"
TestStep.Result: Maestro Name is changed

TestStep.Action: Select Front Right basin → Click Measure baseline !xray-attachment://26798a52-4476-4fa9-a645-f88bb7a47205|width=50%!
TestStep.Result: Baseline started, banner message is displayed for the chosen plate !xray-attachment://b3b2a5da-b58b-4d47-87b0-84a68b62eb07|width=2117,height=1140!

TestStep.Action: Wait until baseline will be completed and Last Sample Time will be fulfilled
TestStep.Result: Baseline completed !xray-attachment://1c60424b-4d5b-4b8d-bb37-cf2a479598f7|width=1598,height=117! Last Sample Time is filled with an appropriate date !xray-attachment://1c7ba188-ce4d-4198-8319-73d62a337dcd|width=538,height=75!

TestStep.Action: Click File -> Export Lab Notebook… → Save
TestStep.Result: Lab Notebook is exported Destination folder is opened

TestStep.Action: Open Lab Notebook file → Verify TrayZ Device Name
TestStep.Result: TrayZ Device Name is not empty TrayZ Device Name if filled with the changed Maestro Name

TestStep.Action: Return to AxIS Z and change Maestro Name to the initial one
TestStep.Result: Initial name is set
